yo: Mo pàdé alàgbà ìnàkí yìí nílé ìtura Japaní kan nínú ilé-ìwẹ̀ onísun
en: I met this old man in a Japanese hotel in a sauna

yo: Ilé ìtura náà ti gbó, tàbí ká ní ó ti ń di àlàpà.
en: The hotel is old, or should we say it is getting dirty.

yo: Kò fẹ́ẹ̀ lè dá dúró, mo kàn ní kí n sun run alẹ́ kan níbẹ̀ ni.
en: He didn't want to stop, I just asked him to spend a night there.

yo: Mo ń rìnrìn àjò káàkiri ni, lọ síbikíbi tí ẹ̀mí bá daríì mi sí.
en: I travel around, go wherever the spirit leads me.

yo: Ìgbà ẹ̀ẹ̀rùn ti fẹ́ parí, oòrùn ti wọ̀ tipẹ́
en: Summer is about to end, the sun has already set

yo: Ìjì olótùútù tó jánilárajẹ kan fẹ́ sísàlẹ̀ láti orí òkè wá
en: A painful cold storm is about to come down from the mountain

yo: Ó ń darí àwọn ìràwé tó dàbíi ẹ̀ṣẹ́ ọwọ́ sílẹ̀, sójú ọ̀nà.
en: He directs the sins of the hands down, to the way.

yo: Mo rìn kọjá láàárin gbùngbùn ìlú onísun gbígbóná
en: I walked through the center of the hot city

yo: Kò sí ìkankan nínú u àwọn ilé ìtura níbẹ̀ tó fẹ́ gbàlejò lẹ́yìn oúnjẹ alẹ́
en: None of the hotels there wanted to stay after dinner

yo: Mo yà ní ibi márùún tàbí mẹ́fà ṣùgbọ́n gbogbo wọn ló já mi kulẹ̀
en: I tried five or six places but they all failed me

yo: Mo ṣàbápàdé e ilé ìtura kan tó gbà mí, tí kò sì ní gbowó oúnjẹ alẹ́
en: I met him at a hotel that accepted me and would not pay for dinner

yo: Ilẹ́ ìtura náà dàbí ibi tí a kọ̀ sílẹ̀, ibi jákujàku kan.
en: The park looks like an abandoned, abandoned place.

yo: Ilé náà ti fojúrí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún sẹ́yìn lọ.
en: The building has been neglected for many years.

yo: Kò ní irú ọ̀yàyà tí èèyàn máa ń retí lọ́wọ́ ibùgbé àtijọ́ bíi tiẹ̀
en: It doesn't have the kind of warmth one would expect from an old home like that

yo: Àwọn nǹkan ọ̀ṣọ́ ara ilé ò farajọra, wọ́n sì tún wọ́ sẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́
en: The household items are not the same, and they are also worn side by side

yo: Kò dá mi lójú pé ó le yèbọ́ lọ́wọ́ ọ ìmìtìtì tó bá tún ṣẹ̀lẹ̀
en: I am not sure that he can survive the earthquake if it happens again

yo: Wọn kò fún wa lóńjẹ alẹ́, ṣùgbọ́n oúnjẹ àárọ̀ wà níbẹ̀.
en: They didn't give us dinner, but there was breakfast.

yo: Lẹ́nu ọ̀nà ni tàbìlì ìgbàlejò kan, tí ọkùnrin arúgbó apárí kan wà lẹ́yìn ẹ.
en: On the way is a reception desk, with an elderly man behind it.

yo: Àìnírun ìpéǹpéjú yìí jẹ́ kójú u arúgbókùnrin yìí dàbí èyí tó mọ́lẹ́ ní gbàgede lọ́nà àràmọ̀ndà.
en: This lack of eyelid hair made this old man's face look like the one that shines in the street in a magical way.

yo: Ológbó ńlá dúdú kan, tóun náà darúgbó, wà níjokòó lóríi fùkùfùkù kan lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́.
en: A big black old man, who was also old, was sitting on a stump nearby.

yo: Ó ní láti jẹ́ pé nǹkankan ṣeé nímú, torí pé ó ń hanrun pẹ̀lú ariwo ju ti ológbò lọ.
en: It must be something that can be caught, because it purrs louder than a cat.

yo: Lẹ́ẹ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan, ìmísókè-mísódò ẹ̀ á dákẹ́ iṣẹ́ díẹ̀.
en: Once in a while, your upgrade will slow down the process a bit.

yo: Gbogbo nǹkan tó wà nínú ilé ìtura yìí dàbíi oun tó ti dàgbá, dògbó,
en: Everything in this hotel looks like it has been washed, washed,

yo: Yàrá tí wọ́n fi mí sí kéré, ó dàbíi yàrá ẹrù tí wọ́n máa ń kó aṣọ ìbora ibùsùn sí.
en: The room they put me in was small, it was like a storage room where they used to store bed sheets.

yo: Igi ìtẹ́lẹ̀ abẹ́ ẹní ń dún bíi pó fẹ́ wó pẹ̀lú ìgbésẹ́ kọ̀ọ̀kan.
en: The wood beneath one's feet sounded like it was about to crumble with each step.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ó ti pẹ́ jù báyìí láti kọbiara sí èyí.
en: But it is too late now to ignore this.

yo: Mo sọ fúnra à mi pé ó yẹ kínú ù mi dùn pé mo tilẹ̀ rí òrùlé sórí mi àti ibùsùn láti sùn lé.
en: I told myself that I should be happy that I even found a roof over me and a bed to sleep on.

yo: Mo gbé àpò èjìká mi, ẹrù kan ṣoṣo tí mo ní, sílẹ̀.
en: I put down my shoulder bag, the only thing I had.

yo: Mo lọ sínú u ìṣọ àmàlà kan nítòsí mo sì jẹun alẹ́ kékeré.
en: I went into a nearby restaurant and had a small dinner.

yo: Kò sí irú oúnjẹ alẹ́ mìíràn ní ṣíṣí, nítorí náà, èyí nìkan ni tàbí kí n pebi sùn.
en: There was no other kind of dinner open, so this was the only one or I had to sleep.

yo: Mo mu bíà, ìpápápánu díẹ̀, àti ẹ̀bà gbígbóná pẹ̀lú u gbẹ̀gìrì.
en: I drank beer, some snacks, and hot coffee with him.

yo: Nígbà tí mo kúrò nísọ̀ ọ sọ́ọ̀bù, mo rò pé kí n ra ìpanu diẹ̀ àti ìgò ẹmu ù kan
en: When I left the supermarket, I thought I'd buy some snacks and a bottle of wine.

yo: Èyí jẹ́ lẹ́yìn-in aago mẹ́jọ, nítorínáà àwọn bíi ìṣọ̀ kékèké ti ṣe tán
en: This is after eight o'clock, so the little guards are done.

yo: Mo sáré padà sínú ilé ìtura, mo yí aṣọ ọ̀ mi padà, mo sì lọ sísàlẹ̀ láti lọ wẹ̀.
en: I ran back into the hotel, changed my clothes, and went downstairs to take a shower.

yo: Mo kíyèsí jákujàku ilé náà àti àwọn nǹkan inú u rẹ̀
en: I looked closely at the house and its contents

yo: Omi ìwẹ̀ gbígbóná náà jẹ́ àwọ̀ ewé tó nípọn
en: The hot bath water was a thick green

yo: Mo ti farabalẹ̀ gbádùn-un ìwẹ̀ mi ní púpọ̀ ìbàlẹ̀ọkàn
en: I have thoroughly enjoyed my bath with great care

yo: Nígbà tó ṣe díẹ̀, orí mi ń fúyẹ́ díẹ̀, mo sì jáde láti lọ gbatẹ́gùn níta.
en: When he did a little, my head was a little lighter, and I went out to go outside.

yo: Ìgbà tó yá, mo padà sínúu balùwẹ̀.
en: After a while, I went back into the bathroom.

yo: Mo wà nínu omi ìwẹ̀ ní balùwẹ̀ fún ìgbà ìkẹta nígbà tí ìnàkí yìí sílẹ̀kùn.
en: I was in the shower in the bathroom for the third time when the door opened.

yo: “Ẹ má bìnú o,” ó sọ lóhùn ilẹ̀pẹ̀pẹ̀.
en: "Don't be angry," he said flatly.

yo: Ó gbà mí lásìkò díẹ̀ láti ríi pé ìnàkí ni.
en: It took me a while to realize that it was a joke.

yo: Gbogbo omi gbígbóná yẹn ti mú ojú ù mi pòòyì
en: All that hot water has made my eyes watery

yo: Ọpọlọ mi fọ́nká bí mo ṣe ń ranjú láti inú híhó omi ìwẹ̀.
en: My brain went blank as I stared out of the shower.

yo: Ó tún àwọn garawa kékeré tó wà káàkiri nílẹ̀ tò.
en: He rearranged the small buckets around the ground.

yo: Ó fi tẹ̀mómítà kan sínú omi ìwẹ̀ láti wo bó ṣe gbóná tó.
en: He put a thermometer in the bath water to see how hot it was.

yo: Kò dàbíi pé ara à mi ló ti jáde wá
en: It's not like I came out myself

yo: Kíni ìnàkí ń ṣe níbi? Kílósìdé tó fi ń sọ èdè èèyàn?
en: What is he doing there? Why does he speak human language?

yo: “Ṣé kí n báa yín yún ẹ̀yìn-in yín?” Ìnàkí náà bèèrè
en: "Should I rub your back with you?" asked the hyena

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n kò sí nǹkankan tó ṣe kàyéfì nípa ohùn-un rẹ̀
en: But there was nothing surprising about his voice

yo: Tí o bá dijú tí o sì tẹ́tí, wàá rò pé ènìyàn lásán kan ló ń sọ̀rọ̀ ni.
en: If you are serious and listen, you will think that it is an ordinary person who is talking.

yo: Kìí ṣáà ṣe pé mo jókòó níbẹ̀ pẹ̀lú èrò pé ẹnìkan á wá bá mi yún ẹ̀yìn mi.
en: It is not that I sit there with the thought that someone will come and rub my back.

yo: Sùgbọ́n mo bẹ̀rù pé tí mo bá kọ̀ọ́, ó le rò pé mo lòdì sí òhun ni
en: But I'm afraid that if I learn, he might think I'm against something

yo: Mo dìde ní pẹ̀lẹ́kùtù kúrò nínú u balùwẹ̀, mo gbé ara à mi sílẹ̀ lórí i pákó kékeré
en: I got up slowly from the bathroom, I put myself down on the small board

yo: Ṣèbí bó ṣe máa ń rí fún ìnàkí nìyí, nítorínáà, eléyìí kò yà mí lẹ́nu.
en: This is how it usually is for people, so this does not surprise me.

yo: Ó mú aṣọ ìnura kékeré kan wá, ó fi ọṣẹ síi, ó sì bá mi fọ ara mi pẹ̀lú ọwọ́ tó mọ́ṣẹ.
en: He brought a small towel, put soap on it, and washed my body with clean hands.

yo: Òtútù ti ń mú lẹ́nu ọjọ́ mẹ́ta yìí, àbí bẹ́ẹ̀ kọ́,” ìnàkí yìí sọ síta.
en: It's been cold these three days, hasn't it," said the old man.

yo: Wọ́n á wá láti fi ọkọ́ gbá yìnyín láti orí àwọn òrùlé.
en: They will come to shovel snow from the roofs.

yo: Ìdákẹ́jẹ́ díẹ wà, ni mo bá wọlé. “Ìyẹn ni wípé ẹ lè sọ èdè ènìyàn?”
en: There was a little silence, when I entered. "Does that mean you can speak human language?"

yo: Ó ní láti jẹ́ pé wọ́n máa ń bèèrè e èyí lọ́wọ́ ẹ̀ lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìgbà.
en: It must be that they ask you this many times.

yo: Ìtàkùrọ̀sọ wa dúró díẹ̀ báyìí. Ìnàkí náà tẹ̀síwájú láti jẹun
en: Our conversation stopped now. The antelope continued to eat

yo: Báwo ni èyí ṣe ṣẹlẹ̀? Ìnàkí nìyí nítorí ọlọ́run. Ọ̀bọ lásán-lásàn.
en: How did this happen? This is a joke for God's sake. Just a monkey.

yo: “A tiẹ̀ fẹ́ẹ̀ jẹ́ alábàágbélé nìyẹn,” ìnàkí náà sọ lóhùn ọ̀rẹ́.
en: "We want to be a host," said the friend.

yo: Nítorí èyí lèmi náà fi nífẹ̀ẹ́ àwọn orin yẹn.
en: That's why I love those songs.

yo: Mo máa ń gbọ́ọ ní gbogbo ìgbà nígbà tí mo bá wà ní kékeré.
en: I used to listen to it all the time when I was little.

yo: A lè wípé mo gba gbogbo oun tí ó ń sọ gbọ́ láì tiẹ̀ mọ̀.”
en: We can say that I believed everything he said without even realizing it."

yo: Bóyá nítorí ìyẹn ló ṣe kọ́ mi dáadáa ní gbogbo ìgbà tó bá ní àsìkò
en: Maybe that's why he taught me so well whenever he had time

yo: Ó jẹ́ onísùúrù, ènìyàn tó nífẹ̀ẹ́ ètò àti ọgbọgba lórí ohunkóhun.
en: He is patient, a person who loves planning and strategy over anything.

yo: Ìyàwó ẹ̀ jẹ ẹni tútù, dídùn, tó máa ń yọ́nú sí mi ní gbogbo ìgbà.
en: His wife is a sweet, sweet person who is always nice to me.

yo: Ìnàkí náà paríi fífọ ẹ̀yìn mi nígbà tó yá. “Ẹ kúu sùúrù,” ó sọ, ó sì tẹríba.
en: The snake then finished rubbing my back. "Be patient," he said, and bowed.

yo: Ojú àánú ni wọ́n ṣe fún mi láti máa ṣiṣẹ́ níbí.
en: It was a pity for me to work here.

yo: Àwọn ilé ìtura ńlá ńlá ojúlówó ò lè láíláí fún ìnàkí níṣẹ́.
en: The real big hotels can never employ the poor.

yo: Nítoríi pé mo jẹ́ ìnàkí, owó kékeré ni mo ń gbà.
en: Because I am a poor person, I earn little money.

yo: Wọn ò sì jẹ́ kí n ṣiṣẹ́ àfi níbi tí ẹnìkankan ò ti ní rí mi.
en: And they didn't let me work except where no one would see me.

yo: Màá bá àwọn ènìyàn tún balùwẹ̀ ẹ wọn ṣe, màá nulẹ̀
en: I will clean the bathroom with people, I will go down

yo: Nítorípé kò sí ẹni tí ìnàkí á gbé tíì fún tí kò ní yàá lẹ́nu, àti bẹ́ẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.
en: Because there is no one who will be served tea that will not be surprised, and so on.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n o, ẹẹ́ ti gba inú oríṣiríṣi nǹkan kọjá kẹ́ẹ tó tẹ̀dó síbí o?
en: But, have you been through many things before you settled here?

yo: Mo dúró díẹ̀, mo wá bèèrè lọ́wọ́ ẹ̀.
en: I waited a bit, then I asked him.

yo: Tí ó bá le jù, ǹjẹ́ ẹ lè sọ fún mi díẹ̀ nípa ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ yín?
en: If it is too difficult, can you tell me a little about your state?

yo: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni, kò sí ìyọnu. Ó lè má jọ yín lójú púpọ̀ tó bẹ́ẹ ṣe rò.
en: Yes, there is no harm. It may not seem like much to you.

yo: Inú mi á dùn tí ẹ bá lè mú ọtí i bíà díẹ̀ wá nígbà yẹn.
en: I would be happy if you could bring me some beer at that time.

yo: Ní gbogbo ayé mi, mi ò tíì ríi kí ìnàkí rẹ́rìín rí.
en: In all my life, I have never seen a donkey laugh.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n mo rò pé àwọn ìnàkí máa ń rẹ́rìín, tàbí sùnkún.
en: But I think that people laugh, or cry.

yo: Rárá, mi ò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ ní. Ṣùgbọ́n gbogbo èèyàn ló ń pè mí ní Ìnàkí
en: No, I didn't say that. But everyone calls me Inaki

yo: Ìnàkí náà ṣí ilẹ̀kùn onigíláàsì sí ibi balùwẹ̀, ó yípadà
en: The snake opened the glass door to the bathroom and turned around

yo: Irú àwọn oun tí a máa ń rí jẹ nílé ọtí.
en: The kind of people we see in pubs.

yo: Kò sí tábìlì kankan nínú yàrá yìí, nítorínáà a jókòó lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ara wa.
en: There was no table in this room, so we sat next to each other.

yo: Ká má parọ́, ó ṣe ni ní kàyéfì bí mo ṣe wà lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ìnàkí tí a jọ ń pín bíà mu.
en: Let's not lie, he wondered why I was next to the guy who shared a beer.

yo: Kò sí oun tó dáa tó kí èèyàn mu bíà lẹ́yìn iṣẹ́.
en: No one is good enough to drink beer after work.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n torí mo jẹ́ ìnàkí, àǹfàní láti mu bíà báyìí kìí sábà á yọjú rárá.
en: But because I'm a drunkard, the opportunity to drink beer doesn't come up very often.

yo: Yàrá kan wà, bíi àjà, níbi tí wọ́n máa ń jẹ́ kí n sùn sí.
en: There was a room, like the attic, where they used to let me sleep.

yo: Nítorí náà, ó nira púpọ̀ láti farabalẹ̀ sinmi níbẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n ìnàkí ni mí
en: Therefore, it was very difficult to relax there, but I was very tired

yo: Ìnàkí náà ti parí ife bíà àkọ́kọ́ ẹ̀, nítorínáà, mo bu èmíì fún-un.
en: The pig had finished his first cup of beer, so I gave him a breather.

yo: Àdúgbò o gúsù tó lókìkí fún pápá ìṣeré ni àwọn ìnàkí wà
en: The southern area is famous for its sports fields

yo: Mo kọ́kọ́ rò pé mo lè gbé lálàáfíà níbẹ̀ ni, ṣùgbọ́n bẹ́ẹ̀ kọ́ ló rí.
en: At first I thought that I could live in peace there, but that was not the case.

yo: Ẹ má ṣì mí gbọ́, ṣùgbọ́n nítorípé ilé ọmọ ènìyàn la ti wò mí dàgbà ni.
en: Don't misunderstand me, but it is because we have watched me grow up in a human house.

yo: Mi ò lè fi èrò mi hàn fún wọn dáadáa.
en: I can't express my thoughts to them properly.

yo: A ò jọra wa púpọ̀ rárá, ìjíròrò kò sì rọrùn.
en: We are not very similar at all, and conversation is not easy.

yo: Àwọn obìnrin ìnàkí máa ń rẹ́rìín tán bá wò mí.
en: The women always laugh when they look at me.

yo: Wọ́n rí bí mo ṣe ń hùwà gẹ́gẹ́ bí ohun tó ń panilẹ́rìín.
en: They saw how I behaved as something funny.

yo: Èyí mú kó le fún mi láti gbé pẹ̀lú u wọn, nítorínáà mo gbọ̀nà a tèmi lọ.
en: This made it difficult for me to live with them, so I sent mine away.

yo: Kò sẹ́ni tó dáàbò bò mí, mo ní láti wá oúnjẹ lọ fúnra à mi kí n lè ráyé gbé.
en: There is no one to protect me, I have to find food by myself in order to survive.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n èyí tó burú jù ni ti àìrẹ́ni bá sọ̀rọ̀pọ̀.
en: But the worst thing is if you don't want to talk.

yo: Mi ò lè bá àwọn ìnàkí sọ̀rọ̀, tàbí àwọn ènìyàn.
en: I can't talk to ants, or people.

yo: Dídánìkàngbé báyìí ló máa ń banilọ́kànjẹ́ gidi
en: Being a monk like this is really frustrating

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n èyí kò túmọ̀ sí pé mo lè bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìjíròrò pẹ̀lú ẹnikẹ́ni tí mo bá pàdé lójú lọ́nà.
en: But this does not mean that I can start a conversation with anyone I meet face to face.

yo: Tí mo bá ṣe eléyìí, gbogbo wàhálá ló máa dá sílẹ̀.
en: If I do this, all the problems will be created.

yo: Àtubọ̀tán ẹ̀ ni pé mo wá wà láàárin agbedeméjì, ìnàkí táa kọ̀sílẹ̀, àti ènìyàn.
en: The result is that I came to be in the middle, the abandoned man, and a man.

yo: Mo ṣọ́ ojú ẹ̀ wò, ṣùgbọ́n nítorípé ó ti pupa tẹ́lẹ̀, mi ò ríi pé ó tún ti pupa síi.
en: I looked at his eyes, but because they were already red, I didn't see that they were redder.

yo: Mo níran pé ìnàkí yìí ní ìjánu nínú u mímu ọtí ẹ̀.
en: I see that this bitch has a leash in her drinking.

yo: Àbí èèyàn kìí mọ̀ láti ojú u wọn tí wọ́n bá ti yó ni?
en: Don't people know from their eyes when they are drunk?

yo: Nǹkan mìíràn tó máa ń bà mí nínú jẹ́ ni ìbálòpọ̀ pẹ̀lú abo.
en: Another thing that makes me sad is sex with women.

yo: Ara mi kìí dìde rárá fún àwọn abo ìnàkí.
en: I don't stand up for women at all.

yo: Mo ní orísiríṣìí àǹfàní láti wà pẹ̀lú u wọn ṣùgbọ́n kò bá mi lára mu rárá.
en: I had various opportunities to be with them but it didn't suit me at all.

yo: Kí n tó bojú wòkè-wolẹ̀ mo ríi pé obìnrin ènìyàn nìkan ni mo lè nífẹ̀ẹ́.
en: Before I looked down I realized that I can only love a human woman.

yo: Mo dákẹ́ jẹ́, mo sì mu ìgò o bíà mi tán.
en: I kept quiet and finished my bottle of beer.

yo: Àwọn ohun yìí ló máa ṣẹlẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ tó máa kúrò nílé pátápátá,
en: These are the things that will happen on the day he leaves home for good,

yo: Ní gbogbo òrùlé e inú ìlú yìí, sánmọ̀ á sì wà ní mímọ́ àti búlù.
en: Every roof in this city will be clean and blue.

yo: Mo ṣí àpò ìpápánu yẹn, mo sì bùú sọ́wọ́.
en: I opened that snack bag and opened my hand.

yo: Ó dàbíi pé ìyẹn lè dá wàhálà púpọ̀ sílẹ̀ o.
en: It seems like that can cause a lot of trouble.

yo: Tórí pé mo jẹ́ ìnàkí, kò sí bí mo ṣe le rò pé kí abo ènìyàn máa kọbiara sí ìfẹ́ mi.
en: Because I am a virgin, there is no way I can think that a woman will ignore my love.

yo: Mo dúró dèé láti sọ̀rọ̀ síi. Ìnàkí náà fọwọ́ pa etí ẹ̀, ó sì ń tẹ̀síwájú.
en: I waited to speak more. The boar touched his ear and kept going.

yo: Nítoríi gbogbo èyí, mo ní láti wá ọ̀nà mìíràn láti gbé gbogbo ìfẹ́ inú mi yìí jáde.
en: Because of all this, I had to find another way to express all my passion.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n mo bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní jí orúkọ àwọn obìnrin tí mo nífẹ̀ẹ́ ẹ wọn.
en: But I started to learn the names of the women I loved.

yo: Mi ò mọ ìdí ẹ̀ ṣùgbọ́n ó dàbíi pé ẹ̀bùn kan wà tí a bí mi mọ́ tí mo máa ń lò.
en: I don't know why but it seems like there is a gift I was born with that I use.

yo: Tó bá wù mí, mo lè jí orúkọ ènìyàn kan kí n múu di tèmi.
en: If I want, I can steal a person's name and make it my own.

yo: Atẹ́gùn àìmòye kọ lù mí lẹ́ẹ̀kansíi.
en: The air of ignorance hit me again.

yo: Ìgbà tẹ́ẹ sọ pé ẹ̀ ń jí orúkọ ènìyàn, ṣé ẹni yẹn á sọ orúkọ ẹ̀ nù pátápátá ni?
en: When you say that you are stealing a person's name, will that person completely remove your name?

yo: Rárá. Wọn ò ní sọ orúkọ wọn nù pátápátá.
en: Never. They will not lose their name completely.

yo: Oun tí mo máa ń jí ni díẹ̀ lára orúkọ wọn, ẹ̀ka kékeré.
en: The one I wake up with is some of their names, a small branch.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n nígbà tí mo bá ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀, orúkọ náà á di yẹpẹrẹ.
en: But when I do that, the name will become meaningless.

yo: Ó dàbíi tí sánmọ̀ bá dáàbò bo oòrùn, tí òjìjí rẹ lórí ilẹ̀ sì ṣàfẹ́ẹ̀rí díẹ̀ síi.
en: It's like when the sun is covered by a cloud, and your shadow on the ground is a little more desirable.

yo: Wọ́n a kàn níran pé nǹkankan ò rí tààrà bó ṣe yẹ kó rí ni.
en: They just say that something is not right as it should be.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n àwọn kan máa ń mọ̀ abí? Wípé wọ́n ti jí díẹ̀ lára orúkọ wọn?
en: But do some people know? That they have stolen some of their names?

yo: Nígbà mìíì, wọn á ríi pé àwọn ò lè rántí orúkọ wọn mọ́.
en: Later, they will find that they cannot remember their names.

yo: Wọn ò tilè ní mọ orúkọ wọn fún bó ṣe jẹ́.
en: They don't even know their names for what it is.

yo: Gbogbo èyí sì jẹ́ ìṣẹ́ mi, nítorípé èmi ni mo jí orúkọ wọn.
en: And all this is my pain, because I stole their names.

yo: Ìgbà míì ẹ̀rí ọkàn mi máa ń wúwo. Mo mọ̀ pé oun tí mo ṣe ò dáa.
en: Sometimes my conscience is heavy. I know that what I did was not good.

yo: Mo ká ọwọ́ mi gbera mo sì wo ìnàkí yìí.
en: I raised my hand and looked at this thing.

yo: Orúkọ àwọn obìnrin tí o fẹ́ràn tàbí tí o fẹ́ ní àjọṣepọ̀ nìkan ni o máa ń jí àbí?
en: Do you only steal the names of women you like or want to have a relationship with?

yo: Orúkọ èèyàn mélòó lo ti wá jí báyìí?
en: How many people's names have you come up with now?

yo: Méjẹ ni gbogbo ẹ̀. Mo ti jí orúkọ obìnrin abílékọ méje.
en: Eat all of them. I have stolen the names of seven schoolgirls.

yo: Tọọ̀, báwo lo ṣe máa ń jí àwọn orúkọ yìí? Mo bèèrè.
en: So, how do you come up with these names? I asked.

yo: Nípa agbára èrò ọkàn nìkan ni. Agbára ìtẹjúmọ́ ẹ̀mí tí kìí sọjú lásán.
en: Only by the power of the mind. The power of spiritual focus that is not just visible.

yo: Mo máa ń nílò nǹkan tí wọ́n bá kọ orúkọ ẹni yẹn sí lórí.
en: I always need something with that person's name written on it.

yo: Àwọn ohun ìdánimọ dára.
en: Identities are good.

yo: Mo ní láti gbá irú nǹkan báyìí mú.
en: I have to handle things like this.

yo: Ní ìgbà púpọ̀, mo máa ń jí wọn ni. Jíjí ní ọ̀nà kan ṣoṣo.
en: Most of the time, I used to steal them. Being in one way.

yo: Mo ní ọgbọ́n púpọ̀ láti yọ́ wọ inú u yàrá àwọn ènìyàn nígbà tí wọ́n bá jáde
en: I have a lot of wisdom to sneak into people's rooms when they go out

yo: Ẹ̀ẹ́ wá lo ohun yìí tó ní orúkọ obìnrin lórí ẹ̀, pẹ̀lú agbára ìtẹjúmọ́ ọ yín
en: Come and use this thing that has a woman's name on it, with the power of your concentration

yo: Màá tẹjúmọ́ orúkọ tí a kọ yìí fún ìgbà pípẹ́, màá fi gbogbo èrò ara à mi sórí ẹ̀,
en: I will stare at this written name for a long time, I will put all my thoughts on it,

yo: Màá gba gbogbo orúkọ ẹni tí mo fẹ́ràn sínú
en: I will include all the names of my loved ones

yo: Gbogbo ìfẹ́ àti èròǹgbà mi, ti kò rí ibi lọ kó tó di ìgbà yìí
en: All my love and ideas, which had never gone before this time

yo: Ìyẹn ni pé kò sí nǹkankan ìfarakanra à kankan níbẹ̀?
en: That is, there is no conflict there?

yo: Ìnàkí náà kan orí mọ́lẹ̀. Mo mọ̀ pé ìnàkí nìkan ni mí
en: The snake hit the ground. I know that I am alone

yo: Mo máa ń mú orúkọ obìnrin tí mo fẹ́ran di ti ara mi
en: I always take the name of the woman I love as my own

yo: Mo gbà pé ìwà èyí bàjẹ́ díẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n ó tún jẹ́ èyí tí ó mọ́ pẹ̀lú.
en: I agree that this behavior is a bit corrupt, but it is also a clean one.

yo: Bíi atẹ́gùn fẹ́rẹ́fẹ́ tó ń kọjá lóríi pápá.
en: Like the breeze that passes over the field.

yo: Bóyá a tiẹ̀ lè pe èyí ní irú ìfẹ́ ọkàn tó ga jù.
en: Perhaps we can even call this a higher kind of desire.

yo: Ó lè jẹ́ òhun ni ìfẹ́ ọkàn tó ga jù. Ṣùgbọ́n, ó tún jẹ́ àpẹẹrẹ àdánìkanwà tó le jù.
en: It may be what is the highest desire of the heart. But, it is also an example of extreme loneliness.

yo: Ọ̀nà méjì ọ̀tọ̀tọ̀ tí a sopọ̀ tí a kò lè pín níyà
en: Two different ways that are connected and cannot be separated

yo: Ìtàkùrọ̀sọ wa parí síbẹ̀ yẹn, èmi àti ìnàkí yìí ń mu bíà wa nínú ìdákẹ́jẹ́.
en: Our conversation ended there, me and this guy drinking our beer in silence.

yo: “Ǹjẹ́ ẹ ti jí orúkọ ẹnìkankan láìpẹ́ yìí?” Mo bèèrè.
en: "Have you stolen someone's name lately?" I asked.

yo: Ó gbá díè mú nínú àwọn irun tó dìde lápá ẹ̀, bíi pé ó fẹ́ ríi dájú pé ìnàkí lòun.
en: He grabbed some of the hairs that stood up on his arms, as if he wanted to make sure that he was safe.

yo: “Rárá, mi ò tíì jí orúkọ ẹnìkankan láìpẹ́ yìí.
en: "No, I have not stolen anyone's name recently.

yo: Nígbà tí mo wá sí ìlú yìí, mo pinnu láti dẹ́kun gbogbo irú ìwà pálapàla yẹn.
en: When I came to this city, I decided to stop all that kind of immorality.

yo: Mo dúró dèé láti sọ̀rọ̀ síi. Ìnàkí náà fọwọ́ pa etí ẹ̀, ó sì tẹ̀síwájú.
en: I waited to speak more. The boar touched his ear and continued.

yo: Nítoríi gbogbo èyí, mo ní láti wá ọ̀nà mìíràn láti gbé gbogbo ìfẹ́ inú mi yìí jáde.
en: Because of all this, I had to find another way to express all my passion.

yo: Ẹẹ̀ tiẹ̀ ni gbà mí gbọ́ rárá, ló yẹ kí n sọ. Ṣùgbọ́n mo bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní jí orúkọ àwọn obìnrin tí mo nífẹ̀ẹ́ wọn.
en: He even believed me at all, I should say. But I started stealing the names of the women I loved.

yo: Mi ò mọ ìdí ẹ̀ ṣùgbọ́n ó dàbíi pé ẹ̀bùn kan wà tí a bí mi mọ́ tí mo máa ń lò.
en: I don't know why but it seems like there is a gift I was born with that I use.

yo: Tó bá wù mí, mo lè jí orúkọ ẹnìkan kí n múu di tèmi.
en: If I want, I can steal someone's name and make it my own.

yo: Wọn ò ní sọ orúkọ wọn nù pátápátá.
en: They will not lose their name completely.

yo: Oun tí mo máa ń jí ni díẹ̀ lára orúkọ wọn, ẹ̀ka kékeré
en: The one I wake up with is some of their names, a small branch

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n nígbà tí mo bá ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀, orúkọ náà á di yẹpẹrẹ, á fúyẹ́ ju bó ṣe wà tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ.
en: But when I do that, the name will become shorter, lighter than it was before.

yo: Ó dàbíi tí sánmọ̀ bá dáàbò bo oòrùn, tí òjìjíi rẹ lórí ilẹ̀ sì ṣàfẹ́ẹ̀rí díẹ̀ síi.
en: It's like when the sun is covered by a cloud, and your shadow on the ground is a little more attractive.

yo: Ó sì tún yàtọ̀ sí irú ẹni tó bá jẹ́, wọ́n lè má mọ̀ pé wọ́n ní àdánù yìí.
en: And it is also different to the type of person he is, they may not know that they have this loss.

yo: Wọn a kàn níran pé nǹkankan ò rí tààrà bó ṣe yẹ kó rí ni.
en: They are just saying that something is not right as it should be.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n àwọn kan máa ń mọ̀ abí? Wípé wọ́n ti jí díẹ̀ lára orúkọ wọn?
en: But do some people know? That they have stolen some of their names?

yo: Nígbà míì, wọn á ríi pé àwọn ò lè rántí orúkọ wọn mọ́.
en: Sometimes, they will find that they cannot remember their names.

yo: Èyí á ni wọ́n lára, bí èyin náa ṣe mọ̀.
en: This will hurt them, as you know.

yo: Wọn ò tilè ní mọ orúkọ wọn fún bó ṣe jẹ́.
en: They don't even know their names for what it is.

yo: Nígbà mìíì, ìyà ìdánimọ̀ ara ẹ̀ni á jẹ wọ́n.
en: At other times, they will suffer from self-identity.

yo: Gbogbo èyí sì jẹ́ ìṣe è mi, nítorí èmi ni mo jí orúkọ wọn.
en: And all this is my doing, because I stole their name.

yo: Ìgbà míì ẹ̀rí ọkàn mi máa ń wúwo.
en: Sometimes my conscience is heavy.

yo: Èyí bà mí nínú jẹ́ gidi.
en: This really upset me.

yo: Mo mọ̀ pé oun tí mo ṣe ò dáa, ṣùgbọ́n mi ò lè dáa dúró.
en: I know what I did was wrong, but I couldn't stop.

yo: Kìí ṣe pé mo ń pọ́n oun tí mo ṣe lé, ṣùgbọ́n ara à mi máa ń yá gágá tí mo bá ń ṣẹé ni.
en: It's not that I'm slandering him, but my body is always in pain when I sneeze.

yo: Ìnàkí náà rẹ́rìín ìyàngì lẹ́ẹ̀kansíi, ó sì mi oríi rẹ̀ fẹ́rẹ́fẹ́ nígbà díẹ̀ síi.
en: The fox laughed again and shook his head a few more times.

yo: Ǹjẹ́ ọ̀nà tí mo fi sọọ́ ò ya ni lẹ́nu díẹ̀ bi?
en: Wasn't the way I said it a bit strange?

yo: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìnàkí ni mí, mi kìí ṣe ènìyàn.
en: Although I am a monster, I am not human.

yo: Aago mọ́kànlá ààbọ̀ ni a parí ìgò ńlá méjì ọtí i bíà wa.
en: At half past eleven we finished our two big bottles of beer.

yo: Ó yẹ kí n máa lọ ilé báyìí, ìnàkí náà sọ.
en: I should go home now, said the man.

yo: Àfi bí ẹni pé ọtí náà dùn mọ́ọ tó bẹ́ẹ̀ gẹ̀ẹ́ tí mo bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní janu bí ejò, ẹ má bìínú
en: Unless the beer tastes so good that I start biting like a snake, don't worry

yo: Rárá, mo gbádùn ìtàn yẹn gaan ni,
en: No, I really enjoyed that story.

yo: Àbí, pípín ọtí i bíà àti títàkùrọ̀sọ pẹ̀lú ìnàkí ṣáà jẹ́ oun méríìírí.
en: Or, sharing beer and chatting with strangers is still appreciated.

yo: Ó sì máa ń jí orúkọ àwọn obìnrin nítorípé ó fẹ́ bá wọn l’ájọṣepọ̀
en: And he steals women's names because he wants to have a relationship with them

yo: Ó jẹ́ oun tó yanilẹ́nu jù tí mo ti gbọ́ rí.
en: He is the most amazing I have ever heard.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n nítorípé mo fẹ́ gbé ọkàn ìnàkí yìí sókè ju bó ti yẹ lọ ni mo ṣe sọ̀rọ̀
en: But because I want to raise the heart of this fool more than it should be, I speak

yo: Bí a ṣe juwọ́ sí ara wa, mo fún ìnàkí yìí ní owó díẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ̀bùn
en: As we waved to each other, I gave this guy some money as a gift.

yo: Kò tó ǹkan ṣùgbọ́n jọ̀ọ́ fi ra nǹkan gidi fúnra à rẹ láti jẹ.
en: It's not enough but please buy the real thing yourself to eat.

yo: Lákọ̀ọ́kọ́, ìnàkí yìí kọ̀, ṣùgbọ́n mo yarí.
en: At first, this guy refused, but I was successful.

yo: Ó ká owó náà ó sì fi pẹ̀lẹ́kùtù fi sínú àpo asọ ẹ̀.
en: He took the money and carefully put it in his cloth bag.

yo: Ẹ ti gbọ́ ìtàn ayé mi bó ṣe yanilẹ́nu tó, ẹ fún mi lọ́tí mu, ẹ tún wá ṣe mí lóore tó tó báyìí.
en: You have heard the story of my life, how amazing it is, give me something to drink, and be kind to me again.

yo: Mi ò lè sọ tán bí mo ṣe moore yín tó.
en: I can't say enough how grateful I am to you.

yo: Ìnàkí bá fi àwọn òfìfo ìgò o bíà àti ife ìmutí sílẹ̀ lóríi pẹpẹ ìṣàlejò.
en: Inaka left empty beer bottles and drinking cups on the hospitality table.

yo: Lọ́jọ́ kejì, mo kó jáde nínú ilé ìtura náà, mo sì padà sí ìlú Adébọ̀
en: The next day, I checked out of the hotel and returned to Adébo

yo: Níbi ìsanwó, mi ò rí ọkùnrin arúgbó yẹn tí kò ní irun orí tàbí ìpéǹpéjú.
en: At the checkout, I did not see that old man without hair or eyelids.

yo: Mi ò sì rí ológbò arúgbó alárùn nímú yẹn
en: And I did not see an old sick cat in that nose

yo: Dípò ẹ̀, obìnrin abílékọ kan tó sanra tojú ẹ̀ kọ́rẹ́lọwọ́ ló wà níbẹ̀.
en: Instead of him, there was a fat uneducated woman who took care of him.

yo: Ó sọ pẹ̀lú ìgboyà pé kò sí èlé owó lóri oun tí mo ní láti san.
en: He boldly said that there is no interest on him that I have to pay.

yo: O tẹnu mọ́ọ pé gbogbo oun tí a ní níbi kò ju owó o bíà inú agolo kan lọ.
en: He emphasized that everything we have here is no more than a penny in a cup.

yo: Lẹ́ẹ̀kansíi, gbogbo ẹ̀ dàrú mọ́ mi lójú.
en: Again, you all confused me.

yo: Ó dàbíi wí pé oun tí mo mọ̀ àti oun mèremère ti ń dàpọ̀ mọ́ra wọn lójú u mi.
en: It's like saying that the one I know and the one I know are getting mixed up in my eyes.

yo: Mo fẹ́ bèèrè nípa ìnàkí yẹn lọwọ́ abílékọ obìnrin yìí.
en: I want to ask about that ailment from this lady teacher.

yo: Mo pinnu láti má ṣe bẹ̀ẹ́ nítorí ó ti rẹ̀ mí.
en: I decided not to do that because I was tired.

yo: Bóyá ìnàkí ò tiẹ̀ sí, bóyá mo kàn ṣìrànrán ẹ̀ ni
en: Maybe it's not even there, maybe I'm just wrong

yo: Tàbí nǹkan tí mo rí jẹ́ àlá lásán, tó gùn, tó ṣe méríìírí
en: Or what I saw was just a dream, a long one, a dream

yo: Ǹjẹ́ ẹ ò ní òṣìṣẹ́ kan tó jẹ́ ìnàkí àgbàlagbà tó ń fọhùn bí ènìyàn bi?
en: Don't you have an employee who is an old man who speaks like a human?

yo: Wọ́n tiẹ̀ tún lè rò pé mo ya wèrè ni.
en: They may even think that I am crazy.

yo: Àlàyé è mi tún ni pé ìnàkí yìí jẹ́ òṣìṣẹ́ ìkọ̀kọ̀ kan tí wọn ò forúkọ rẹ̀ sóríi ìwé
en: My explanation is that this person is a secret agent whose name is not on the book.

yo: Ilé ìtura náà ò sì lè dárúkọ ẹ̀ ní gbangba kí àwọn ilé iṣẹ́ ẹ agbowó-orí tàbí ilé iṣẹ́ ìlera má gbọ́ nípa ẹ̀.
en: And the hotel can't name it publicly so that the tax authorities or the health company don't hear about it.

yo: Nínú ọkọ̀-ojú-irin tí mo wọ̀ padà sílé, mo tún gbogbo ohun tí ìnàkí yìí sọ fún mi.
en: In the train that I boarded back home, I repeated everything that this man told me.

yo: Mo kọ gbogbo ohun tó ṣe pàtàkì níbẹ̀ sílẹ̀, bí mo ṣe rántí wọn tó
en: I wrote down all the important things there, as much as I remember them

yo: Mi ò mọ mélòó ni kí n gbàgbọ́ nínú àwọn ohun tó sọ fún mi nígbà tí à ń mu ọtí i bíà.
en: I don't know how much I should believe in the things he told me while we were drinking beer.

yo: Láti jí orúkọ àwọn obìnrin àti láti múu di tara ẹni?
en: To steal the name of women and to make it personal?

yo: Kò le láti ròó pé ó tún lè jẹ́ òpùrọ́ gidi.
en: It is not hard to think that he could also be a real liar.

yo: Nínú iṣẹ́ mi, mo ti fi ọ̀rọ̀ wá ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ènìyàn lẹ́nu wò.
en: In my work, I have interviewed many people.

yo: Mo si ti mọṣẹ́ dáadáa débi pé mo lè mọ ẹni tó tọ́ láti gbàgbọ́ àti ẹni tí kò tọ́.
en: And I have learned so well that I can know who is right to believe and who is wrong.

yo: Tí èèyàn kan bá ti sọ̀rọ̀ fún ìgbà díẹ̀, wàá ti rí àwọn nǹkankan kékèké gbámú
en: If a person has been talking for a while, you will have noticed small things

yo: Wàá sì ti mọ̀ bóyá wọ́n ṣeé gbàgbọ́ àbí bẹ́ẹ̀ kọ́
en: And we will know if they can be believed or not

yo: Bí mo ṣe wo ojú ẹ̀, àti bó ṣe ń sọ̀rọ̀, bó ṣe ń ronú nǹkan lẹ́ẹ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan.
en: The way I look at his face, and the way he talks, the way he thinks sometimes.

yo: Kò sí nǹkankan nípa ẹ̀ tó dàbí àhesọ tàbí ohun afipáṣe.
en: There is nothing about him that is like a rumor or a rumor.

yo: Ìrìn àjò àdánìkanrìn mí parí báyìí, mo wá padà si ìrìnkèrindò inúu ìlú.
en: My solitary journey is now over, I returned to the inner city.

yo: Láì tiẹ̀ sí iṣẹ́ mìíràn kankan láti ṣe mọ́, bí mo ṣe ń dàgbà síi ni ọwọ́ mi ń kún síi.
en: Without any other work to do, as I grew older my hands became fuller.

yo: Àsìkò sì dàbí ẹni tó ń sáré tete.
en: And time is like someone who runs early.

yo: Nígbẹ̀yìn mi ò sọ fún ẹnikẹ́ni nípa ìnàkí yìí
en: In the end I did not tell anyone about this tragedy

yo: Kí làǹfààní kikọ nǹkan nípa ẹ̀ nígbà tí kò s’ẹ́ni tó gbà mí gbọ́?
en: What's the point of writing about you when no one believes me?

yo: Àwọn èèyàn á kàn máa sọ pé mo ti ń sọ ìsọkúsọ ni.
en: People will just say that I have been talking nonsense.

yo: Ó jẹ́ oun kàyéfì láti kọ gẹ́gẹ bí oun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ ní tòótọ́, nítorípé kò sí bí mo ṣe lè rí ẹ̀rí hàn.
en: It is strange to write as it actually happened, because there is no way I can find proof.

yo: Kò sí ẹni tó máa gbàá gbọ́ àfi tí mo bá fi hàn wọ́n.
en: No one will believe unless I show them.

yo: Bí mo bá tiẹ̀ kọọ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìtàn àròsọ, kò ní lórí tàbí ìdí.
en: Even if I tell it like a myth, it has no head or reason.

yo: Kí n tiẹ̀ tó bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí kọ̀ọ́ ni mo ti rí ojú u olùtẹ̀wé mi nígbà tó bá kàá tán
en: Before I even started reading, I saw the look on my publisher's face when he finished reading.

yo: Kò yẹ kí n máa bèèrè yìí lọ́wọ́ ẹ nítorí pé ìwọ ni olùkọ̀wé, ṣùgbọ́n — kíni kókó ìtàn yìí gaan ni?
en: I shouldn't be asking you this because you are the author, but - what is the point of this story?

yo: Ẹ ṣá mọ̀ pé ó jẹ́ ìtàn ìnàkí kan tó ń sọ èdè ènìyàn nínú ìlú kékeré kan ní agbègbè e wa.
en: You should know that it is a story of a man who speaks the language of the people in a small town in our area.

yo: Ó máa ń fọ ẹ̀yìn àwọn àlejò nínú ilé ìwẹ̀ gbígbóná, ó sì máa ń gbádùn bíà tútù
en: He washes guests' backs in the hot tub and enjoys cold beer.

yo: Ó máa n nifẹ̀ẹ́ àwọn ọ̀dọ́mọbìnrin ènìyàn tó sì ma ń jí orúkọ wọn.
en: He loves human girls and steals their names.

yo: Bí àsìkò ṣe ń lọ sí, ìrántí i ìlúu onísun-gbígbóná yìí bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí parẹ́ lọ́kàn mi.
en: As time went on, the memory of this hot city began to fade from my mind.

yo: Bo tile wù kí ìrántí kan le lóòrìn tó, wọn kò lè sáré ju agbára àsìkò lọ.
en: No matter how strong a memory is, they cannot outrun the power of time.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ní báyìí, lẹ́yìn ọdún márùún, mo ti pinnu láti kọ́ nípa ẹ̀.
en: But now, after five years, I have decided to learn about it.

yo: Ìdí èyi ni ohùn kan tó ṣẹlẹ̀ láìpẹ́ yìí tó mú mi rántí.
en: This is why a voice that happened recently made me remember.

yo: Tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí kò bá tíì ṣẹlẹ̀ ni, m̀bá tí kọ ohun tí ẹ ń kà lọ́wọ́ yìí.
en: If this incident had not happened, I would not have written what you are reading now.

yo: Lọ́jọ́ kan, mo ní ìpàdé iṣẹ́ kan nínú yàrá ìgbàlejò ilé ìtura kan ní Alégóńgó
en: One day, I had a business meeting in the lobby of a hotel in Alégongo

yo: Ẹni tí mo pàdé jẹ́ olùdarí ìwé ìròyìn arìnrìnàjò kan.
en: The person I met was the editor of a travel magazine.

yo: Ó jẹ́ obìnrin tó rẹwà gidi, bí ọmọ ọgbọ̀n ọdún tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ, kò lára púpọ̀.
en: She is a very beautiful woman, about 30 years old or more, she doesn't hurt much.

yo: Ó ní irun gígùn, àwọ ara tó lẹ́wà, pẹ̀lú u ojú ńlá tó fanimọ́ra.
en: He has long hair, beautiful skin, and big, attractive eyes.

yo: Ó sì tún jẹ́ olùṣàkóso ìtẹ̀wé tó mọṣẹ́.
en: And he is also a skilled publisher.

yo: A ti ṣiṣẹ́ papọ̀ nígbà díẹ̀ rí, a sì mọwọ́ ara wa.
en: We have worked together a few times before and we know each other.

yo: Lẹ́yìn ìgbà tí a ti parí iṣẹ́ ẹ wa, a fẹ̀yìntì, a sì tàkùrọ̀sọ díẹ̀ tí a sì ń mu kọfí.
en: After we finished our work, we retired and talked a little while drinking coffee.

yo: Fóònù alágbèéká ẹ̀ dún, ó sì wò mí bí ẹni ń bẹ̀bẹ̀.
en: His cell phone rang, and he looked at me pleadingly.

yo: Mo ní mi ò bínú, pé kó gbé ìpè náà.
en: I said I am not angry, that he picked up the call.

yo: Ó dàbíi pé ìpè náà wà nípa ààyè tó gbà sílẹ̀ níbìkan
en: It seems that the call was about a place he saved somewhere

yo: Bóyá ní ilé oúnjẹ, tàbí ilé ìtura, tàbí ti ìrìnnà òfurufú
en: Maybe in a restaurant, or a hotel, or an airline

yo: Ó sọ̀rọ̀ fún ìgbà díẹ̀, ó sì ń wo ìwé pélébé abániṣẹ̀tò ẹ.
en: He spoke for a while, looking at his planner's notebook.

yo: Ó wá wò mí pẹ̀lú ojú ìpòrúurùu.
en: He looked at me with confused eyes.

yo: Ó sọ fún mi pẹ̀lú ohùn ìṣàlẹ̀, ó sì fi ọwọ́ bo ẹnu fóònù
en: He told me in a low voice and covered the phone with his hand

yo: Mo mọ̀ pé ìbéèrè yìí yanilẹ́nu o, ṣùgbọ́n kíni orúkọ ọ̀ mi?
en: I know this question is strange to you, but what is my name?

yo: Ó gbọ́, ó sì sọ èyí fún ẹni tó wà lódìkejì i fóònù yìí.
en: He heard and told this to the person on the other side of the phone.

yo: Ó parí ìpè yìí, ó sì tún tọrọ àforíjì lọ́wọ́ọ̀ mi.
en: He ended this call and again apologized to me.

yo: Má bìnú o. Mo kàn gbàgbé orúkọ mi lójijì ni. Ó ya èmi gaan lẹ́nu.
en: Don't be angry. I just suddenly forgot my name. It really surprised me.

yo: Ó ṣebí ẹni pé ó ń ronú nípa ẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n ó padà gbà pé bẹ́ẹ̀ni
en: He pretended to be thinking about her, but she said yes

yo: Ó ti máa ń ṣẹlẹ̀ púpọ̀ lẹ́nu ọjọ́ mẹ́ta yìí.
en: A lot has been happening in these three days.

yo: Mo kàn gbàgbé orúkọ ọ̀ mi; bíi pé iyè mi sọnù lójijì ni.
en: I just forgot my name; as if my life suddenly disappeared.

yo: Ṣé o máa ń gbàgbé àwọn nǹkan míì? Bíi kóo má le rántí ọjọ́ ìbí ẹ.
en: Do you forget other things? Like you can't remember your birthday.

yo: Mo mọ gbogbo ọjọ́ ìbí àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ̀ mi lórí.
en: I know all my friends' birthdays by heart.

yo: Mi ò tiẹ̀ tíì gbàgbé orúkọ ẹnìkankan rí lẹ́ẹ̀kanṣoṣo.
en: I have never once forgotten someone's name.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n síbẹ̀, ìgbà míì, mi ò kí ń rántí i orúkọ èmi gangan alára.
en: But still, sometimes, I can't remember my real name.

yo: Lẹ́yìn ìṣẹ́jú díẹ̀, iyè mi á sọ padà, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn ìṣẹ́jú kékeré tí mo fi ń rántí yẹn ló le jù.
en: After a few minutes, my life will be restored, but those small moments that I remember are the hardest.

yo: Ṣé o rò pé èyí túmọ̀ sí pé mo ti fẹ́ bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ṣarán ni?
en: Do you think this means I'm about to get sick?

yo: Ká sọ pé ti ètò ìlera ni, èmi ò mọ̀. Ṣùgbọ́n ìgbà wo ni ó bẹ̀rẹ̀?
en: Let's say it's about the health system, I don't know. But when did it start?

yo: Mo rò pé bí oṣù mẹ́tà sẹ́yìn ni.
en: I think it was about three months ago.

yo: Mo rántí pé ó jẹ́ ìgbà tí mo lọ gbádùn òdòdó o ṣẹrí níta
en: I remember that it was a time when I went to enjoy the cherry blossoms outside

yo: Mi ò bá rántí orúkọ mi mọ́. Èyí ni ìgbà àkọ́kọ́.
en: I don't remember my name anymore. This is the first time.

yo: Má bìnú tí ìbéèrè mi bá dàbí òdì ọ̀rọ̀ o, ṣùgbọ́n ǹjẹ́ o sọ nǹkankan nù lásìkò yẹn?
en: Don't be offended if my question seems silly, but did you throw anything away at that time?

yo: Iǹkan bíi káàdì ìdánimọ̀, bíi ìwé ìwakọ̀, ìwé ìdánimọ̀ ìrìnà òfurufú, tàbí káàdì i adójútòfò?”
en: Something like an identification card, like a driver's license, airline ticket, or passport?"

yo: Ó ṣu ẹnu ẹ̀, ó ronú fún ìgbà díẹ̀, ó sì fèsì.
en: He closed his mouth, thought for a while, and answered.

yo: Bí o ṣe dárúkọ ẹ̀ yìí ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ mú mi rántí pé mo sọ ìwé ìwakọ̀ mi nù nígbà yẹn.
en: The way you mentioned it just made me remember that I lost my driver's license that time.

yo: Àsìkò oúnjẹ ọ̀sán ni, mo dẹ̀ jókòó sí oríi pèpéle ìta gbangba, mo ń gbatẹ́gùn.
en: It was lunch time, I was sitting on the outdoor platform, I was walking.

yo: Mo gbé báàgì ìgbékọ́pá à mi sílẹ̀ lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ mi lórí pèpéle ọ̀hún.
en: I put my suitcase down next to me on the platform.

yo: Mo ń tún ìtọ́tè mi kùn pẹ̀lú dígí.
en: I repeat my direction with the mirror.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ìgbà tí mo máa wo ẹ̀gbẹ́ ẹ̀ mi, báàgì mi ti lọ.
en: But when I looked around, my bag was gone.

yo: Kò yé mi rárá. Kò tó ìṣẹ́jú àáyá kan tí mo fi gbójú kúrò níbi báàgì ọ̀hún
en: I have not the foggiest idea. It didn't last a second that I looked away from that bag

yo: Mi ò sì níran ẹnìkankan láyìíká, tàbí gbọ́ ìró ẹsẹ̀ kankan.
en: And I didn't see anyone around, or hear any footsteps.

yo: Mo wò yíká ibẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n èmi nìkan ni mo wà níbẹ̀.
en: I looked around, but I was the only one there.

yo: Ibẹ̀ jẹ́ pápá tó dákẹ́ jẹ́, ó sì dá mi lójú pé ẹnìkan wá síbẹ̀ láti jí báàgì mi lọ
en: It was a quiet place, and I was sure that someone had come there to steal my bag.

yo: Mo dúró dèé láti tẹ̀síwájú.
en: I waited to continue.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n eléyìí nìkan kọ́ ló ṣe kàyéfì o
en: But this was not the only thing that surprised him

yo: Mo gba ìpè kan láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn ọlọ́pàá wípé wọ́n rí báàgì alágbèéká à mi.
en: I got a call from the police saying they found my mobile bag.

yo: Ẹnìkan ti gbée kalẹ̀ síwájú àgọ́ ọlọ́pàá kan lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ pápá yẹn.
en: Someone has set up in front of a police station next to that field.

yo: Kò sí nǹkankan mìíràn tó sọnù níbẹ̀ o — gbogbo owó sì wà nínú ẹ̀
en: Nothing else is missing there — and all the money is in it

yo: Pẹ̀lú gbogbo káàdì ìyáwó mi, káàdì ìgbówórìn, àti fóònù àgbérìn
en: With all my credit cards, credit cards, and cell phones

yo: Gbogbo ẹ̀ wà níbẹ̀ láìfọwọ́kàn. Káàdì ìwakọ̀ mi nìkan ló sọnù.
en: They were all there untouched. I only lost my driver's license.

yo: Òhun nìkan ni oun tí wọ́n jímú nínú báàgì mi.
en: He was the only thing that was caught in my bag.

yo: Kò dàbí ohun tí ènìyàn lè gbàgbọ́, kódà ó ya ọlọ́pàá gan lẹ́nu.
en: It's not like what people can believe, even the police were surprised.

yo: Wọn kò mú owó, wọ́n mú káàdì ìwakọ̀, wọ́n sì gbé báàgì ọ̀hún sílẹ̀ níwájú àgọ́ ọlọ́pàá.
en: They did not take money, they took the driver's card and left the bag in front of the police station.

yo: Mo tún mí kanlẹ̀ jẹ́jẹ́, mi ò sọ nǹkankan.
en: I took a deep breath and said nothing.

yo: Ìparí oṣù kẹta nìyí. Lójú ẹsẹ̀, mo lọ sí ilé iṣẹ́ Ìrìnnà Ọkọ̀
en: This is the end of the third month. Immediately, I went to the Transport office

yo: Aláàfin Adéyẹmí ti wàjà lánàá.
en: Aláfin Adéyami came yesterday.

yo: Mo máa rin ìrìn àjò lọ sí ìlú Èkìtì ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀
en: I will travel to Ekiti next week

yo: Awọn ọmọ ilé ẹ̀kọ́ yó bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìdánwò wọn tó bá di inú oṣù kẹfà ọdún
en: Students will start their exams in the sixth month of the year

yo: Ní àdúgbò yìí, ilé àwọn yẹ́misí ọmọ bàba Gàní ló rẹwà jùlọ
en: In this area, Gani's father's house is the most beautiful

yo: Ìya Ìṣọ̀lá tún ti bí ìbejì lẹ́yìn ìbẹta tí wọ́n bí ní ọdún mẹ́jì sẹ́yìn
en: Osola's mother has given birth to twins after two years ago

yo: Àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù mìíràn tí máa ń ṣiṣẹ́ papọ̀ báyìí nílé
en: Other footballers who used to work together now at home

yo: Ìkòkò tó bá máa jata á gbọdọ̀ gbóná fẹlifẹli
en: The pot to be sold must be very hot

yo: Ikọ̀ mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́ta ni yóò kópa nínú eré ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù tí a wí yẹn.
en: 64 teams will participate in the said football tournament.

yo: Wọ́n ti buwọ́ lu àṣẹ ìjọba báyìí láti kópa nínú eré ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù.
en: They have now signed the government's order to participate in the football tournament.

yo: Èyí yóò wáyé ní pápá ìṣeré tìlú Èkó, bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ karùn-ún oṣù karùn-ún.
en: This will take place at the Ego stadium, starting on the fifth day of May.

yo: Ìdíje ọ̀hún ni ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù obìnrin ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ mẹ́jọ yóò kópa nínú ẹ̀ fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́.
en: In that competition, eight different female soccer players will participate in it for the first time.

yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí alága ìgbìmọ́ tó ń ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje ọ̀hún, ọgbẹ́ni Adékúnbi ṣe sọ.
en: According to the chairman of the committee that is promoting that competition, Mr. Adekunbi said.

yo: Ó ṣe é lálàyé pé, wọn yóò ri dájú láti mú àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù náà wálé láyọ̀.
en: He explained that, they will make sure to bring the players home happily.

yo: Àwọn tó bá fakọyọ nínú eré náà ni ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù yóò fún lówó.
en: The football ambassador will give money to those who excel in the game.

yo: Àṣekágbá ìdíje ẹ̀ka méjéèjì ló máa wáyé lọ́jọ́ ìtúnu ààwẹ̀
en: The finals of both divisions will be held on the day of breaking the fast.

yo: Àwọn ọkùnrin àti obìnrin yóò bá ara wọn ṣeré ní ilé-ìwé gíga fáfìti onímọ̀-ẹ̀rọ̀ Ìbàdàn
en: Men and women will play against each other at Ibadan engineering college

yo: Lọ́jọ́ kínní oṣù kẹsàn-án ọdún tí a wà yìí, nílùú Èkó, ni ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí máa wáyé.
en: This event will take place on the first day of September this year, in the city of Eko.

yo: Agbábọ́ọ̀lù tẹ́lẹ̀rí, tí ó jẹ́ àlejò pàtàkì lásìkò o ìfigagbága ìdíje ọ̀hún, ti kú.
en: The football player, who was the main guest during the competition, has died.

yo: Ò fikún-un pé, ìdíje ọ̀hún yóò ṣe ìrànwọ́ láti ṣàwárí àwọn ọ̀dọ́ tí ò lẹ́bùn eré bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá.
en: He added that, this competition will help to discover young people who are not talented in the game of football.

yo: Mo gbórìyìn púpọ̀ fún Àlùfáà wa fun akitiyan láti gbé ìdíje ọ̀hún lárugẹ lọ́dọọdún.
en: I highly commend our Priest for his efforts to promote this competition every year.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ langba tó gbé ẹnu lé ìpele kejì àṣekágbá náà.
en: The young dragons who put their mouths on the second stage of the competition.

yo: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù mìíràn kópa dáradára nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ipele kẹta
en: Another player played well in the third round

yo: Lẹ́yìn tó fàgbà han ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù kejì pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò mẹ́rin sóókan
en: After becoming the second goalie with four goals in a row

yo: Ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ náà ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbẹ́yìn.
en: The match finally happened.

yo: Gbogbo nǹkan tí mo bá sọ fún Ṣadé ló máa ń sọ fún ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀.
en: Everything I say to Şade, he tells his friend.

yo: Gbogbo ṣòkèṣodò yìí ni àwọn olóṣèlú ń bá ara wọn sọ.
en: Politicians talk to each other all this time.

yo: Níṣẹ̀ẹ́jú péréte tí ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀, a ti jẹ oúnjẹ wa tán.
en: At the very moment that the procession began, we had finished our meal.

yo: Ǹjẹ́ o ti rí aṣọ tí mo gbé sí inú u kọ́ḿbọ́ọ̀dù
en: Have you seen the clothes I put in the closet

yo: Àwọn tó fẹ́ ṣiṣẹ́ ò pọ̀ tó àwọn tó kàn fẹ́ máa gba owó ìjọba
en: Those who want to work are not as many as those who just want to receive government money

yo: Gbogbo nǹkan tí mo sọ fún àwọn ìyàwó mi ni wọ́n ti sọ fún Gómìnà
en: Everything I said to my wives, they have said to the Governor

yo: Àǹfàní púpọ̀ ló wà láti jẹ àgbàdo ní ìgbà òjò.
en: There are many opportunities to eat corn in the rainy season.

yo: Gúgúrú àti ẹ̀pà ni mo jẹ sù lọ́jọ́ àbámẹ́ta
en: I ate a lot of chickpeas and peanuts on the third day

yo: Ebi í sì tún pa mi síi, ni mo bá lọ sílé oúnjẹ
en: I was hungry again, so I went to the restaurant

yo: Ìyansẹ́lódì alẹ́ ọjọ́bọ ọ̀sẹ̀ tó kọjá ti wá sópin

yo: Ìbíkúnlé Amósùn ti fi ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú àkọ́kọ́ sílẹ̀
en: Ibigunle Amossun has left the first political party

yo: Lẹ́yìn ọjọ́ mẹ́wàá, àwọn ajínigbé ti dá Túndé Ọlọ́wọ̀ sílẹ̀
en: After 10 days, the kidnappers released Tunde Olowo

yo: Mínísítà fún epò rọ̀bì ní orílẹ̀ èdè yìí ti sọ pé òun kò parọ́ ìwé ẹ̀rí
en: The minister for rubber in this country has said that he did not lie on the certificate

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ yóò gba isẹ́ àwọn obìnrin ṣe láti ọ̀la lọ

yo: Ẹlẹ́wọ̀n mẹ́tàlá àti àwọn ọmọ wọn ló ti gba òmìnira
