yo: Ìtàn-an Fágúnwà máa ń dẹ́rùba àwọn ọmọ kékèké
en: The story of Fagungwa scares little children

yo: Mo ti sùn sí ibojì, aginjù, àti etí òkun.
en: I have slept in graves, deserts, and seashores.

yo: Ìrọ́ ní pé a ṣètò ẹ̀kọ́ òfẹ fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́gboyè
en: It is a lie that free education is organized for graduates

yo: Wàhálà àwọn òbí mi pọ̀ tó bẹ́ẹ̀ ti mo fi gbé àwọn méjì níyàwó
en: My parents' problems were so much that I married two of them

yo: Ẹ̀mí mẹ́rin péré ló sọnù sínú ìjámbá ọkọ̀ ní Bẹẹrẹ
en: Only four lives were lost in a car accident in Beret

yo: Gbogbo oun tí ẹ bá rí lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára kọ́ ló jẹ́ òótọ́
en: Everything you see on the internet is not true

yo: Igbésẹ̀ láti yọ orúkọ Omíṣore àti Ọbaníkòró ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ báyìí
en: The process to remove the names of Omishare and Obanikoro has now started

yo: Àwọn òbí ti ń kó ọmọ wọn kúrò ní ibi tí ìjàkadì ti ń ṣẹlẹ̀
en: Parents are taking their children away from the place where the fighting is happening

yo: Gómìnà Aḿbọ̀dé ìlú èkó ti gbà pé òún fìdí rẹmi
en: Governor Ambode of the city of Eko has admitted that he is a victim

yo: Ìkọlù oníyanu ló ṣẹlẹ̀ níbi tí àwọn agbébọn ti pa ènìyàn mẹ́tàlá
en: A shocking attack happened where the gunmen killed thirteen people

yo: Obìnrin mẹ́ta ló gbẹ́mìí mi nítorípé wọ́n fẹ́ ki ìdí àwọn tóbi síi
en: Three women killed me because they wanted their cause to be bigger

yo: Onímọ̀ ọrọ̀ ajé tó dáńtọ́ ni Olúmorótì jẹ́.
en: Olúmoróti is a good economist.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá fi tajútajú tú àwọn tó ń fẹ̀hónú hàn ká
en: The police brutally dispersed the protestors

yo: Ọlọ́pàá Ìpínlẹ̀ Òǹdó ti lu Egúngún mẹ́rin pa
en: Ondo State Police has killed four Egungu

yo: Ọ̀dọ́mọkùnrin mẹ́jọ ni yóò fojú ba Ilé Ẹjọ́ lọ́sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀.
en: Eight young men will face the Court next week.

yo: Tọkọtaya méjì àti ọmọ ìyá mẹ́rin ló bá ìjàmbá ọkọ̀ pàdé
en: Two couples and a mother of four met with a car accident

yo: Ojú kò tì mí láti gbàgbọ́ pé Bàbá mi ló jẹ Baálẹ̀ àdúgbò
en: I am not ashamed to believe that my Father is the Mayor of the community

yo: Oníkálukú ti fi èrò o wọn hàn lórí oun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ lóríi ẹ̀rọ ayélujára
en: Everyone has expressed their opinion on what happened on the Internet

yo: Ayẹyẹ ọdún Ọlọ́jọ́ á parí pẹ̀lú àyájọ́ òmìnira ilẹ̀ ẹ wa
en: The celebration of the New Year will end with the celebration of our country's independence

yo: Òmìnira tún ti fakọyọ lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n na ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù kejì
en: Ominira has also recovered after sending the second goalkeeper

yo: Bì àwọn kan se faramọ́ ìlànà ìdìbò náà ni àwọn mìíràn takòó
en: While some people agree with the election process, others oppose it

yo: Adébáyọ̀ Fálétí ló fakọyọ jù nínú ìdíje tó wáyé lọ́jọ́ náà
en: Adébayo Faléti was the most prominent in the competition that took place that day

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ òṣìṣẹ́ alábọ́dé ti so ìyanṣẹ́lódì i wọn rọ̀
en: The middle class union has suspended its mission

yo: Ọ̀ṣọba ló ké gbàjarì lórí ẹ̀rọ ayàwòrán tó ń fò lófúrufú
en: Osoba was the first to fly on a flying machine

yo: Àwọn olùdìbò tú jáde fún àtúndì ìbò ní Ifẹ̀
en: Voters turn out for re-election in Ifa

yo: Olè jíjà tó tìí lágbara jù ni mo fojúrí ní Ìkẹjà
en: The most powerful thief I saw in Ikeja

yo: Nǹkan púpọ̀ ló ń fa omíyale ní orílẹ̀-èdè e wa.
en: There are many things that cause confusion in our country.

yo: Ìjàmbá a bàálúù kan ṣẹlẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ àjọ̀dún òmìnira ilẹ̀ ẹ wa
en: A helicopter accident happened on the day of our country's independence

yo: Lọ́jọ́ tí wọn ń se iṣẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ni bàálúù méjì já.
en: On the day they were working, two helicopters broke.

yo: Ibì kan wà ní Bódìjà tí wọ́n ti máa ń jẹ àmàlá gbígbóná
en: There is a place in Bodija where they used to eat hot amla

yo: Mo lọ síbẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ mi mẹ́jọ, a sì yó bámúbámú
en: I went there with eight of my friends, and we got drunk together

yo: Nígbà tí à ń padà bọ̀, a pàdé àwọn agbófinró, wọ́n sì dá wa dúró
en: On our way back, we met the law enforcement officers and they stopped us

yo: Mi bèèrè pé kí ni mo ṣe tí wọ́n fi fẹ́ gba owó lọ́wọ́ mi.
en: I did not ask what I did that they want to take money from me.

yo: Wọ́n ní pé kò yẹ kí á wà níta lẹ́yìn aago mẹ́fà alẹ́
en: They said that we should not be outside after six o'clock at night

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ ọ wọn kò yé mi tààrà, kò sì yé àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ mi pẹ̀lú
en: I didn't understand their words directly, and neither did my friends

yo: A bá dìde, a sì sálọ kúrò lọ́dọ̀ ọ wọn.
en: We got up and ran away from them.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá yìí ń fi ìbọn lé wa káàkiri gbogbo Ìbàdàn
en: These policemen are shooting at us all over Ibadan

yo: Bá mi mú owó tí mo fún ẹ lánàá wá, mo fẹ́ lòó.
en: Bring the money I gave you yesterday, I want to use it.

yo: Ṣé kí n bèèrè ọ̀rọ̀ lọ́wọ́ ọba ni àbí kí n bi gómìnà
en: Should I ask the king or should I ask the governor

yo: Kọ́kọ́rọ́ ọlá mi kò sí lọ́wọ́ ẹnìkankan mọ́ báyìí
en: The key to my honor is no longer in anyone's hands

yo: Ètò kan wà lórí ẹ̀rọ amóhùnmáwòrán tí mo máa ń wò.
en: There was a program on the television that I used to watch.

yo: Wàhálà àìrówóná ló pọ̀ jù nílùú Ìbàdàn
en: There is a lot of unemployment in Ibadan

yo: Àìsàn ìtọ̀ ọ ṣúgà ló mú bàbá a wa kí ó tó kú.
en: My father was diagnosed with diabetes before he died.

yo: Mi ò lè sùn fún bí ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́fà kí ìyá mi tó dé
en: I could not sleep for about six weeks before my mother arrived

yo: Àwọn dókítà obìnrin méje ló fún mi lábẹ́rẹ́.
en: I was given seven female doctors under him.

yo: Ìlù u gángan ni wọ́n máa ń lù fún àwọn ọba.
en: It is the actual drum that they used to beat for the kings.

yo: Òògùn mẹ́ta ni mo lò kí ara mi tó yá.
en: I used three medicines before I got better.

yo: Bàtà mi ti ń dún ko ko kà nítorí pé mo mọ̀wé.
en: My shoes are ringing because I know how to read.

yo: Ẹni tó bá mọ̀wé ló máa ń níyì láwùjọ wa.
en: A literate person is respected in our society.

yo: Ìgbá orò kìí fọ́ ni àwọn àgbà máa ń sọ
en: The elders used to say that words never break

yo: Ọjọ́ burúkú ẹ̀ṣù gbomi mu ni ọjọ́ tí Aláàfin kú
en: The worst day for the devil to drink is the day Alafin died

yo: Tí mo bá tún sọ̀rọ̀, wọ́n á máa bínú
en: If I speak again, they will be angry

yo: Tí mi ò bá tún sọ̀rọ̀, wọ́n á ni mi ò dá wọn lóhùn.
en: If I do not speak again, they will say that I did not answer them.

yo: Mo sọ fún dókítà pé ara mi ti yá ju ti tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ
en: I told the doctor that I was better than before

yo: Àwọn ọmọ Yorùbá fẹ́ràn láti máa ṣe fàájì
en: Yoruba people love to have fun

yo: Tí ara ẹ ò bá yá, ó yẹ kí o lọ bá dókìtà sọ̀rọ̀.
en: If you do not feel better, you should go and talk to a doctor.

yo: Gba gbogbo ohun tí ó sọ gbọ́, òótọ́ ni.
en: Believe everything he says, it's true.

yo: Àlùfáà kan jádé síwájú ìjọ láti bá àwọn ọ̀dọ́ sọ̀rọ̀.
en: A priest came out in front of the congregation to talk to the youth.

yo: Tó bá di agogo méjìlá alẹ́, a máa bá àwọn òbí i wa jà
en: When it is 12 o'clock at night, we will fight with our parents

yo: Ìwé mẹ́ta ni mo kà kí ilẹ̀ tó ṣú
en: I read three books before it got dark

yo: Àbúrò àti ọbàkan mi pàdé ara wọn lọ́jà Akẹ̀sán
en: My brother and sister met each other in Akesan market

yo: Ìgbà tí mo bá Ìyálóde sọ̀rọ̀, ó dá mi lóhùn.
en: When I spoke to Iyalode, he answered me.

yo: Tí o bá fún ọmọ lọ́yàn láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀, wọ́n á ní ìlera gidi.
en: If you give birth to a child from the beginning, they will have real health.

yo: Owó tí mo ná lọ́jọ́ àjọ̀dún ò àdúgbò o wa á ti pọ̀ jù.
en: The money that I spend on the day of the festival is not too much.

yo: Mo fẹ́ràn-an gbogbo ìkìlọ̀ tí gómìnà ń fún wa.
en: I like all the warnings the governor is giving us.

yo: Ara àwọn ọmọ yẹn kò yá, ni wọ́n fi gbé wọn lọ sí ilé ìwòsàn
en: The bodies of those children did not recover, so they took them to the hospital

yo: Àwọn òbí ẹ̀ gan ti mọ̀ báyìí pé ìyàtọ̀ ti wà.
en: Your parents know now that there is a difference.

yo: Kí ni mo tún fẹ́ sọ fún Adébáyọ̀ tí kò mọ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀?
en: What else do I want to say to Adébayo who did not know before?

yo: Mi ò mọ ìdí tí Olúwadáre fi bá àwọn ará àdúgbò ẹ̀ jà.
en: I don't know why Lord Dare fought with the people of his community.

yo: Mo kàn ríi pé àwọn olè wọnú ilé tọ̀ wọ́n ni.
en: I just saw that the thieves entered the house after them.

yo: Ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì i náírà ni wọ́n gbé fún ọ̀dọ́mọkùnrin méjèèjì.
en: Two thousand naira were given to the two young men.

yo: Èso mẹ́rin ni èmi nìkan jẹ láàárọ̀ ọjọ́ náà.
en: I alone ate four fruits that morning.

yo: Mo lè jẹ ẹyin mẹ́rin lẹ́ẹ̀kan náà láìsí wàhálà
en: I can eat four eggs at once with no problem

yo: Oun tí dókítà sọ fún mi kí n jẹ nìyẹn
en: That's what the doctor told me to eat

yo: Wọ́n ní kò yẹ kí àwọn àgbàlagbà máa jẹ kókò láàárọ̀.
en: They said that adults should not eat cocoa in the morning.

yo: Àwọn ìjẹkújẹ ti pọ̀ jù nínú oúnjẹ tí a máa ń jẹ
en: There is too much waste in the food we eat

yo: Èso dára púpọ̀ láti jẹ, tí a kò bá jẹẹ́ jù.
en: Fruit is very good to eat, if we don't eat too much.

yo: Ìrẹsì àti dòdò ni àwọn ọmọ kékèké ń jẹ
en: Little children eat rice and water

yo: Ẹ̀jẹ̀ ríru ni àìsàn tó léwu jù fún àwọn àgbàlagbà.
en: Diarrhea is the most dangerous disease for the elderly.

yo: Mo ti kọ ìwé méjì báyìí, tí mo sì ń tà wọ́n
en: I have now written two books and am selling them

yo: Kọ́lá Túbọ̀sún ló kọ ìwé e Ìgbà Èwe lọ́dún tó kọjá
en: Kola Tubusun wrote his book Childhood last year

yo: Bàálẹ̀ Olúgbòde jẹ́ ògbóǹtarìgì kan nínú ìtàn Ìbàdàn.
en: Baal Olugbode is an expert in the history of Ibadan.

yo: Ajá mi ni mo rà ní Akínmọ̀ọ́rìn níjọ́sí
en: I bought my dog ​​in Akinmorin yesterday

yo: Mo tún ra olóńgbò méjì nígbà tí mo rìnrìnàjò
en: I also bought two cats when I traveled

yo: Ẹranko púpọ̀ ló ti wá ń gbé inú ilé mi báyìí.
en: Many animals have been living in my house now.

yo: Owó o dọ́là ti wá wọ́n ju bó ti yẹ lọ báyìí.
en: Dollars are more expensive than they should be now.

yo: Mo ti gbìyànjú láti kọrin sínú amóhùnmáwòrán.
en: I have tried to sing into the microphone.

yo: Ìyàwó mẹ́ta ni baálẹ̀ náà ni, gbogbo wọn ló sì sanra.
en: The chief has three wives, and all of them are fat.

yo: Wọ́n ti fún mi ní iṣẹ́ ṣe nílé ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́
en: They have given me a job in Oyo state government house

yo: Mo bá Túndé kẹ́dùn ti ìyá à rẹ̀ tó kú
en: I sympathize with Tunde on the death of his mother

yo: Àwọn àrá ilé mi kò tilẹ̀ dá mi lóhùn bí mo ṣe ń pariwo tó
en: My family members did not even answer me as I was shouting

yo: Àfi ìgbà tí mo bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní kọrin lóru ọ̀gànjọ́
en: Except when I started singing at midnight

yo: Gbogbo ará ìlú ni mo jí sílẹ̀ láìku ẹnìkan
en: I woke up all the townspeople without anyone dying

yo: Èyí jẹ́ kí inú bí àwọn adélébọ̀ àti àwọn ọkọ wọn.
en: This made the middlemen and their husbands angry.

yo: Irú èèyàn wo ni kìí jẹ́ kí ará ilé sùn lálàáfíà?
en: What kind of person does not let the family sleep in peace?

yo: Àbí kí n rán àwọn bùrọ̀dá àdúgbò kí wọ́n lọ bá mi nàá ni?
en: Or should I send the local buradas to go with me?

yo: Mi ò kàn fẹ́ kí wọ́n sọ mí lẹ́nu ni.
en: I just don't want to be talked down to.

yo: Adémọ́lá náà mọ̀ bí mo ṣe jẹ́ ní ìlú yìí.
en: The Ademola knows how I am in this city.

yo: Wọ́n sọ mí lorúkọ lánàá, inú u tèmi gaan dùn síi.
en: They named me yesterday, I was really happy.

yo: Àjẹmọ́nú ni wọ́n pe owó tí ẹ̀gbọ́n mi san fún mi níjẹta.
en: The money that my brother paid me was called a lien.

yo: Ìgbà wo ni àwọn alájọ máa wá gba àjọ wọn?
en: When will the people come to collect their organization?

yo: Owó kékeré tí mo ní lọ́wọ́ kò tó mií ná di ìparí oṣù
en: The little money I have in my hand is not enough until the end of the month

yo: Tí oṣù bá sì ti parí báyìí, ìyàwó mi á bẹ̀rẹ̀ ẹ tiẹ̀.
en: And if the month is over now, my wife will start it too.

yo: Àbí kí lẹ tún fẹ́ kí n ṣe ju pé kí ń fa ara mi sílẹ̀ lọ.
en: Or what else do they want me to do than to drag myself down.

yo: Àǹfàní i kí ló jẹ́ fún ènìyàn kó jèrè e gbogbo ayé kó wá sọ ẹ̀mí ẹ̀ nù?
en: What is the benefit for a person to gain the whole world and then lose his life?

yo: Bóyá ọ̀run àpáàdì náà ni gbogbo wọn ń lọ
en: Maybe they are all going to hell

yo: Ìbínú ò yẹ akọ̀wé, ó yẹ kí gbogbo wọn ó máa ní sùúrù ni.
en: Anger is not appropriate for a secretary, everyone should be patient.

yo: Àfi kí á bá orí i wa sọ̀rọ̀ kó baà le sìn wá dé ibi tó dára.
en: Unless we talk to our head so that it can serve us to a good place.

yo: Iṣẹ́ yìí mà ti fẹ́ parí báyìí, díẹ̀ ló kù.
en: This work is about to be finished now, there is only a little left.

yo: Mo gbé ohùn mi sókè sí ọlọ́run, ó sì dá mi lóhùn.
en: I raised my voice to God, and he answered me.

yo: Àbí kìí ṣe ọmọ àbúrò o bàbá mi ni mò ń wò yí ni?
en: Is it not my father's younger brother that I am looking at?

yo: Ení bí ení lọmọdé ń kawó, èjì bí èjì làgbà ń tayò.
en: One who is born as a child reads, the other as an adult excels.

yo: Ẹ̀ta ǹ tagbá, ẹ ta ara yín lọ́rẹ.
en: It's wrong, you fight each other.

yo: Ọmọ mi ti lọ sílé ìwé láàárọ̀ yìí kí n tó jí.
en: My son went to school this morning before I woke up.

yo: Kò sí oun tí mo bèèrè lọ́wọ́ ayálégbé mi tó dá mi lóhùn.
en: No one I asked from my tenant answered me.

yo: Àwọn nǹkan púpọ̀ ni èèyàn lè rí rà lọ́jà Akẹ̀sán.
en: Many things can be found and bought in Akesan market.

yo: Kàkà kí eku ú má jẹ sèsé, á fi ṣe àwàdànù.
en: Instead of the rat not eating it, it will be eaten.

yo: Kìí burú títí kó má ku ẹnìkan mọ́ni.
en: It's not bad until no one dies.

yo: Ayé ń lọ, à ń tọ̀ọ́ lẹ́yìn lọ.
en: The world is moving, we are moving forward.

yo: Ìgbà ò lọ bí òréré, ayé kìí tọ́ lọ bí ọ̀pá ìbọn.
en: Time doesn't go like a stick, the world doesn't go like a gun.

yo: Ètò ìdìbò mélòó la ó ṣe kí ọdún yìí tó parí ná?
en: How many elections will you do before the end of this year?

yo: Ó ti pẹ́ tí mo ti ń dúró de Túndé àti Àrẹ̀mú
en: I have been waiting for Tünde and Aremu for a long time

yo: Wọ́n ti pẹ́ dé sí ẹnu iṣẹ́ lónìí.
en: They are late for work today.

yo: Bóyá àwọn ìyàwó o wọn ló tún dá wọn dúró.
en: Maybe their wives stopped them.

yo: Èmi nìkan ni mo wà níbí yìí láti aago mẹ́sàn-án.
en: I have been here alone since nine o'clock.

yo: Kí ló tún wá kù fún mi láti ṣe ju kí n pè wọ́n lọ?
en: What else is left for me to do than to call them?

yo: Ilú Ọba ni Adétúnjí ti ń fi owó púpọ̀ ránṣẹ́ sílé
en: Adétunji has been sending a lot of money home from Ilu Oma

yo: Ìyá a wọn ǹkan ló ṣẹ́kù láti ìgbà tí bàbá a wọn ti kú.
en: Their mother is the only thing left since their father died.

yo: Kò jẹ́ bó ti jẹ́? Iṣẹ́ ti parí o.
en: Isn't it the way it is? Job done.

yo: Mo jẹ ànàmọ́ àti epo pupa pẹ̀lú ẹja díndín
en: I eat garlic and red oil with thin fish

yo: Oúnjẹ náà dùn púpọ̀ debi mo já díẹ̀ sára aṣọ mi.
en: The food was so delicious that I tore a little on my clothes.

yo: Ìyá a Túndé ní kí n fún òun ní díẹ̀ lára oúnjẹ mi.
en: Tünde's mother asked me to give her some of my food.

yo: Iyán àti ẹ̀fọ́ rírò ni mo fi lé èyí tí mo jẹ tẹ́lẹ̀.
en: I put on the one I ate before with fever and nausea.

yo: Mo ní mi ò fẹ́ jẹ àsáró mọ́ nítorí pé ara mi kò yá
en: I said that I don't want to eat any more because my body is not well

yo: Ìṣòro púpọ̀ ló ń dojú kọ àwọn tó ń gbé agbègbè Onírù.
en: Many problems are facing those who live in Oniru area.

yo: Wàá ti máa gbọ́ gbogbo oun tí mo ti ń sọ látàárọ̀
en: You will be listening to everything I have been saying this morning

yo: Kíni a tún lè fi wé iṣẹ́ àràmọ̀ǹdà tí ọlọ́run ṣe fún wa?
en: What else can we compare to the miraculous work that God did for us?

yo: Báa ti fẹ́ kó rí, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ló rí, emi la ò ní yọ̀ sí?
en: If he wanted it to be, that's how it is, won't I be happy?

yo: Ààfin Olúbàdàn fẹ̀ ju ti Aláké lọ
en: Olubabadan's palace is bigger than Aláke's

yo: Àwọn òbí mi máa ń sọ fún mi kí n rántí ọjọ́ àtisùn.
en: My parents always tell me to remember the day to sleep.

yo: Bàbá mi ní kí n rántí ọmọ ẹni tí mò ń ṣe.
en: My father asked me to remember the son of whom I was acting.

yo: Àfi ìgbà tí àwọn agbófinró mú àwọn ọlọ́sà yìí ni wọ́n tó dẹ́kun.
en: Except when the law enforcement officers caught these thieves, they stopped.

yo: Kí la gbé, kí lẹ jù? Kò le tó bẹ́ẹ̀.
en: What do we live, what is too much? It's not that hard.

yo: A sọ fún gbogbo àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ pé kí wọ́n so ewé agbéjẹ́ mọ́wọ́.
en: We told all the students that they should tie the leaves in their hands.

yo: A ti rí ẹ̀rọ kọ̀m̀pútà tó ń ka ìwé bí ọmọ ènìyàn.
en: We have seen a computer that reads like a human.

yo: Ṣé gbogbo ohun tí mo sọ fún ẹ náà lo ti fi kọ́gbọ́n?
en: Did you understand everything I told you?

yo: Kò sí nǹkan tó ń bọ̀ lókè tí ilẹ̀ ò gba, ni wọ́n máa ń sọ.
en: There is nothing that comes from above that the earth does not accept, they used to say.

yo: Kò sì sí oun tí ojú ò rí rí, àbí bẹ́ẹ̀ kọ́?
en: And there is no one who has never seen, is it not?

yo: A kìí fi okó ńlá dẹ́rúba arúgbó ni àwọn Yorùbá ń wi.
en: The Yoruba say that we don't scare old people with a big car.

yo: Kí ni mo tún lè ṣe láti mú ẹ gbọ́ràn sí mi lẹ́nu?
en: What else can I do to make you listen to me?

yo: A ti jáde kúrò nílé ìwé gíga kí ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n náà tó wọlé.
en: We had left the university before the professor entered.

yo: Ọmọ yẹn kìí sábà gbọ́ràn àfi tí wọ́n bá fi ẹjọ́ ẹ̀ sùn.
en: That child usually does not obey unless they put him to sleep.

yo: Nígbà tí a ti ń dúró sínú ọjà látàárọ̀, a ò rí ẹnìkankan dá wa lóhùn.
en: When we were waiting in the market in the morning, we did not see anyone answering us.

yo: Adékúnlé ọkọ Sinmi ni wọ́n fi ẹ̀sùn kàn pé ó ṣe aṣemọ́ṣe.
en: Simmi's husband Adekunle was accused of adultery.

yo: Tí a bá ní ká wòó fínífíní, kò sí ọmọ rere nínú àwọn ọmọ ejò.
en: If we have to look closely, there are no good children among the children of snakes.

yo: Wọ́n ti pè mí láti wá bá àwọn aláyò ṣe àjọyọ̀, mo sì gbà.
en: They have invited me to celebrate with the good people, and I accepted.

yo: Ìtàn ìnàkí tí a sọ̀rọ̀ ọ ẹ̀ níjọ́sí pa mí lẹ́rìín gidi ni.
en: The story that we told you yesterday really made me laugh.

yo: Báwo ni ìnàkí ṣe máa máa sọ̀rọ̀ bí èèyàn láìsí wàhálà?
en: How can a raccoon speak like a human being without difficulty?

yo: Kàn sí mi tí o bá ti gba owó tí mo fi ránṣẹ́.
en: Contact me if you have received the money I sent.

yo: Ó dàbíi pé Àrẹ̀mú àti ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀ ti dé báyìí.
en: It seems that Aremu and his friend have arrived now.

yo: Jẹ́ kí n lọ pàdé e wọn lẹ́nu ọ̀nà kí ajá má baà gbó mọ́ wọn.
en: Let me go to meet them at the door so that the dog will not bark at them.

yo: A ò ní gbọ́ ikú elédùmarè, ó ṣe èèwọ̀ òrìṣà.
en: We will not hear of the death of the almighty, he forbade the gods.

yo: Àwámárídìí ni iṣẹ́ ọba arínúróde olùmọ̀ràn ọkàn.
en: Awamaraidii is the work of the king who is waiting for the counselor of the heart.

yo: A kìí bá yímíyímí du imí ẹ̀ lákìtàn.
en: We will never take your breath away.

yo: Àdúgbò tí mo ti dàgbà ni wọ́n ń pè ní Àkóbọ̀ Ojúurin.
en: The neighborhood where I grew up is called Akokobo Ojuurin.

yo: Kò jìnnà sí Bashọ̀run ní ìlú Ìbàdàn.
en: It is not far from Bashorun in the city of Ibadan.

yo: Ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ ẹ Lágelú ni a ti pàdé e olóríkunkun yẹn.
en: We have met him in his native kingdom, Lagelu.

yo: Ó lè jẹ́ pé ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tí mo sọ fún ẹ nípa ẹ̀ ni wọn ń ròyìn ẹ̀.
en: It may be that they are reporting the incident that I told you about.

yo: Ojú u wa kò ní ríbi mọ́ nílẹ̀ yìí o, ó dòkèèrè.
en: Our eyes will no longer be in this land, he said.

yo: Àfi ìgbà tí mo fi ojú mi rí oun tí wọ́n ń rà lọ́jà.
en: Except when I saw him with my eyes being bought in the market.

yo: Káàkiri gbogo ìgbèríko Ìbàdàn ni a ti rí Olóòlù tó jẹ́ eléégún.
en: All over the countryside of Ibadan we have seen Ololulu who is a thorn.

yo: Ọdọọdún ni wọ́n máa ń gbée jáde, ó sì máa ń dẹ́rù ba àwọn ọmọdé
en: Every year they show it, and it scares the children

yo: Àìtètè mólè ni ọ̀rọ̀ tó wà nílẹ̀ yìí.
en: The word here is simple.

yo: Olè náà ti fẹ́ máa mú olóko lọ.
en: The thief wanted to take away the money.

yo: Kàkà kí ewé àgbọn dẹ̀, ńṣe ló tún ń le koko síi
en: Instead of the coconut leaf shrinking, it is getting harder

yo: Aì tíì kó ifá nílẹ̀, ifá ti ń ṣẹ o.
en: The sword has not been put down, the sword is breaking.

yo: Àsìkò òjò ni gbogbo oun tí a fẹ́ ṣe máa ń ṣeé ṣe
en: Everything we want to do is possible during the rainy season

yo: Tí a bá gbin ẹ̀wà àti kòkó, ǹjẹ́ èyí kò ní fún wa lówo?
en: If we plant beauty and fruit, won't this give us money?

yo: Iṣẹ́ àgbẹ̀ ṣá ni iṣẹ́ ilẹ̀ ẹ wa láti àtẹ̀yìnwá.
en: Agriculture is the work of our land from the past.

yo: Ẹni tí kò bá fẹ́ ṣiṣẹ́ gbọdọ̀ ṣetán láti jalè.
en: He who does not want to work must be ready to steal.

yo: Èwo ló tún dé tí Fúnmiláyọ̀ ń bá gbogbo ará àdúbgbò jà?
en: Where is Mrs. Mrs. fighting with all the local people?

yo: Ká ní pé mi ò dá ẹ lóhùn lẹ́ẹ̀kan ni, kí lo máa ṣe?
en: If I don't answer you once, what will you do?

yo: Ọlọ́run ò ní jẹ́ ká rí ogun abẹ́lé mọ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí o.
en: God will not let us see civil war again in this country.

yo: Èyí tí a jà ní bíi ogójì ọdún sẹ́yìn kò bójú mu rárá.
en: What we fought about 40 years ago is not appropriate at all.

yo: Lọ́sẹ̀ yìí, mo bá Adékúnlé sọ̀rọ̀ nípa oyè tí wọ́n fi mí jẹ.
en: This week, I spoke to Adékunle about the reputation they gave me.

yo: A ò ní fi ojú sunkún ara wa mọ́ o, lágbára ọlọ́run.
en: We will not cry our eyes out, God's strength.

yo: Bí a ò bá tiẹ̀ mọ ara wa rí, ṣe ó yẹ kí á tún máa jà ni?
en: If we don't even know each other, should we still fight?

yo: A ti rí ire púpọ̀ láti inú ìwà ọmọlúàbí tí Adébáyọ̀ hù.
en: We have benefited greatly from Adébayo's good behavior.

yo: Mo ti lọ sí òkun àti ọ̀sà, mi ò rí ọmọ tó dáa tó tìẹ.
en: I have gone to sea and ocean, I have not found a child as good as you.

yo: Máa bá wa lọ, Olúwa, kí á má baà sọnù.
en: Go with us, Lord, so that we will not be lost.

yo: Ìgbà tí mo wọ inúulé náà, wọ́n dá mi padà.
en: When I entered the house, they returned me.

yo: Ta ló fẹ́ fún mi lówó láti ra ẹ̀rọ kọ̀m̀pútà márùn-ún.
en: Who wants to give me money to buy five computers.

yo: Àìleèjó ni ó máa ń fàá kí ènìyàn máa sá kúrò ní ayẹyẹ
en: It is impatience that causes people to run away from celebrations

yo: Bóyá ọkọ ni ẹ́ tàbí àlè, obìnrin náà ni yóò pa ọkùnrin.
en: Whether you are a husband or a concubine, the woman will kill the man.

yo: Aago méjìlá ti ku ìṣẹ́jú mẹ́tàléláàdọ́ta ààbọ̀.
en: It was half past twelve.

yo: Mo máa jayé orí mi kí n tó kúrò nílẹ̀ yìí o.
en: I will hang my head before I leave this place.

yo: Mo fẹ́ ran àwọn èèyàn lọ́wọ́ ní gbogbo ìgbà tí mo bá ni
en: I want to help people every time I have

yo: Ogun abẹ́lé ìjọ́sí ò tíì kúrò lọ́kàn àwọn tó jàá.
en: The civil war has not left the hearts of those who fought.

yo: Ààrẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà kan kò fẹ́ kúrò lórí oyè títí tí wọ́n fi yọọ́ dànù.
en: An American president does not want to leave office until they are removed.

yo: A kò gbọdọ̀ tún dìbò yan bàbá arúgbó yẹn sí ipò kankan mọ́.
en: We must not re-elect that old man to any position.

yo: A kìí fi àgbàlagbà sílẹ̀ láti bọ́ ara wọn tí wọ́n bá ti darúgbó
en: We do not leave the elderly to fend for themselves when they are old

yo: Kàkà kí n jalè, màá yà lọ wá iṣẹ́ gidi ṣe ni.
en: Instead of stealing, I'll go find a real job.

yo: Àwọn òbí mi ti fún mi ní ọgbọ́n orí láti ṣe oun tí mo fẹ́ ṣe.
en: My parents have given me the wisdom to do what I want to do.

yo: Láìfọ̀tápè, gbogbo oun tí mo fẹ́ ṣe láyé ni mo ti ṣe báyìí.
en: Without hesitation, I have done everything I wanted to do in the world.

yo: Kíni mo tún lè sọ tí kò ní mú wọn bínù?
en: What else can I say that won't make them angry?

yo: Mo ti ṣe gbogbo nǹkan tí àlùfáà ní kí n ṣe.
en: I have done everything the priest asked me to do.

yo: A ò tíì gbọ́ nǹkankan láti ẹnu àwọn tí a fi ẹ̀sùn kàn.
en: We have not heard anything from the accused.

yo: Ó ya ni lẹ́nu pé Títí ṣì ní bàbá àti ìyá láyé.
en: It is surprising that Titi still has a father and mother in the world.

yo: Máa mu omi àti ọtí papọ̀ lẹ́ẹ̀kannáà láìsí wàhálà
en: Drink water and alcohol at the same time without difficulty

yo: Kíni a ò tíì rí rí nílẹ̀ yìí?
en: What have we never seen before in this land?

yo: Àjọ̀dún ọdún òmìnira ní orílẹ̀èdè e Amẹ́ríkà máa ń wáyé lóṣù keje.
en: Independence Day in the United States is celebrated in the month of July.

yo: Bá mi na ọmọ mi kìí sábà á dé inú ọlọ́mọ.
en: With me, my child will rarely come to term.

yo: Àbámẹ́ta ni màá bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ mi tuntun tí mo ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀
en: I will start my new job in three days

yo: Ọkọ̀ òfurufú mẹ́ta ni mo wọ̀ kí n tó dé ilé ìtura ọ̀hún.
en: I took three flights before I got to that hotel.

yo: Ọkùnrin àti obìnrin ń fi ọwọ́ kọ́ ara wọn lọ́rùn.
en: A man and a woman strangle each other with their hands.

yo: Wọ́n dúró, wọ́n sì ya fọ́tò papọ̀ tí wọ́n fi ránṣẹ́.
en: They stopped and took a photo together which they sent.

yo: Wọ́n ti fagilé àwọn ìrìn àjò òfurufú kọ̀ọ̀kan nítorí èrò.
en: Individual flights have been canceled due to overcrowding.

yo: Láti ìgbà tí mo ti sọ fún Fúnmiláyọ̀ nípa ìyàwó mi ni kò ti fi mí sílẹ̀
en: Ever since I told Mrs Milayo about my wife, she has not left me

yo: Báwo la ṣe fẹ́ gbọ́ pé irunmú ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n fásitì ti jóná?
en: How do we want to hear that the university professor's beard is on fire?

yo: Àlùfáà ń jóná, ẹ̀ ń bèèrè irungbọ̀n.
en: The priest is burning, you are asking for a beard.

yo: Ajénifújà jẹ́ ọkùnrin takuntakun tó ń dá gbé ní ìlú Ẹlẹ́yẹlé
en: Ajenifujja is a hardworking man who lives in the city of Ejeyele

yo: Tí wọ́n bá ti Ààrẹ àná mọ́lé, inú máa bí àwọn ènìyàn púpọ̀.
en: If yesterday's President was locked up, many people would be angry.

yo: Mi ò rò pé wọn á ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ ṣá, nítorípé ẹ̀rù ń bà wọ́n.
en: I don't think they will do that, because they are afraid.

yo: Mo lè sáré ju gbogbo àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ àti ẹbí mi lọ.
en: I can outrun all my friends and family.

yo: Ebi ń pa ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ará ìlú ní ìpínlẹ̀ Arámọkọ
en: A lot of people in the city of Aramokko are starving

yo: Ìgbà tí àwọn gómìnà méjèjì bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìjà ni mo mọ̀ pé wàhálà ti dé
en: It was when the two governors started fighting that I knew that trouble had come

yo: Ká má lọ kọlu igi tí wọ́n gbìn sí ojú ọ̀nà o.
en: Let's not go and hit the tree planted on the road.

yo: Mo fẹ́ràn láti máa lá oyin pẹ̀lú u búrẹ́dì àti omi ọbẹ̀
en: I like to drink honey with bread and soup

yo: Àṣé kò sí oùn kankan tó lè dẹ́rùba ọmọ akin.
en: There is no one who can scare the brave son.

yo: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí yà mí lẹ́nu gidi, ṣùgbọ́n a dúpẹ́ pé kò sí ewu kankan tó tibẹ̀ jáde.
en: I was shocked by this incident, but thankfully there was no danger.

yo: Ìlú yẹn ò jìnnà sí ibi iṣẹ́ mi, nítorínáà kò gba àsìkò púpọ̀.
en: That city is not far from my place of work, so it doesn't take much time.

yo: Nítorí náà, ó jẹ́ ibi tí mo kàn lè wọ takisí lọ ní kíá
en: Therefore, it is a place that I can just take a taxi to immediately

yo: O wá fojú ẹ̀gbẹ́ kan wò mí lọ́nà tí kò bá mi lára mu.
en: You looked at me in a way that didn't suit me.

yo: Ṣé o rò pé wọ́n tan mọ́ ara wọn ni? Bí mi ò ṣe rántí orúkọ ọ̀ mi mọ́ àti sísọ ìwé ìrìnnà ọkọ̀ mi nù?
en: Do you think they are lying to each other? If I don't remember my name and lose my passport?

yo: Mo mi orí mi ní kíákíá kí n tó dáa lóhùn.
en: I quickly shook my head before answering.

yo: Tí mo bá ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀, ó lè máà bèèrè pé níbo ló wà báyìí.
en: If I do that, he might ask where he is now.

yo: Kó wá lọ kòó lójú nílé ìtura náà, kó má bèèrè gbogbo oun tó ṣẹlẹ̀.
en: He then went to the hotel, so that he wouldn't ask everything that happened.

yo: Rárá, mi ò rò pé wọ́n tan mọ́ ara wọn,” mo fèsì.
en: No, I don't think they are lying to each other," I replied.

yo: Ó kàn wá sí mi lọ́kàn láti bèèrè ni, nítorípé o jọ mọ́ orúkọ ẹ ni.
en: It just occurred to me to ask, because you know your name.

yo: Kò dà bíi ẹni tó gbà mí gbọ́ rárá, àbí mo ń lálàá ni?.
en: He doesn't seem to believe me at all, or am I dreaming?.

yo: Mo mọ̀ pé ó léwu ṣùgbọ́n ìbéèrè pàtàkì kan ṣẹ́kù tí mo ní láti bèèrè.
en: I know it's dangerous but one important question remains that I have to ask.

yo: “Tiẹ̀ gbọ́ ná, ǹjẹ́ o ti rí ìnàkí kankan lẹ́nu ọjọ́ mẹ́ta yìí?
en: "Even so, have you seen any trouble in these three days?

yo: “Ìnàkí?” Ó bèèrè. “Ṣé ọ̀bọ lágídò ẹranko?”
en: "Baboon?" He asked. "Is a monkey not an animal?"

yo: “Bẹ́ẹ̀ni, ìnàkí ẹranko,” mo dáhùn.
en: "Yes, an animal," I answered.

yo: Mi ò rò pé mo ti rí ìnàkí kankan fún ọdún pípẹ́, bóyá ní ọgbà ẹranko tàbí níbòmíì.
en: I don't think I've seen any moose for years, either in the zoo or anywhere else.

yo: Àbí ìnàkí àdúgbò o wa yìí ti padà sí ìwà ìpátá a ẹ̀ ni?
en: Or has this community returned to its violent behavior?

yo: Àbí ìnàkí mìíràn ló ń lo àwọn ọgbọ́n àyínìke ẹ̀ láti ṣe àwọn ìrúfin yìí ni?
en: Or is it someone else who is using his tricks to commit these crimes?

yo: Àbí nǹkan mìí, tí kì ń ṣe ìnàkí yìí, ló ṣokùnfàá ni?
en: Or are there other things, which are not doing this thing, that are causing it?

yo: Mi ò ṣáà fẹ́ gbà pé ìnàkí ìlú u wa yìí lo ti padà sí jíjí orúkọ àwọn ènìyàn.
en: I don't want to believe that the people of this city have gone back to stealing people's names.

yo: Ṣèbí ó ti sọ fún mi tẹ́lẹ̀ ní pàtó pé dídi orúkọ àwọn obìnrin méjẹ mú sínú òun ti tó gẹ́ẹ́
en: He had already told me clearly that holding seven women's names inside him was enough.

yo: Ó sọ pé inú òún máa dùn láti kàn máa gbé ìyókù ayé oun lálàáfíà nínú u ìlú onísun yẹn ni
en: He said that he would be happy to live the rest of his life in peace in that burning city.

yo: Ó sì dàbí ẹni pé ó dáa lójú.
en: And he seems to be convinced.

yo: Àbí bóyá ìnàkí yìí ní àrùn kan tí kò gbóògùn, tí èèyàn ò lè fi ìrònú lásán yí padà.
en: Or maybe this person has an incurable disease that cannot be changed with mere thought.

yo: Àti pé bóyá àìsàn ẹ̀, àti ìjípépé ara ẹ̀, ló ń sọ fún-un pé kó ṣá máa ṣeé lọ!
en: And maybe his illness, and his perfect body, is telling him to keep going!

yo: Bóyá gbogbo èyí ló mú padà wá sí àdúgbọ̀ o ẹ̀ àtijọ́ ní Olúyọ̀lé
en: Perhaps all this brought him back to his old village in Olûyolé

yo: Ó padà sí ìwà ìbàjẹ́ ẹ̀ àtijọ́ tó kọ̀ tí kò lọ.
en: He returned to his old depravity that he refused to leave.

yo: Bóyá màá tiẹ̀ gbìyànjú ẹ̀ níjọ́ kan fúnra à mi, kí n ríi bó ṣe máa ń rí.
en: Maybe I'll even try it myself one day, to see how it goes.

yo: Láwọn òru aláìrórunsùn kọ̀ọ̀kan, lọ́jọ́ tí àwọn ìrònú onírúurú aládùn bá ń wá sí mi lọ́kàn.
en: In each sleepless night, in the day when all kinds of delicious thoughts come to my mind.

yo: Màá wá káàdì ìdánimọ̀ tàbí káàdì orúkọ ìtẹ̀mọ́ra obìnrin kan tí mo fẹ́ràn, màá tẹjú mọ́ọ dáadáa
en: I will look for the identity card or name card of a woman I like, I will look at it carefully

yo: Màá gba gbogbo orúkọ ẹ̀ sínú mi, màá wá gba díẹ̀ lára ẹ̀ wá fún ara tèmi nìkan.
en: I will take all your names into me, I will take some of you for myself.

yo: Báwo ló ṣe máa ń rí na? Rárá, kò tiẹ̀ lè ṣẹlẹ̀.
en: How does it look? No, it can't even happen.

yo: Ọwọ́ mi ò yá báyẹn, mi ò sì ní lè jí nǹkan tó jẹ́ tọmọ ẹlòmìíràn.
en: My hand is not strong, and I will not be able to steal something that belongs to someone else.

yo: Nǹkan ọ̀hún ìbáà jẹ́ oun tí kò ṣeé rí dìmú. Jíjalè sì jẹ́ oun tó lòdì sófin.
en: That thing would be something that could not be grasped. Stealing is against the law.

yo: Ìfẹ́ alágídí, ìdánìkanwà àìlópin.
en: Stubborn love, endless loneliness.

yo: Láti ìgbà yẹn, ìgbàkúùgbà tí mo bá tẹ́tí sí orin ni mo máa ń rántí ìgbésí ayé ìnàkí yẹn.
en: Since then, whenever I listen to music, I remember that poor life.

yo: Ìnàkí nínú àjà ìlé ìtura àlàpà kan, tó daṣọ tẹ́ẹ́rẹ́ bora, tó sì sùn.
en: An anak in the attic of a small hotel, dressed in a blanket, and sleeping.

yo: Màá sì máa rántí àwọn ìpanu ibẹ̀ tí a gbádùn nígbà tí à ń mu ọtíi bíà papọ̀.
en: I will always remember the snacks we enjoyed while drinking beer together.

yo: Mi ò tíì rí obìnrin arẹwà atọ́kùn ìwé ìròyìn arìnrìnàjò mi yen mọ́ láti ọjọ́ yìí.
en: I have not seen the beautiful woman on the cover of my travel magazine since that day.

yo: Mo ṣá rò pé ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí kò fún-un ní ìdààmú púpọ̀ kankan rárá.
en: I still think that this incident did not give him much trouble at all.

yo: Òun àti àwọn àbúrò o ẹ̀ kò ṣáà lẹ́bi kankan níbẹ̀.
en: He and his siblings did not commit any crime there.

yo: Òun kọ́ ló fa èyíkéyìí gbogbo nǹkan tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí wa lọ́sàán àná.
en: He did not cause any of the things that happened to us yesterday afternoon.

yo: Ó máa ń mú inú mi bàjẹ́ ṣá, ṣùgbọ́n mi ò lè mú ara mi wá látí sọ fún-un
en: It always makes me feel bad, but I can't bring myself to tell him.

yo: Bí àlá ni gbogbo ẹ̀ ṣe bẹ̀rẹ̀: ìyá mi ṣí ilẹ́kùn, wọ́n sì wọlé.
en: It all started like a dream: my mother opened the door and they entered.

yo: Mo ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ nà sórí ibùsùn láti sùn ni nígbàtí ẹ̀yìn ojú mi bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ta mí gidi.
en: I had just laid down on the bed to sleep when the back of my eyes started burning.

yo: Mo lajú, mo sì rí àwọn èèyàn yìí, tí mo fẹ́ràn rí, tí wọ́n ti fi mí sílẹ̀ nígbà pípẹ́ sẹ́yìn.
en: I looked up and saw these people, whom I loved, who had left me a long time ago.

yo: Ìyá mi jókòó sí apá ọ̀tún mi. Adémọ́lá fara pẹ́ mi lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ òsì.
en: My mother was sitting on my right. Ademola was waiting for me on the left side.

yo: Ìgbà ò tíì yí wọn padà tàbí sún wọn kì rárá.
en: Time has not changed them or moved them at all.

yo: Èmi wà ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọgọ́ta ọdún, ṣùgbọ́n Àyọ̀ní rí bí ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rìndínlógún.
en: I am in my early 60s, but Ayoni looks like 16 years old.

yo: Ó sì tún ń wọ aṣọ aláwọ̀ ọ búlù tí mo ti máa ń fi ṣe yẹ̀yẹ́ pé ó fún-un ní àyà.
en: And she was also wearing a blue dress that I used to joke that it gave her a chest.

yo: Ìyá mi rí gẹ́gẹ́ bí wọ́n ṣe rí nígbà tí wọ́n kú ní ogún ọdún sẹ́yìn.
en: My mother was the same as they were when they died 20 years ago.

yo: Ńṣe ló dàbí ẹni pé wọ́n fò jáde nínúu fọ́tò kan tí a yà nígbà èwe mi ni
en: It looks like they jumped out of a photo taken when I was young.

yo: Àwọn méjèèjì nínú aṣọ tí mo dámọ̀ látẹ̀yìnwá.
en: Both of them in clothes that I recognized from before.

yo: Irun ìyá mi wà ní kíká lókè bí wọ́n ṣe máa ń ṣùú yẹn.
en: My mother's hair was on top like it used to be.

yo: Ìka rẹ̀ gùn ó sì rí tínrín bí ilá. Ìgbọ̀nrìrì mú mi.
en: His fingers were long and thin as a line. I was overwhelmed with laughter.

yo: Àwọn ọwọ́ yìí ni wọ́n ti kàn mí lára.
en: These are the hands that have hurt me.

yo: Àwọn ọwọ́ yìí ni wọ́n ti fìgbà kan nu omijé mi nù.
en: These hands have once wiped away my tears.

yo: Ṣèyí àti màmá ràn mí lọ́wọ́ kúrò lórí ibùsùn, ìkọ̀ọ̀kan ń mú mi dání ní àpá kọ̀ọ̀kan
en: Shei and mom helped me out of bed, each holding me on each side.

yo: Àwọn mẹ́tẹ̀èta sì ń rìn lẹ̀ngbẹ̀ sínú u oòrùn àárọ̀ tó ṣebí ọ̀lẹ.
en: The three of them were walking side by side in the lazy morning sun.

yo: Ojú ọjọ́ ń rùn bíi ilẹ̀ tútù tí a wú jáde, ó sì tutu pẹ̀lú ìrì àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀rọ̀.
en: The weather smelled like fresh, blown-out earth, and it was wet with dew.

yo: Ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́ kan sáré kọjá lórí ọgbà mi
en: A dog ran across my garden

yo: Ẹyẹ kan bà sórí igi gúrọ́fà tó wà lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ mi níbẹ̀ yẹn.
en: A bird fell on the tree next to me.

yo: Ó ń kọrin pẹ̀lú ohùn tó tobi.
en: He sings with a loud voice.

yo: Etí ì mi ò kọbiara púpọ̀ tó bẹ́ẹ̀ sí kíkọrin yìí
en: My ears didn't pay much attention to this singing

yo: Báyìí ni gbogbo ohun tí ó ń dún ṣe mú létíì mi tó
en: This is how everything that sounds makes me listen

yo: A jókòó lóríi àpótí tí ọmọ ọ̀dọ̀ mi ti gbé sẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ilẹ̀kùn
en: We sat on the box that my son had placed next to the door

yo: Ọmọ yẹn ṣá ti kọ́ bí wọ́n ṣe ń gbálẹ́ báyìí, ó sì nawọ́ sí àgbàlá.
en: That child has learned how to sweep now, and he reaches out to the yard.

yo: Igi ọwọ̀ tí Adédàmọ́lá fi ń gbálẹ̀ ń fi ààmì wọ́gọwọ̀gọ sílẹ̀ lórí ilẹ̀ iyẹ̀pẹ̀.
en: The wood used by Adédamola leaves a mark on the ground.

yo: Ìyá mi pòṣé ó sì kùn lábẹ́nú. Ó ní. Ọkàn mi.
en: My mother sighed and grumbled under her breath. He said. My heart.

yo: Ohun tí Babalájé ma ń pè mí nígbà tí mo wà ní kékeré tí a jẹ́ kòríkòsùn ni
en: It's what Babalajé used to call me when I was a little girl

yo: Ó máa ń fún ìyá à mi ní ìnira; bóyá nítorí bí Bámgbóṣé ṣe máa ń sọ ọ̀rọ̀ yẹn ni
en: He used to give my mother a hard time; maybe because of the way Bámgboshe used to say that word

yo: Ohùn rẹ̀ rí bíi ẹ̀fẹ̀ àti agbára iná lẹ́ẹ̀kannáà.
en: His voice was like love and fire at the same time.

yo: Mi ò wá lè ṣe àìkọbiarasí pé kiní yìí ò wá rí bí àlá mọ́.
en: I can't ignore that this is not like a dream anymore.

yo: Lákọ̀ọ́kọ́, mo wà lórí ìjókòó, ohun tí mi ò tíì lè ṣe láti bí oṣù púpọ̀ sẹ́yìn
en: First, I was sitting up, something I hadn't been able to do for months.

yo: Láti ìgbà tí ẹsẹ̀ mi ti kùnà, tí a sì ti dá mi kulẹ̀ sóri ibùsùn.
en: Ever since my legs failed and I was laid on the bed.

yo: Àti pé, báwo ni Olúmorótì ṣe lè mọ̀ nípa àwọn ọjọ́ tí Kúnlé ti lò pẹ̀lú mi?
en: And, how can Olúmoróti know about the days Kunle has spent with me?

yo: Ọmọ ọ̀dọ̀ yìí ṣẹ̀ṣè dé láti wá gbé pẹ̀lú mi lọ́dún kẹta sẹ́yìn ni.
en: This young man just came to live with me three years ago.

yo: Mo kọjú sí ìyá mi.
en: I looked at my mother.

yo: “Láti ìgbà wo l’ẹ̀yin méjèèjì ti wà níbi?” mo bèèrè.
en: "Since when have you two been there?" I asked.

yo: Mo bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní sọ̀rọ̀ ṣùgbọ́n lẹ́yìn ìgbà yẹ ni Túndé gbé garawa omi kọ̀rọ̀ nílẹ̀.
en: I started to speak but after a while Tünde put a bucket of water on the ground.

yo: Kò kí wa, kò tiẹ̀ kọbiara sí ìdúró o wa.
en: He didn't greet us, he didn't even pay attention to where we were.

yo: Mo kíyèsíi pé ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ìbínú ti ń mú ọwọ́ mi gbọ̀n.
en: I noticed that the beginning of anger was making my hands tremble.

yo: Irú ọmọ Òṣogbo wo ní ń rìn kọjá lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ àwọn tó jùú lọ nírú ọ̀nà báyìí?
en: What kind of Osogobo son is walking next to those who are the most in this way?

yo: “Fi ọmọ yẹn sílẹ̀,” Mo gbọ́ tó sọ, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò lanu ẹ̀ láti sọ̀rọ̀.
en: "Leave that child," I heard him say, even though he didn't hesitate to speak.

yo: Ìyá mi wò wá, wo àwọn ìka wa tí a lọ́ papọ̀.
en: My mother looked at us, looked at our fingers that we went together.

yo: Ètè wọn di fífẹ́lẹ́, kùrukùru dúdú sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí pé jọ nínú ojú wọn.
en: Their lips became thin, and dark clouds began to gather in their eyes.

yo: Nínú ojú yìí, mo sì rí àwọn ohun ìrántí tí mo gbé sínú u ibi ìfìrántí.
en: In this face, I saw the memories that I put in the memory.

yo: Èmi gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ọmọbìnrin kékeré tó ń bẹ̀ wọ́n láti fọwọ́ sí ìbáṣepọ̀ mi pẹ̀lú Ṣadé
en: I am like a little girl begging them to approve my relationship with Shadé

yo: Wọ́n ti rí Tolú gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ti ń wo ológbò sí àpẹrẹ ẹja
en: They have seen Tolu as we see a cat to a fish

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n Ṣeun ò kọbiara sí àìfọwọ́sí yìí;
en: But Sheun ignored this disapproval;

yo: Agídí ìgbàgbọ́ ẹ̀ ti fọ́ọ lójú;
en: The stubbornness of his faith has blinded him;

yo: Èmi naà ò tilẹ̀ níran nítorí agídí tí mo fi so mọ́ ìbáṣepọ̀ náà.
en: I didn't even see because of the stubbornness I attached to the relationship.

yo: A so mọ́ ara wa bíi ẹran sí egungun.
en: We are attached to each other like flesh to bone.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ìgbà tó yá, mo pé ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rìndínlógún
en: But later, I was 16 years old

yo: Ọkùnrin kan bá yọ sí ẹnu ọ̀nà ilé e wa — ọkùnrin tí ìyá mi ti ṣètò fún mi
en: A man appeared at the door of our house - the man my mother had arranged for me

yo: Nígbà ti mo lọ sí ilé ẹ̀, ìyá ẹ sọ pé ó ti lọ́kọ ní kánmọ́, ó sì ti kó lọ sínú ìlú pẹ̀lú ẹ̀.
en: When I went to her house, her mother said that she got married soon and moved to the city with her.

yo: Ìyá mi ti gbìyànjú láti tù mí nínú ṣùgbọ́n kò sí ohun tó yé mi mọ́, oúnjẹ ò sì ládùn mọ́.
en: My mother has tried to comfort me but I don't understand anything anymore and the food doesn't taste good anymore.

yo: Mo fẹ́ẹ̀ lè má sọ̀rọ̀ mọ́ lẹ́yìn tí Motúnráyọ̀ ti lọ.
en: I almost stopped talking after Motúnrayo left.

yo: Mi ò tiẹ̀ kúrò nínú yàrá à mi rárá.
en: I didn't even leave my room.

yo: Àwọn kan tiẹ̀ sọ pé bóyá mo ti ya wèrè ni.
en: Some even said that maybe I am crazy.

yo: Ojú mi ti sún kì sínú ihò wọn, àti ikunmú sí ẹ̀yìn ìbàdí mi.
en: My eyes are close to their holes, and fists on the back of my hips.

yo: Ọwọ́ àti ẹsẹ mi ti tínrín di bíi ọmọ ọwọ̀, aṣọ mi sì dúró mọ́ mi lára bíi àpò gàrí.
en: My hands and feet are as thin as a baby, and my clothes are tight on me like a saddle bag.

yo: Ìyá mi mọ̀ pé wọ́n lè sọ èso kan ṣoṣo tó fi ìdí wọn múlẹ̀ sí inú ilé ọkọ wọn nù.
en: My mother knew that they could throw away the only fruit that established them in their husband's house.

yo: Wọ́n mọ̀ pé àwọn ìyekan bàbá mi á ṣùrù bò wọ́n àti àwọn ohun ìní bàbá à mi.
en: They know that my father's actions will protect them and my father's possessions.

yo: Nítorí náà, wọ́n yára ṣe ìgbéyàwó o pàjáwìrì mìíràn.
en: Therefore, they quickly had another emergency wedding.

yo: Ó ti sú mi, mi ò sì ṣe agídí lérò yìí.
en: I'm tired, and I'm not stubborn about this.

yo: Ìbáṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìyá à mi súnkì bí ohun ọ̀gbìn tí òǹgbẹ ń gbẹ.
en: My relationship with my mother shriveled like a thirsty plant.

yo: A ní àwọn ìjíròrò ọlọ́wọ̀ ní àwọn ọdún tó kọjá sẹ́yìn
en: We had respectful discussions over the years

yo: Ọ̀gbun tó wà láàárín wa bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí fẹ̀ síi, ó sì ń gbé gbogbo ìfẹ́ tí a ní sí ara wa mì.
en: The gap between us began to widen, swallowing all the love we had for each other.

yo: Nígbà tó yá, lọ́jọ́ kan, wọ́n lọ sùn, wọn kò sí jí mọ́.
en: Later, one day, they went to sleep and did not wake up.

yo: Èyí jẹ́ ogójì ọdún àti márùún sẹ́yìn
en: This was forty-five years ago

yo: A jókòó síbẹ̀ nínú ìdákẹ́jẹ́ẹ́, a sì ń tẹ́tísí ìró àwọn ìyá a àdúgbò bí wọ́n ṣe ń pariwo
en: We sat there in silence and listened to the voices of the local mothers as they screamed.

yo: A ń tẹ́tísí ẹ̀rín àwọn ọmọdé bí wọ́n ṣe ń sáré kọjá lẹ́gbẹ̀gbẹ́
en: We listen to the children's laughter as they run past

yo: Fún ìgbà díẹ̀, kò sí ẹni tó sọ nǹkankan.
en: For a while, no one said anything.

yo: Látijọ́, ìyá à mi á ti máa pariwo pé kí Òrìsàbùnmi jáde.
en: In the past, my mother would shout for Orisabunmi to come out.

yo: Mo ti sọ fún ẹ, mi ò fẹ́ ọmọ ẹlẹ́nu rírùn yẹn nínú ilé mi
en: I told you, I don't want that ugly baby in my house

yo: Wọ́n á ti sọ fún mi, ṣùgbọ́n Fábùnmi ò ní kọbiara sí èébú náà.
en: They would have told me, but Fabunmi would not pay attention to the insult.

yo: Láti ìgbà wo lẹ̀yin méjèèjì ti wà níbẹ̀yẹn?
en: Since when have you two been there?

yo: Báwo ni ẹ ti ṣe wà níbíyìí pẹ̀lúù mi ná?
en: How have you been here with me?

yo: Mo rán wọn létí pé ní ọdún kẹta ni a wà, àti pé mo jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún méjìlélọ́gọ́ta
en: I reminded them that we are in our third year, and that I am 62 years old

yo: Àwọn èèyàn kìí wọ irun wọn ní ṣùkú mọ́ tàbí kun ètè wọn ní aró.
en: People don't wear their hair straight anymore or paint their lips with lipstick.

yo: Mo ka gbogbo ohun tí ó n ṣẹlẹ̀ láyé òde òní sílẹ̀ bíi oníròyín tẹ́rù ń bà.
en: I read everything that is happening in today's world like a journalist.

yo: Ìyá à mi gbá ọwọ́ mi tó ń gbọ̀n mú.
en: My mother grabbed my trembling hand.

yo: Fọwọ́ kan mí lójú, Ìyá à mi sọ, wọ́n sì fi ọwọ́ méjì sí ẹ̀ẹ̀kẹ́ẹ wọn.
en: Touch me in the face, my mother said, and they put two hands on their cheeks.

yo: O ti wà níbí pẹ̀lúu wa báyìí.
en: You are here with us now.

yo: Fún ìṣẹ́jú díẹ̀, mi ò lè sọ̀rọ̀.
en: For a few minutes, I could not speak.

yo: Tófúnmi sọ pé òún wà níbẹ̀ nígbà tí mo bí àwọn ọmọ mi obìnrin méjì
en: Tofunmi said that he was there when I gave birth to my two daughters

yo: Nígbàtí àwọn ọmọbìnrin yìí lọ́kọ tí wọ́n sì kó lọ bá wọn.
en: When these girls got married and moved in with them.

yo: Ó ní òun ò kúrò lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ mi, pé òun ti ń dúró de ọjọ́ yìí tí màá lè fi ojú rí òun.
en: He said that he will not leave my side, that he has been waiting for this day when I can see him with my eyes.

yo: Òòyì í bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí kọ́ mí. Ọkàn mi ti wà nínú ìpòrurù àìmọ̀kan tẹ́lẹ̀
en: Ooyi started teaching me. My heart was already in the confusion of ignorance

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n nísìnyí, mo wá ń làkàkà pẹ̀lú ìran òtítọ́ tuntun ni.
en: But now, I am struggling with a new vision of truth.

yo: Gbogbo ara ẹ̀ pátápátá ni ó hunjọ tí irun funfun arúgbó sì dà bòó
en: His whole body was completely disfigured and his old white hair was scattered

yo: Àwọn ẹsẹ̀ mi tó ti wà ní kíkú tẹ́lẹ̀ ni ó ti wá ní àwọn ààmì dúdú káàkiri.
en: My legs that were already dying now have black marks all over them.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n mi ò wá tún máa mí túpetúpe pẹ̀lú ìrora
en: But I was no longer panting with pain

yo: Mo sì ríi pé mo le gbé àwọn ẹsẹ̀ mi láìní wàhálà.
en: And I found that I could lift my legs without difficulty.

yo: Mo ń níran iyẹ̀pẹ̀ bíi yangan tó ń yí mi ní gìgísẹ̀.
en: I see a scaly blade spinning around my heels.

yo: Mo ti ń dúró de ọjọ́ yìí, ọkàn mi, ó sọ, ó sì gbé orí ẹ̀ lé èjìká mi.
en: I have been waiting for this day, my heart, he said, and placed his head on my shoulder.

yo: Ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ń tẹ èjìká mi jẹ́jẹ́, mo sì rí ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ìbàlẹ̀ ọ̀kàn tó sodo sínú ikùn mi.
en: He began to press my shoulder gently, and I felt the beginning of a calm feeling in my stomach.

yo: Mo so apá mi kan mọ́ọ lọ́rùn, mo sì dì mọ́ọ síbẹ̀.
en: I tied one of my arms around his neck and held him there.

yo: Ìyá mi náà, tí kìí dùn mọ́ nínú láti rí kí ara wa kanra, dúró, wọ́n sì rìn lọ pẹ̀lú pípòṣé
en: My mother, who was no longer happy to see us together, stood and walked away

yo: Sálúbàtà wọn dún pà-pà-pà lábẹ́ ẹsẹ̀ẹ wọn.
en: Their shoes crunched under their feet.

yo: Ìrántí ìgbà kékeré kan tún wá sí mi lọ́kàn pẹ̀lú ọ̀rẹ́ mi
en: A childhood memory also came to my mind with my friend

yo: Mo ń sunkún nínú yàrá mi lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n lé Motúnráyọ̀ lọ tí wọ́n sì tì mí mọ́nú ilé.
en: I was crying in my room after Motúnrayo was sent away and I was locked up in the house.

yo: Ìbínú ńlá gba inú mi kọjá. Ìjì ráńpẹ́ kan gbọn amọ̀ ilẹ̀ pupa sókè.
en: Great anger went through me. A sudden storm shook up the red clay.

yo: Tí o bá rí bí inú Ìyá mi ò ṣe dùn, kò fi hàn.
en: If you see how unhappy my mother is, she doesn't show it.

yo: Wọ́n ti tì wá mọ́ ibí láti iye ọdún yìí sẹ́yìn wá.
en: We have been stuck here for years.

yo: Ó sọọ́ pẹ̀lú àìbìkítà, àfi bíi wípé ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀yìn-ayé jẹ́ irú ọ̀rọ̀ tí a ti fìgbà kan sọ tẹ́lẹ̀ rí.
en: He spoke with indifference, except that the words of the afterlife are the kind of words that have been said before.

yo: Àgbàlá pa lọ́lọ́; eruku ti baralẹ̀.
en: The courtyard is closed today; the dust has settled.

yo: Gbogbo ògiri àwọn òrùlé onírin ti àwọn ilé tó wà nítòsí ni wọ́n ti wọ àwọ̀ pupa.
en: All the walls of the metal roofs of the nearby houses have been painted red.

yo: Ariwo agbègbè tún padà wá, gbogbo ohùn dídún orin àwọn ọ̀dọ́ àti àgbà
en: The noise of the area came back, all the voices of the young and the old singing

yo: Gbogbo dídún àwọn ohun bíi páńgolo
en: All playing things like drums

yo: Ẹnìkan ń kọrin ìyìn Yorùbá kan nínú ọgbà tó wà lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ tẹ̀mi.
en: Someone is singing a Yoruba hymn in the garden next to me.

yo: Ohùn rẹ̀ kẹ̀, ó sì ń gbọ̀n, àfi bíi pé orin náà jáde wá láti inú odò ikùn ẹ̀ ni.
en: His voice was hoarse and trembling, as if the music came from the river in his stomach.

yo: Mo jókòó jẹ́ẹ́ sétí ìjókòó ò mi, pẹ̀lú ikùn mi tó ń kùn
en: I sat on my seat, with my stomach grumbling

yo: Mo fẹ́ sọ fún Ṣeun pé nkò mọ ohun tí màá ṣe pẹ̀lú àlàyé yìí
en: I want to tell Sheun that I don't know what to do with this explanation

yo: Mi ò bìkítà fún ohun tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ lẹ́yìn ikú, àti ibi tí màá lọ lẹ́yìn náà.
en: I don't care about what happens after death, and where I will go after.

yo: Nǹkan ṣoṣo tí mo fẹ́ ni pé kí n tún ríi padà. Eléyìí ti tó fún mi.
en: The only thing I want is to see him again. This is enough for me.

yo: Kí ni a máa ṣe nípa wọn? Ó nawọ́ sí ibi tí ìyá mi wà.
en: What are we going to do about them? He reached where my mother was.

yo: Aò le tẹ̀ síwájú láì fi tiwọn ṣe.
en: We cannot move forward without doing theirs.

yo: Mo ròó fún ìgbà díẹ̀, mo wá sọ nǹkan tí mi ò tíi sọ rí nípa màmá mi.
en: I thought for a while, then I said something that I have never said before about my mother.

yo: Wọn á ní láti gba ohun tí wọn ò lè yí padà lọ́tẹ̀ yìí.
en: They will have to accept what they cannot change this time.

yo: Mo pè sí ibi tí wọ́n jókòó sí ní igun ẹ̀yìnkùnlé. “A ní láti sọ̀rọ̀.”
en: I called to where they were sitting in the back corner. "We need to talk."

yo: Ìyá mi dúró níwájú u wa, wọ́n sì yí ojú padà láti ọ̀dọ̀ mi
en: My mother stood in front of us, and they turned away from me

yo: Ohun tí ẹ̀yin méjèèjì ń ṣe yìí, èèwọ̀ ni o, Ìyá mi wí.
en: What you two are doing is forbidden, said my mother.

yo: Eléyìí bẹ̀rẹ̀ àríyànjiyàn láàárin wọn.
en: This started an argument between them.

yo: Wọ́n ti súnmọ́ ara wọn débi pé wọ́n fẹ́ẹ̀ lè máa na ara wọn
en: They are so close to each other that they are almost touching each other

yo: Ẹ dákẹ́ ẹnu yín kí ẹ jókòó, Màmá, ni mo pariwo, ẹnu sì ya ìyá à mi.
en: Shut up and sit down, Mom, I shouted, and my mother's mouth was shocked.

yo: Wọ́n wò mí bíi pé ó ti wá yé wọn pé ọjọ́ púpọ̀ ti kọjá
en: They looked at me as if they understood that many days had passed

yo: Mi ò sì nílò láti gbà’ṣẹ lọ́wọ́ wọn mọ́. Wọ́n jókòó jẹ́jẹ́.
en: And I don't need to take jobs from them anymore. They sat quietly.

yo: Ó ya ìyá mi lẹ́nu bí mo ṣe sọ fún wọn pé àwọn ni wọ́n ń gbé agbedeméjì ayé òhun ọ̀run
en: My mother was surprised when I told them that they live in the middle of the sky.

yo: Wọ́n súnmú nígbà tí wọ́n rí ẹ̀rín músẹ́ rẹ̀.
en: They got closer when they saw his smile.

yo: Nígbà náà ni omijé bẹ̀rẹ̀, tó ń dà sílẹ̀ pòròpòrò sí ẹ̀rẹ̀kẹ́ àti ọrùn wọn.
en: Then the tears started, pouring down their cheeks and necks.

yo: Mi ò lè sọ bóyá ẹkún wọn jẹ́ nítorí ohun tí mo sọ tàbí ìjà a wọn pèlú Mọ́túndé
en: I can't say whether their crying was because of what I said or because of their fight with Motünde

yo: “Ṣé ẹ ti ṣetán láti parí ìjà báyìí?” Mo bèèrè lọ́wọ́ wọn.
en: "Are you ready to end the fight now?" I asked them.

yo: “Mi ò tíì ṣetán,” Adé jágbe. Mo gbọdọ̀ sọ òótọ́ fún ẹ.”
en: "I'm not ready yet," Adé said. I must tell you the truth."

yo: “Irú òótọ́ wo?” Mo bèèrè lọ́wọ́ ẹ
en: "What kind of truth?" I asked you

yo: Túndé tẹjú mọ́ iwájú, láìṣẹ̀tàn láti sọ ojú abẹ níkòó nípa ohun tí ìròyìn náà jẹ́.
en: Tunde stared straight ahead, not ready to say anything about what the news was.

yo: Mo wo ìyá mi; wọ́n ń wo káàkiri láiwo ibi tí mo wà.
en: I looked at my mother; they were looking around regardless of where I was.

yo: Ìyá à mi da ọwọ́ méjèèjì bojú.
en: My mother covered both hands.

yo: Wọ́n wà ní ipò yìí fún ìgbà pípẹ́, bí ẹni pé wọ́n ti ń di àpáta ni.
en: They were in this position for a long time, as if they were turning into rocks.

yo: Nígbà tí wọ́n tún wò mí, mo ríi pé ètè wọn ti ń gbọ̀n.
en: When they looked at me again, I saw that their lips were trembling.

yo: “Ìyàwó ẹ̀ pokùnso nínú ilé ìdáná ìyá àgbà ẹ̀ l’óṣù tó tẹ̀lé ìgbéyàwó ẹ,”
en: "Your wife hanged herself in her grandmother's kitchen the month after your wedding,"

yo: Mo gan pa sórí ìjókòó mi.
en: I really fell on my seat.

yo: Mo ń gbọ́ bí orí mi ti ń lagogo ju gbogbo oun mìíì tó ń dún
en: I can hear my head ringing louder than all the others that are ringing

yo: Gbogbo iṣan nínú ara mi ni ó ti yípo ní ọ̀nà tí ó ń dùn mí gidigidi.
en: Every muscle in my body has twisted in a way that hurts me a lot.

yo: Ojú ẹ̀ ti dà bí ẹ̀re igi, pẹ̀lú àwọn ètè .
en: His face is like a statue of wood, with lips.

yo: Bóyá tí màmá mi ò bá bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ń sọ̀rọ̀ padà, m̀ bá rò pé mo ń ṣìràrán ni.
en: Maybe if my mother doesn't start talking back, I think I'm wrong.

yo: Èmi àti ìyá ẹ̀ ní láti ṣe nǹkan nípa ẹ̀yin méjèèjì.
en: Your mother and I have to do something about you two.

yo: Nítorínáà, a rán-an lọ sí ọ̀dọ̀ọ ìyà-àgba ẹ̀, a dẹ sọ fún un pé ó ti lọ ilé ọkọ ni.”
en: So, we sent him to the prison, we told him that he had gone to the husband's house."

yo: Ó dúró láàárín ọgbà, ó ń dìmọ́ ara ẹ̀, ó kẹ̀yìn sí wa.
en: He was standing in the middle of the garden, holding himself, and he looked at us.

yo: Ó ń rí sí mi bíi pé mo ti jáa kulẹ̀ nípa gbígba àwọn irọ́ nípa ìgbéyàwó yìí gbọ́.
en: It seems to me that I have been disappointed by believing the lies about this marriage.

yo: Mo bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí lérò pé mo le fọwọ́ yí nǹkan nínú atẹ́gùn láti dá gbogbo nǹkan padà.
en: I began to think that I could manipulate the air to change everything.

yo: “Mo lérò pé ẹò ni sọ pé kí n pẹ̀lẹ́ o,” Mo sọ fún màmá mi.
en: "I think you're the one who told me to be late," I said to my mother.

yo: “Nítorípé eléyìí ò ní mọ́gbọ́n wá.”
en: "Because this will not make sense to us."

yo: “Ó ti rẹ̀ mí,” ni nǹkan ẹyọ kan tí wọ́n sọ.
en: "I'm tired," was one thing they said.

yo: Mo kún fún oríṣiríṣi èrò nínú àyà mi
en: I am full of different thoughts in my heart

yo: Ìyá mi rí bí àwọ̀ omi; mo ń wò wọ́n
en: My mother looks like water; I am looking at them

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ó rí bíi pé mo tún lè rí àwọ̀ ọ̀dà tí ó wà lódìkejì lẹ́yìn wọn.
en: But it seems that I can also see the color of the tar that is on the other side behind them.

yo: Agbedeméjì ayé àti ọ̀run yìí ti sú mi.
en: I am tired of this space between heaven and earth.

yo: Mo dìde, mo sì rìn jáde.
en: I got up and walked out.

yo: Ó ń fẹsẹ̀ gbá àwọn òkuta nílẹ̀ nínú àgbàlá, ó sì ń rẹ́rìín músẹ́.
en: He was kicking stones in the yard and smiling.

yo: Ṣé o rántí ìgbà tí a máa ń yí bébà fi ṣe sìgá, tí a máa ń fàá mu lẹ́yìn ilé?
en: Do you remember the time when we used to turn paper into cigarettes, which we used to smoke behind the house?

yo: Mo fọwọ́ kan ọrùn ẹ̀, mo fi ìka kan fa ìlà yíi ká, mo wò ìsàlẹ̀ láti yẹ̀ẹ́wò fún àpá.
en: I touched her neck, I drew a line around it with one finger, I looked down to check for scars.

yo: Ó dún ìdún ayọ̀ díẹ̀, ara ẹ̀ sì le lábẹ́ ìfọwọ́kàn mi.
en: He let out a small sound of joy, and his body stiffened under my touch.

yo: Ó gbé orí ẹ̀ lé èjìká mi.
en: He put his head on my shoulder.

yo: Mo da ọwọ́ mi ká gbogbo ara rẹ̀ nígbà tí mo ní ipa omijé ẹ̀ lọ́rùn mi.
en: I spread my hands all over his body when I felt the impact of his tears on my neck.

yo: Àwọn ẹyẹ ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí kọrin láti orí igi.
en: Birds have started singing from the trees.

yo: Èyí jẹ́ àwọn oun dídùn kan tí a gbọ́ gbẹ̀yìn kí ariwo tó dún
en: These are some of the last things we heard before the noise

yo: Àwọn èrò kan bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí pé jọ.
en: Some thoughts began to gather.

yo: Ìyá Túndé sáré lọ sínú àgbàlá, kọjá lára wa lọ sínu ilé.
en: Túndé's mother ran into the yard, past us and left the house.

yo: Àwọn obìnrin mìí tún tẹ̀lée láìpẹ́, pẹ̀lú eruku ìdọ̀tí lẹ́yìn ìsáré e wọn.
en: The other women soon followed, with dust in the wake of their run.

yo: Ó mú ọwọ́ ọ̀ mi dání.
en: He took my hand.

yo: Gbogbo nǹkan ló polúkúrúmuṣu báyìí, àbí bẹ́ẹ̀kọ́?
en: Everything is so simple now, isn't it?

yo: Ìwọ ọ́ ṣì jẹ́ ọmọge èmi sì ti di ìyá arúgbó.
en: You are still young and I have become an old mother.

yo: Ó gbọn orí ẹ̀ nù ní rárá. “Ìwọ náà ti ń yípadà.”
en: He shook his head. "You are changing too."

yo: Mo si ríi pé àwọ ara mi ti di fífà le.
en: And I saw that my skin has become tighter.

yo: Ìyá à mi dúró lẹ́nu ọ̀nà, ṣùgbọ́n mi ò kọbiara sí wọn.
en: My mother was standing at the door, but I ignored them.

yo: Gbogbo kókó ara mi ò dùn mí mọ́.
en: Every part of my body does not make me happy.

yo: Ó dà bíi pé mo ti kún fún agbára tí mi ò mọ̀ láti ìgbà pípẹ́.
en: It seems that I have been filled with strength that I have not known for a long time.

yo: Ẹsẹ̀ mi sì yá fáfá nígbà ti mo wọ yàrá tí ẹgbẹ́ àwọn obìnrin ti péjọ.
en: And my feet felt good when I entered the room where the group of women had gathered.

yo: Màmá Ọdúnladé ń nu omijé ojú ẹ̀ pẹ̀lú etí aṣọ ìró ẹ̀.
en: Odunlade's mother wipes the tears from her eyes with the edge of her cloth.

yo: Obìnrin mìí ti já sórí ìkúnlẹ̀, lẹ́sẹ̀ ẹ ibùsùn mi.
en: My wife has fallen on her knees, at the foot of my bed.

yo: Wọn ò ṣebí ẹni pé wọ́n rí wa; kò dàbí ẹni pé wọ́n kófìrí wa.
en: They did not pretend to see us; it doesn't seem like they hate us.

yo: Mo wo ara à mi lórí ibùsùn, mo rí obìnrin tí mo jẹ́ nígbàkan rí.
en: I looked at myself on the bed, I saw the woman I once was.

yo: Bí ilẹ̀ ṣe máa ń rí lẹ́yìn tí ọyẹ́ bá ti mu gbogbo omi ara ẹ̀ tán.
en: How the earth looks like after a bird has drunk all its body fluids.

yo: Irun ẹ̀ jẹ́ bíi ti dúdú ẹlẹ́ní bí olókùn.
en: His hair was as black as a rope.

yo: Ọyàn ẹ, tó pẹlẹbẹ tó sì gùn, sàn wá sílẹ̀ lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ẹ̀ mẹ́jẹ̀ẹ̀jì
en: Your breasts, soft and long, come down next to both of you.

yo: Obìnrin kan fa aṣọ ìbora láti bo àyà ẹ̀.
en: A woman pulls a blanket to cover her chest.

yo: Bí a ṣe kúrò ní yàrá yẹn, mo wo inú u jígí kékeré kan tí mo ní.
en: As we left that room, I looked inside a small mirror that I had.

yo: Èyí sì fi àwòrán mi hàn bí mo ṣe rí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọbìnrin ìkòkó
en: And this shows my image as I was as a little girl

yo: Mo wo Ṣadé, ṣùgbọ́n ó rẹ́rìín múṣẹ́ lọ́nà tó yà mí lẹ́nu púpọ̀.
en: I looked at Şadeh, but he smiled in a way that surprised me a lot.

yo: Àwọn ìyá ti fún wa ní ààyè lati tún bẹ̀rẹ̀ níbi tí a ti dádúró.
en: Mothers have given us the opportunity to pick up where we left off.

yo: Ó dì mí lọ́wọ́ mú, a sì jọ jáde lọ síta.
en: He held my hand and we went outside together.

yo: Ó jẹ́ àsìkò tí àwọn òdòdó àárọ̀ ti wà ní oge ẹwà a wọn.
en: It is the season when the morning flowers are at their peak of beauty.

yo: Mo ṣí ọwọ́ mi méjì síta, Ṣadé sì súnmọ́ iwájú.
en: I opened my two hands, and Şade came closer to the front.

yo: Ìdìmọ́ra wa pẹ́ púpọ̀, tí ara àwa méjèjì ń balẹ̀ sínú ara wọn.
en: Our hold lasted for a long time, both of us resting inside each other.

yo: Ìyá à mi súnmọ́ wa, wọ́n káwọ́ gbera, wọ́n sì tún tú u ká.
en: My mother came close to us, they started moving, and they scattered her again.

yo: Mo mọ̀ láti gbogbo bí wọ́n ṣe ń gbọ̀n.
en: I know from all the way they are shaking.

yo: Kò tiẹ̀ rẹ́rìín tàbí kọbiara sí ìdúró ìyá à mi níbẹ̀.
en: He didn't even laugh or ignore my mother standing there.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n mo mọ̀ pé ìbínú ẹ̀ jẹ́ èyí tí mo lè mú wálẹ̀
en: But I know that his anger is something that I can bring down

yo: Mo ti dé ibí lákòótán, èmi sì ni kọ́kọ́rọ́ sí ilẹ̀kùun ẹ̀.
en: I have finally arrived here, and I have the key to your door.

yo: Sé ẹ ti ṣetán láti tẹ̀síwájú? Mo bèèrè lọwọ́ ọ wọn.
en: Are you ready to move on? I asked you them.

yo: Ìbéèrè yìí ò tiẹ̀ wúlò mọ́ lásìkò yìí. Síbẹ̀, wọ́n ní, “Bẹ́ẹ̀ni.”
en: This question is not even relevant at this time. Still, they said, "Yes."

yo: Nígbà tí mo lá ojú ù mi padà, a ń dúró níwájú odò.
en: When I opened my eyes again, we were standing in front of the river.

yo: “Tọọ̀, báwo la ṣe máa pe àwọn ìyá wá o?” Mo bi wọ́n.
en: "Well, how are we going to call the mothers?" I asked them.

yo: “Àá kọrin ni,” ìyá mi fèsì. Wọ́n sì gbóhùn sókè.
en: "She will sing," my mother replied. And they spoke loudly.

yo: Ó gbé agbohùn fóònù sókè, ó sì dìímú digbí
en: He picked up the phone and held it tight

yo: Òun ló máa dúro fún àsìkò díẹ̀ kó tó sọ̀rọ̀.
en: He will wait for a while before speaking.

yo: Ó ríi pé òun máa ń fẹ́ ṣeé ní àwọn ìgbà tí kò ròtì.
en: He realizes that he wants to be able to when he doesn't think.

yo: Dípò ìyẹn, ó gbé agbohùn fóònù sílẹ̀, tí ọwọ́ ẹ̀ sì ń gbọ̀n.
en: Instead, he put the phone down, his hands shaking.

yo: Ilé kan wà tó dúró bí ahá: bíi òkúra dúdú fafa
en: There is a house that stands like a house: like a sophisticated black stone

yo: Obìnrin náà tó ga, tó wunilójú tó dàbí ará ayé mìíràn
en: The tall, attractive woman who looks like someone from another world

yo: Ó tún àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ yìí sọ sókè, ó ń gbádùn bí wọ́n ṣé ń yí lórí ahọ́n ẹ̀
en: He repeated the words, enjoying the way they rolled off his tongue.

yo: Ó sáré lọ sínú yàrá màmá ẹ̀, ó ṣí àwọn àpótí i aṣojúlóge ẹ̀.
en: He ran into his mother's room and opened the boxes.

yo: Ó ń wá nǹkan láàárín àwọn ìtọ́tẹ̀, ó ń pòṣé.
en: He is looking for something between the clues, he is posing.

yo: Ó ṣí àpótí aṣọ ẹ̀ pẹ̀lú agídí, àwọn dígí inú ẹ̀ ṣì sọọ́ di púpọ̀ lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀
en: He opened his wardrobe stubbornly, and the mirrors inside were immediately wide open.

yo: Oyin kan pẹ̀lú ẹnu pupa bí ẹ̀rọ panápaná ń léfòó nínú ìtànná ariwo ẹ̀lẹ́tíríìkì.
en: A bee with a mouth as red as a fire engine floats in a flower of electrical noise.

yo: Nínú ìjókòó ẹ̀yìn, ó le rí orí ojú ẹ̀ nínú dígí ìwẹ̀yìn ọkọ̀
en: In the back seat, he could see his face in the rearview mirror

yo: Ó rì lọ sínú àga bí ìlú náà ṣé ń jáde wá
en: He sank into the chair as the city came out

yo: Ó tẹ fèrèsé ọkọ̀ sílẹ̀ bí awakọ̀ ṣe ń sọ̀rọ̀ láìdúró
en: He rolled down the car window as the driver kept talking

yo: Ó dijú ẹ̀, tí gbogbo bótòbótò awakọ̀ náà ń wọ̀ọ́ lára láìjanpata.
en: It is complicated, that all the driver's attention is affected without fail.

yo: Níbi iṣẹ́ kìnní yìí, ó rí ọkùnrin pẹ́lẹ́ngẹ́ onígòlójú kan
en: At this first job, he saw a handsome man

yo: Ó ń fọwọ́ tún ìgò ojú tó bà sórí imú ẹ̀ ṣe
en: He was fixing the eye bottle that fell on his nose

yo: Ilé náà dàbíi àwòrán tí a mú wá láti Ilé Olókuta
en: The house looks like a picture taken from the House of Olokuta

yo: Ohun ọjọ́ iwájú tó dàbíi pé kò jọ mọ́ àdúgbó yẹn.
en: The future that seems to be different from that village.

yo: Ó fi ẹ̀rọ abomiwọ́nlẹ̀ sílẹ̀, inú ẹ̀ dùn láti rí arábìnrin yìí
en: He left the water heater, you are happy to see this sister

yo: Ó nawọ́ sí ìlẹ̀kùn iwájú ilé tó wà ní ṣíṣí
en: He reached for the open front door

yo: Nínú ilé, ó pòórá fún bí ìṣẹ́jú kan, ó sì padà pẹ̀lú ìnura lọ́wọ́.
en: Inside the house, he disappeared for about a minute and returned with a towel in hand.

yo: Lẹ́yìn èyí, lẹ́yìn tó ti bọ́ gbogbo aṣọ ẹ̀ tán lórí ibùsùn
en: After this, after taking off all his clothes on the bed

yo: Ó ń dún, ó ń yìn-ín fún bí ọwọ́ ẹ̀ ṣe lọ́wọ́rọ́ tó.
en: He is singing, he is praising you for how rich your hands are.

yo: Iná ẹ̀ tó ń jó fún ọmọkùnrin yìí bẹ̀rẹ̀ nínú u balùwẹ̀
en: The fire that was burning for this boy started in the bathroom

yo: Lọ́sẹ̀ yẹn, àwọn iná nàà bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ń jó ní yàrá ọ̀tọ̀tọ̀ nígbà kọ̀ọ̀kan
en: That week, the fires started burning in different rooms each time.

yo: Ó bẹ́ jáde, ó rìn kọjá lóríi pápá a atẹ́rẹrẹ tí a kùn pẹ̀lú àwọn àtíbàbà funfun
en: He jumped out and walked across the grassy field covered with white blankets.

yo: Ọpọ̀lọpọ̀ ẹran ara wà ní gbogbo àyíká
en: There is a lot of flesh all around

yo: Ó bọ́ aṣọ òtútù ẹ̀, ó fi kọ́ apá ẹ̀ bíi ẹnìkan
en: He took off his cold clothes and put them on his arms like someone else

yo: Ó yẹ àwọn àlejò yìí wò. Kò sí ènìyàn dúdú kankan níbẹ̀.
en: He looked at these guests. There were no black people there.

yo: Kò tiẹ̀ pinnu láti pín oúnjẹ ìpanu kankan.
en: He didn't even decide to share any snacks.

yo: Ó ti mọ́ọ lára láti máa jẹ́ obìnrin dúdú kan ṣoṣo tó farajọ ẹlòmíràn
en: She was used to being the only black woman who faced anyone else

yo: Ó gbá àwọn bọ́tìnì dùùrù mọ́lẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ipá.
en: He hit the piano keys hard.

yo: Àwọn èrò kékeré yìí ń pariwo, láì fún ara wọn ní ijánu kankan
en: These little people are screaming, without giving themselves any reins

yo: Wọ́n ń di ife wáìnì wọn mú.
en: They are holding their wine cups.

yo: Nǹkankan nípa ìfọwọ́kàn yẹn dàbí ohun tó dámọ̀.
en: Something about that touch felt familiar.

yo: Ó fara mọ́ọ láìlágbára láti kọ àyípadà kan tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ nínúu ikùn ẹ̀.
en: He was unable to resist a change that was happening in his stomach.

yo: Ó wọ ìbòjú oní fàdákà tí a fi iṣẹ́ ọ̀ṣọ́ púpọ̀ ṣí.
en: He wears a veil of silver with many ornaments.

yo: Kò sí ọ̀nà tí a fi lè rí ojú ẹ̀ wò.
en: There is no way we can see his face.

yo: Ó wọ aṣọ iṣẹ́ aláwọ̀ ọ búlù òru tí a fi àrà rán, tó sì bá àwọ ẹ̀ mu
en: She wears a navy blue embroidered work dress that matches her complexion.

yo: Ó wà ní ìwọ̀n-ọn gíga kannáà, pẹ̀lú ìdúró àti títínrín.
en: He is of the same height, with stature and strength.

yo: Dípò o kó dáa lóhùn, ọkùnrin yìí gbàá lọ́wọ́, ó darí ẹ̀ lọ
en: Instead of giving a good answer, this man took her by the hand and led her away

yo: Ó fọwọ́ sí abẹ́ aṣọ àríyá ẹ̀ tó jẹ́ àwọ̀ ọ alámọ̀
en: He patted the bottom of her party dress which was colored purple

yo: Ó fi ẹnu kòó lọ́rùn jẹ́jẹ́ kó tó kúrò.
en: He kissed her neck before leaving.

yo: Àwọn ẹja oníràwọ olóṣùpá kúrò nínú ilé e wọn
en: The moon starfish leave their homes

yo: Ó wọ inú àwọn èrò tó ń gégèé lọ sí oríṣiríṣi ọ̀nà.
en: He entered the crowd going in different directions.

yo: Ẹja oníràwọ̀ olóṣùpá wá di olú.
en: The moon starfish became a mushroom.

yo: Òhun ti ń wo inú àpò ìléwọ́ ẹ̀ láti sanwó ìlàjì oúnjẹ.
en: He was looking in his pocket to pay for the food.

yo: Ọmọkùnrin náà ń wòó bíi pé ó mọ̀ọ́ timọ́tímọ́.
en: The boy looked as if he knew him well.

yo: Èyí jẹ́ wíwò ológe tó lọ́wọ́rọ́, tó sì wà fún ìgbà bíntín.
en: This is a very rich look, and it is for childhood.

yo: Lẹ́yìn náà, ojú ẹ̀ dúdú, gbogbo ara ẹ̀ sì kọ́rẹ́lọwọ́.
en: After that, your face was black and your whole body was paralyzed.

yo: Kò sí bí ó ṣe lè mu ọtí yó tó.
en: There is no way he can get drunk enough.

yo: Mi ò fẹ́ kú ikú ọkàn ríru láàárín ọgbọ̀n’jọ́ orí mi o.
en: I don't want to die of a heart attack in my thirties.

yo: Kóo sì sá fún gbogbo àwọn nǹkan tó ní ẹ̀pà nínú.
en: And avoid all things that contain peanuts.

yo: Ní tòótọ́, ó rántí ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ yẹn.
en: In fact, he remembered what had happened.

yo: Ọkùnrin yìí ti sọ fún-un nípa ìrìn àjò o ẹ̀ sí ìlú ọba
en: This man had told him about his trip to the royal city

yo: Ó sọ̀rọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìgbónára fún ìgbà díẹ̀.

yo: Ọmọbìnrin yìí ò retí àti rí irú ọ̀yàyà báyìí gbà lọ́dọ̀ ọ ẹ̀.
en: This girl did not expect and see this kind of warmth from you.

yo: Òtítọ́ ni pé nǹkan kékeré ló mọ̀ nípa ẹ̀ yàtọ̀ sí ìbaṣepọ̀ iṣẹ́ tí wọ́n ní.
en: The truth is that he knows little about you apart from the work relationship they have.

yo: “Nǹkankan tí inú ẹ̀ ò dùn sí nípa iṣẹ́?” Ó rọ̀ọ́ jẹ́jẹ́.
en: "Anything you're not happy about at work?" It's easy.

yo: Àwọn irin iṣẹ́ ìyàwòránilé ni ó kán lọ́wọ́ ẹ̀.
en: He was full of painting tools.

yo: Ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní kó owó láti inú àpò ìléwọ́ ẹ̀.
en: He started asking her to take money from her pocket.

yo: Iná tó bẹ̀rẹ̀ ẹ gbogbo ẹ̀ jẹ́ ìṣèèṣì, bí wọ́n ṣe sọ fún-un.
en: The fire that started you all was a failure, as they told him.

yo: Ara ìrántí yẹn máa ń parapọ̀ sínú àtubọ̀tán kannáà ni.
en: That body of memory merges into the same image.

yo: Ó gbìyànjú láti sọ̀rọ̀ ṣùgbọ́n kò lè ṣeé mọ́.
en: He tried to speak but couldn't.

yo: Nàìjíríà yóò gba ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun tuntun.
en: Nigeria will receive a new army ambassador.

yo: Wọ́n fẹ́ gbógun ti ìdúnkokò àti ètò ààbò tó ń ṣe ṣége-ṣège.
en: They want to fight corruption and the corrupt security system.

yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yẹmí Òṣíbàjò jẹ́ igbákejì ààrẹ.
en: Professor Yemi Oshibajo is the vice president.

yo: Mo lọ sí ìlú Àbújá lọ́jọ́ Ajé láti pàdé ọ̀rẹ́ mi.
en: I went to Abuja on Monday to meet my friend.

yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Ajáńlékokò sọ̀rọ̀ lásìkò ìpàdé tí ó ṣe.
en: Professor Ajanlekoko spoke during the meeting he held.

yo: Mò ń gbọ́ orin nígbà tí mò ń lọ sí ilé ìjọsìn.

yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Òsíbàjò tún ní, À ń sa ipá wa lórí ètò ààbò.
en: Professor Osibajo also said, We are doing our best on the security system.

yo: Wọ́n lọ sí ìlà oòrùn láti kojú ikọ̀ ọlọ́tẹ̀.
en: They went to the east to face the rebel ambassador.

yo: Wọ́n ya owó kan sọ́tọ̀ láti fi ra irinṣẹ́ ogun.
en: They set aside money to buy tools of war.

yo: Wọ́n ṣe àmójútó ètò ààbò lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
en: They manage the security system in this country.

yo: Ìlú ṣe ètò tí ìjọba yóò máa tẹ̀lé láti mójútó ètò ààbò.
en: The city made a plan that the government will follow to ensure the security system.

yo: Wọ́n ṣàpèjúwe rẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí èèyàn àlááfíà.
en: He was described as a man of peace.

yo: A ò ní fowó kún ọkọ̀ ojú irin nítorí àwọn mẹ̀kúnnù.
en: We will not invest in the train because of the complaints.

yo: Ìjọba kò ní dẹ́kun àti ṣèrànwọ́ nípa fífi owó kún ọkọ̀ ojú irin.
en: The government will not stop and help by adding money to the train.

yo: Ó sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọ̀rọ̀yìn sọ̀rọ̀.
en: He said this while talking to reporters.

yo: Lágbàáyé kò sí ibi tí wọ́n ti ń lo ọkọ̀ ojú irin láti pa owó sápò ìjọba.
en: There is no place in the world where trains are used to save money for the government.

yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń mójútó ọkọ̀ ojú irin yóò pèsè àwọn ọkọ̀ ojú irin tuntun.
en: The train maintenance company will provide the new trains.

yo: Olùdarí ò fèsì lórí ìgbà tí ọkọ̀ ojú irin láti Èkó sí Ìbàdàn yóò parí.
en: The conductor did not comment on when the train from Lagos to Ibadan will finish.

yo: Wọ́n sọ fún wa pé wọn yó parí isẹ́ náà ní oṣú kẹrin ọdún tó kọjá
en: They told us that they will finish the work in the fourth month of last year

yo: Sùgbọ́n wọ́n ní ìpènijà lẹnu iṣẹ́ nígbà tí mò ń bá iṣẹ́ lọ.
en: But they had a challenge at work while I was working.

yo: Wọn kò tí ì rí ẹrù u wọn gbà ní èbúté láti ọ̀sẹ̀ to kọjá.
en: They have not seen the cargo they received at the port since last week.

yo: Orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà àti Nàìjíríà yóò tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn.
en: The United States and Nigeria will sign an agreement.

yo: Wọ́n dá owó iyebíye orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà tí wọ́n jí padà.
