yo: Gbogbo owó tí wọ́n kó sálọ sí ilẹ̀ òkèèrè ni wọ́n gbà padà.
en: All the money they took to flee to a foreign land was returned.

yo: Ó ti fi orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà sílẹ̀ lọ sí orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà lọ́jọ́ Àìkú.
en: He left Nigeria for America on Sunday.

yo: Ìpàdé ọ̀hún máa wáyé ní ọjọ́ Àìkú lọ́dọọdún.
en: That meeting will be held on Sunday every year.

yo: Olùdámọ̀ràn fún ìjọba lórí ètò ààbò sọ̀rọ̀ lórí àjálù inú àwùjọ.
en: The adviser to the government on the security system talks about the disaster in society.

yo: Aláṣẹ pàṣẹ láti mú àwọn adarí agbègbè lọ sí ibi ìpéjọpọ̀ kan
en: The authority ordered to bring the local leaders to a meeting place

yo: Ẹ̀mí tó sọnù ti di méjìlélógún báyìí, bi ìwà ìpànìyàn ṣe ń tẹ̀síwájú.
en: The number of missing lives has now reached twenty-two, as the killing spree continues.

yo: Wọ́n fi ọ̀rọ omíyalé tó ìjọba léti láti wá àtúnṣe sí i.
en: They sent a letter to the government to seek correction.

yo: Ó wá fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn lóríi ọwọ́ tí àwọn ọlọ́pàá fi mú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.
en: He then expressed his displeasure at the police's handling of the incident.

yo: Rògbòdìyàn máa ń wáyé ní gbogbo àsìkò ìdìbò.
en: Conflicts arise every election season.

yo: Èèyàn márùn-ún farapa, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọ dúkìá àti ilé sì jóná.
en: Five people were injured and many properties and houses were burnt.

yo: Wọ́n ka ìwé òfin sí etí àwọn tó bá fẹ́ dá wàhálà sílẹ̀.
en: They read the law to the ears of those who want to cause trouble.

yo: Títí tí wọn yóò fi mú àwọn afurasí náà àárin yín ni ọ̀daràn wà.
en: Until they catch the suspects there is a criminal in your midst.

yo: Ó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn tó wà níbi ìpàdé ọ̀hún nígbà tí a bẹ̀rẹ̀.
en: He was one of those who were at that meeting when we started.

yo: Ó wá kìlọ̀ kí wọ́n má gba ìwà ọ̀daràn láàyè ní agbègbe wọn.
en: He then warned them not to allow crime in their neighborhood.

yo: Ìpàdé wáyé lẹ́yìn ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ tí ó gba ẹ̀mí àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́tàlá.
en: The meeting took place after the incident that claimed the lives of 13 people.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀daràn wá ṣe ọṣẹ́ ní agbègbè ọ̀hún ní àṣálẹ́ ọjọ́ Àìkú.
en: Criminals then made soap in that area in the desert of Sunday.

yo: Ìjàm̀bá iná ṣẹlẹ̀ ní ọjà a Balógun nílùú Èkó.
en: A fire accident occurred at Balogun market in Lagos.

yo: Ìjàm̀bá iná ń sẹlẹ lọ́wọ́-lọ́wọ́ lọ́jà a Balógun nílùú Èkó
en: Fire accidents are happening from time to time at Balogun market in Lagos.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́jà ti pàdánù ọ̀kẹ́ àìmọye dúkìá a wọn.
en: Traders have lost billions of their assets.

yo: Àwọn agbébọn pa ènìyàn mẹ́tàlá ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun
en: Thirteen people were killed by gunmen in Osun state

yo: Wọ́n ṣe ìdájọ́ fún àwọn tó ṣe iṣẹ́ ibi náà.
en: They judged those who did the evil work.

yo: Ààrẹ sọ pé “kò sí ànfààní níbi ẹ̀san, ìkórìíra àti ìwà ìbàjẹ́"
en: The president said "there is no place in revenge, hatred and corruption".

yo: Ààrẹ rọ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ kí wọ́n máa gbé pẹ̀lú ìbáṣepọ̀ àlááfíà.
en: The president urged the youth to live with peaceful relations.

yo: Ààrẹ wá bá àwọn ẹbí tí ọ̀fọ̀ ṣè kẹ́dùn lóríi ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú ọ̀hún.
en: The President then condoled with the bereaved families over the tragic event.

yo: Nàìjíríà yóò fọwọ́ṣowọ́pọ̀ lórí ètò o ẹ̀kọ́ fún Éṣíà.
en: Nigeria will collaborate on education for Asia.

yo: Kí ìbáṣepọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè méjéèjì náà tún le fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ sí i.
en: So that the relationship between the two countries can be strengthened.

yo: Akọ̀wé ìjọba àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ẹ̀kọ́ sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìbáṣepọ̀ yìí.
en: The government secretary in charge of the education system spoke on this relationship.

yo: Àǹfààní ńlá ni ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ náà yóò jẹ́ fún àwọn méjèèjì.
en: The collaboration will be of great benefit to both.

yo: Ètò ẹ̀kọ́ nílò o ìrànlọ́wọ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn olókoòwò àti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè.
en: The education system needs help from investors and foreign countries.

yo: Ìjọba ti ṣetán láti dá sí ètò okoòwó lórí ẹ̀kọ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
en: The government is ready to intervene in the education system in this language.

yo: Kí ni ó fa rògbòdìyàn láàárín lọ́kọ láyà tó jẹ́ pé gbogbo ìgbà ìjà ni ṣáá?
en: What is the cause of the conflict between the people that is always fighting?

yo: Akútọ́ọ́lọ́ ló rán wọn láti béèrè ọ̀nà tí ìjọba ó fi ṣèrànwọ́
en: Akutolo sent them to ask how the government would help

yo: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ló ṣàgbéyẹ̀wò o ètò ààbò òfin epo rọ̀bì.
en: The House of Assembly considered the protection plan of the rubber oil law.

yo: Ní kété tí wọ́n bá ti wọlé lọ́jọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun ni iṣẹ́ bẹ̀rè.
en: As soon as they entered the Victory Day, the work began.

yo: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ní láti mójútó àwọn ìpele ìjọba yòókù.
en: The parliament has to take care of the other levels of government.

yo: Kò sóhun tó ń bọ̀ lókè tílẹ̀ ò gbà.
en: It doesn't matter what is coming up even if you don't agree.

yo: Ìjọba ń ṣe àtìlẹyìn fún àwọn tó fẹ́ ibùdó omi òkun.
en: The government is supporting those who want a marine station.

yo: Ìjọba àpapọ̀ yó ṣàtìlẹyìn nídìí iṣẹ́ ọ̀nà márosẹ̀ náà.
en: The federal government will support the development of the arts.

yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Ayọ̀dé bẹ̀bẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ Ajé lẹ́yìn ìpàdé tí ó ṣe pẹ̀lú ààrẹ.
en: Prof. Ayode made the appeal on Business Day after the meeting he held with the president.

yo: Gómìnà náà sọ pé iṣẹ́ àkànṣe méjì ni ìjọba òún ti gùnlé.
en: The governor said that his government has completed two special projects.

yo: Mo gbóríyìn fún ààrẹ Bùhárí fún ètò ìrànwọ́ rẹ̀ sí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè.
en: I commend President Buhari for his plan to help the countrymen.

yo: Ìjíròrò o wa kìí ṣe lórí ìgbàgbọ́ tí a ní nínú ìṣèjọba yìí nìkan.
en: The discussion is not only about the faith we have in this government.

yo: Gómìnà Ayọ̀dé fọkàn gbogbo àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ rẹ̀ balẹ̀ pé.
en: Governor Ayode reassured all the people of his state.

yo: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ náà tí pinnu láti fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì ní iṣẹ́.
en: The state government has decided to give jobs to two thousand youths.

yo: Wọn yóò ṣe àfilọ́lẹ̀ ẹ èto ìrónilágbára fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́.
en: They will launch a youth empowerment program.

yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ogun òfurufú ti dáná sun ibùdó ikọ̀ ọlọ́tẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Òǹdó
en: The Air Force has set fire to a rebel embassy in Ondo state.

yo: Kò sẹ́ni tó le gbèjà ọlọ́run afi Ọlọ́run fúnra rẹ̀.
en: No one can defend God except God himself.

yo: Wọ́n tún ṣe ìkọlù sí ibi tí àwọn ikọ̀ ọlọ́tẹ̀ ń sá pamọ́ sí.
en: They also attacked the place where the rebel ambassadors were hiding.

yo: Ó sọ̀rọ̀ yìí nílùú Àbújá láti sọ nípa ìkọlù orí afẹ́fẹ́.
en: He spoke in Abuja to talk about the airstrike.

yo: Ìjọba àpapọ̀ kò nílò láti yá owó nílẹ̀ òkèèrè.
en: The federal government does not need to borrow money from abroad.

yo: Tí ìjọba bá le rí owó orí, wọn ò nílò láti yá owó mọ́.
en: If the government can get tax revenue, they don't need to borrow money anymore.

yo: Ìyá àgbà sọ pé "ẹ ǹ lẹ́ níbẹ̀ yẹn".
en: The grandmother said "you are right there".

yo: Ìjọba àpapọ̀ nílò owó láti lè jẹ́ kí ó ṣe ojú ẹ̀.
en: The federal government needs money to make it happen.

yo: Ó wá kí alága àti ìgbìmọ̀ rẹ̀ kú orí ire fún ipò tuntun wọn.
en: He wished the chairman and his committee well for their new position.

yo: Ààrẹ pàṣẹ láti kọlu jàǹdùkú, ọ̀daràn àti olè lórí afẹ́fẹ́.
en: The president ordered to attack mobs, criminals and thieves in the air.

yo: Ààrin gbùgbùn ìlú ni wọ́n fi ìpàdé àwọn ẹlẹ́gbẹ́jẹgbẹ́ náà sí.
en: In the middle of the city they put the meeting of the members.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn èèyàn ti pàdánù ẹ̀mí i wọn nínú ìjàm̀bá náà.
en: Many people have lost their lives in the accident.

yo: Ní ìbámu ìlànà yìí wọ́n pèsè ìrànwọ́ fún ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun òfurufú.
en: According to this policy they provide assistance to the Air Force.

yo: Ààrẹ bá wọn kẹ́dùn lórí ìkọlù àti òfò ẹ̀mí tó ṣẹlẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.
en: The President sympathized with them on the attack and loss of life in the state.

yo: Ààrẹ fi dá wọn lójú pé oríléèdè Nàíjíríà kò ní gbàgbée wọn.
en: The President assured them that Nigeria will not forget them.

yo: Amẹ́ríkà yóò ran Nàíjíríà lọ́wọ́ nípa ètò ajé, okoòwò, ààbò àti ẹ̀kọ́.
en: America will help Nigeria in terms of economy, trade, security and education.

yo: Wọ́n ṣe ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ lórí ètò ìlera fún àǹfààní orílẹ̀ èdè méjéèjì.
en: They cooperated on the health system for the benefit of both countries.

yo: Bàbá náà sọ̀rọ̀ yìí ní ibi ayẹyẹ àádọ́rin ọdún tí wọń gba òmìnira.
en: The father said this at the 70th anniversary of independence.

yo: Owó gidi ló ń wọlé lórí ètò ìṣòwò wọn tó tóbi jù
en: Real money is coming in on their biggest business plan

yo: Olùkọ́ fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ní iṣẹ́-àmúrelé tí wọ́n yóò ṣe wá sí iléèwé.
en: The teacher gave the students homework to do at school.

yo: Orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti pèsè ètò ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún Nàìjíríà.
en: The United States has provided aid to Nigeria.

yo: Adarí fún ọ̀rọ̀ ọ òkèèrè ilẹ̀ Nàìjíríà tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ náà.
en: Nigeria's foreign minister continued the cooperation.

yo: Àyìndé máa ń parọ́ lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀ kódà èṣù ò parọ́ tó o.
en: Goats lie a lot, even the Èṣù does not lie enough.

yo: Àjọṣe tó dán mọ́rán wà láàárín orílẹ̀-èdè méjèèjì.
en: There is a good relationship between the two countries.

yo: Àwọn àáfáà gbàdúrà fún àlàáfíà orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjíríà.
en: The nuns prayed for the peace of Nigeria.

yo: Àpéjọ àdúrà náà wáyé lásìkò ìgbéyàwó àbúrò ààrẹ.
en: The prayer meeting was held during the wedding of the president's younger brother.

yo: Ààrẹ Bùhárí lo àsìkò ayẹyẹ náà láti fi gbàdúrà fún tọkọ-taya.
en: President Buhari used the occasion to pray for the couple.

yo: A mọ rírì i rẹ̀ torí náà ni a ṣe ń jó tí à ń yọ̀.
en: We appreciate it, that's why we dance and rejoice.

yo: Nàìjíríà ti fẹnu kò láti dá àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n padà sílẹ̀.
en: Nigeria has refused to release the prisoners.

yo: Wọ́n dá àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n tó wà lọ́gbà a ẹ̀wọ̀n lórílẹ̀ èdè e Sáínà padà sílé
en: Prisoners who were in Chinese prisons were repatriated

yo: Ọlọ́run kò dà bí ènìyàn, ènìyàn aronipin.
en: God is not like a man, a rational man.

yo: Fẹ́mi Adéṣínà fi tó ìròyìn létí pé ààrẹ ti buwọ́lu ìwé àdéhùn náà.
en: Femi Adésina informed the news that the president has signed the agreement.

yo: Àjọ ìdìbò yóò rí i dájú pé kò sí ìwà màgò-mágó ní ìgbà ìdìbò.
en: The Election Commission will ensure that there is no fraud during the election.

yo: Bírí-bírí layé ń yí bẹ́ẹ̀ ni àwa ẹ̀dá inú ẹ̀ ń yí pẹ̀lú.
en: The world is changing, so are we the creatures inside it.

yo: Adelé ní ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn.
en: Adele had an interview with reporters.

yo: Àwọn àgùnbánirọ̀ yóò ṣe ìkéde ìfẹ̀hónúhàn nípa ewu tó wà níbi ìwà ìbàjẹ́.
en: Doctors will make public announcements about the dangers of corruption.

yo: Àwọn ẹ̀sùn nípa ìwà ìbàjẹ́ tí àjọ náà gùnlé ni wọn yóò ri pé wọ́n yanjú rẹ̀.
en: Allegations of corruption in the organization will be resolved.

yo: Wọ́n dá ọ́fíìsì sílẹ̀ ní Ìlọrin láti máa mú àwọn ẹlẹ́ṣẹ̀.
en: They established an office in Ilorin to catch criminals.

yo: Ó rọ̀ wọ́n láti fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àjọ náà kí wọn lè ṣe àṣeyọrí.
en: He urged them to cooperate with the organization so that they can succeed.

yo: Ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga dá Kíkẹ́ láre gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wà nínú ìwé òfin.
en: The Supreme Court justified Kikike as it is in the constitution.

yo: Bí wọ́n ṣe ń paná ọ̀tẹ̀ kan ni òmíràn ń rú.
en: As they put down one rebellion, another one breaks out.

yo: Ṣebí bí ọ̀kan bá bàjẹ́ tọ́rọ doríkodò ẹlẹ́dàá ẹni là ń sá bá.
en: For example, if one is corrupted, we are running away from the creator.

yo: Nínú ẹjọ́ tí adájọ́ dá ni ó ti sọ pé olùfẹ̀sùnkàn náà kò ní ẹ̀rí tó le.
en: In the case made by the judge, he said that the accused did not have strong evidence.

yo: Ilé ẹjọ́ gíga da ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn tí wọ́n pè tako àṣeyọrí i Ọbásanjọ́
en: The High Court dismissed the appeal against the success of Obasanjo

yo: Ilé ẹjọ́ gíga ti gbàá gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ẹni tó jáwé olúborí nínú ètò ìdìbò ọdùn yìí
en: The Supreme Court has recognized him as the winner of this popular election.

yo: Adájọ́ náà dá ẹjọ́ ọ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn torí pé ẹjọ́ náà kò múná dóko tó.
en: The judge dismissed the complaint because the case was not effective enough.

yo: Àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ ẹlẹ́nu márùn-ún ilé ẹjọ́ ọ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn náà da ẹjọ́ náà sígbó.
en: The five members of the Court of Appeal rejected the case.

yo: Olùpẹ̀jọ́ náà kò ní ẹ̀rí tó múnádóko láti fi han àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ náà.
en: The plaintiff did not have effective evidence to show the courts.

yo: Ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga dá Abíọ́lá láre nínú ètò ìdìbò o ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó
en: The High Court acquitted Abiola in the Lagos state election process

yo: Ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga fi òǹtẹ̀ lu Abíọ́lá gẹ́gẹ́ bí olùborí ìdìbò tí ó wáyé.
en: The High Court stamped Abiola as the winner of the election.

yo: Aṣẹ̀dá a gbogbo ènìyàn olóore ìṣẹ̀dá, ta ni a ò bá fi ọpẹ́ fún?
en: The creator of all human beings, the benevolent creation, who would we not give thanks to?

yo: Ẹ jẹ́ ẹni tó ṣe é fọkàn tán àti ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè e Nàíjíríà rere.
en: Be a trustworthy person and a good Nigerian.

yo: Kí orílẹ̀ èdè le ní ìdàgbàsókè tó ní ìtumọ̀ ẹ jẹ́ kí á fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀.
en: So that the nation can have a meaningful development, let us cooperate.

yo: Àti ẹni tó mọ̀ ọ́, àtẹni tí ò mọ̀ ọ́ ni ó ń ṣe àfẹ́rí iṣẹ́ ẹ̀ rẹ.
en: And the one who knows you, the one who doesn't know you is the one who admires your work.

yo: Ó ní ìyípadà tí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ń fẹ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ ìjọba.
en: He has the change that Nigerians want from the government.

yo: Oúnjẹ tí mo fẹ́ràn jùlọ ni èkuru àti ẹ̀kọ́ pẹ̀lú ata díndín.
en: My favorite food is dust and rice with hot pepper.

yo: Èèyàn gbọdọ̀ mọ ojúse rẹ̀ láti jẹ onítara àti láti máa dáwọ́ lé wàhálà.
en: One must know his duty to be zealous and to stop trouble.

yo: Ìdàgbàsókè tó dé bá orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti bí ogún ọdún sẹ́yìn.
en: The development that has come to the nation of Nigeria since 20 years ago.

yo: Ìyàtọ̀ ńlá àti ìdàgbàsókè ló ti dé bá orílẹ̀ èdè e Nàìjíríà láti bí ogún ọdún sẹ́yìn.
en: A great difference and development has come to the country of Nigeria since 20 years ago.

yo: Ìgbìmò àwọn aṣòfin ń ṣe ìpàdé ní inú ilé lọ́dọ̀ Ààrẹ
en: The council of legislators is holding a meeting in the house of the President

yo: Adébáyọ̀ jẹ́ àlejò pàtàkì níbi ayẹyẹ ọ̀hún náà àmọ́, kò wá.
en: Adébayo was a special guest at that party but he did not come.

yo: Ọkùnrin kì í ṣe ọkùnrin lásán, ẹni tó ní ọkàn akin ní í ṣe
en: A man is not just a man, he is a man with a brave heart

yo: Ìyàwó náà ya ọ̀bùn gbogbo inú ilé ló ti ń rùn rádaràda.
en: The wife was surprised that the whole house was smelling bad.

yo: Lára àwọn ènìyàn pàtàkì tí ó wà níbi ayẹyẹ ọ̀hún ni Adébáyọ̀ Sàlámì
en: Adébayo Salami was among the important people present at that ceremony

yo: Ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ ti ń jẹ̀gbádùn ètò ààbò tó péye.
en: Oyo State has been enjoying an adequate security system.

yo: Ìjọbá ti pèsè omi ẹ̀rọ fún àwọn ará ìlú Irédé.
en: The government has provided water for the people of Irédé.

yo: Gbogbo adìrẹ àwọn Mogbọ́njúbọ́lá ló ti kú lóríi kọ́ọ́lí tó ń ṣe wọ́n.
en: All the leaders of Moggonjubola have died on the way they were made.

yo: Mo wá láti rí adarí ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wa, ààrẹ Bùhárí láti sọ nípa bí ìpínlẹ̀ mí ṣe ń ṣe sí
en: I came to see the leader of our party, president Buhari to tell about how my state is doing to

yo: Mo ní ànfààní láti sọ fún ààrẹ Bùhárí nípa ìdàgbàsókè ìlú mi.
en: I had the opportunity to tell President Buhari about the development of my city.

yo: Ìyàwó ààrẹ pe àwọn tó fẹ́ dìbò ipò ààrẹ sí ibi àṣèjẹ ẹ̀ kan.
en: The wife of the president invited those who want to vote for the position of president to a party.

yo: Ààrẹ yan Adékúnlé gẹ́gẹ́ bi igbákejì ẹni tí ó gbégbá orókè.
en: The president appointed Adékunlé as the deputy of the person who won the election.

yo: Ó gbé ọmọ náà lọ sí ilé ìtura, ìyàwó o rẹ̀ ká wọn nínú aṣemáṣe náà.
en: He took the child to the hotel, his wife was tired of the accident.

yo: Obìnrin tí ó bímọ ti fara gba oríṣiríṣi ìwọ̀sí láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn ẹbí, ará àti ọ̀rẹ́.
en: A woman who has given birth has suffered various attacks from family, relatives and friends.

yo: Ọ̀mọ̀wé Ẹlẹ́ṣin, ni yóò dípò o Oyèwálé, tí ó fẹ̀yìntì ní ọjọ́ kejì.
en: The Equestrian Scholar, will replace Oyewale, who retired the next day.

yo: Ọmọ ọba náà kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ gboyè èyí tó jẹ́ ìdùnnú fún ọba gan-an.
en: The king's son studied well which was very happy for the king.

yo: Ọ̀mọ̀wé Ẹlẹ́ṣin jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn adarí nílé ìfowópamọ́ àgbáyé.
en: The Equestrian Scholar is one of the world's leading financial institutions.

yo: Ìdásílẹ̀ ẹ Àmọ̀tẹ́kùn lòdì sí òfin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjiríà ọdún yìí.
en: The establishment of this year is against the constitution of Nigeria.

yo: Àwọn òṣèré tún pàdánù ọ̀kan lára àwọn akẹgbẹ́ ẹ wọn.
en: Actors also lost one of their companions.

yo: Ọkọ̀ olùkọ́ kan bá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìpànìyàn pàdé nígbà tí ó ń padà láti ibi iṣẹ́.
en: A teacher's husband encountered a murder case while returning from work.

yo: Agbẹjọ́rò fún ìjọba àpapọ̀ ṣàlàyé pé, ọ̀rọ̀ ààbò jẹ ojúṣe ìjọba àpapọ̀.
en: The lawyer for the federal government explained that security is the responsibility of the federal government.

yo: Ẹ kúulé là ń kárá ilé, ẹ káàbọ̀ là ń kérò ọ̀nà.
en: We are going home, we are welcoming you, we are planning the way.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ ìyá méjì náà gbé ẹjọ́ ara wọn lọ sílé-ẹjọ́.
en: The two mothers took their case to court.

yo: Ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà yọ àwọn tó ń ṣi agbára lò.
en: The Supreme Court of Nigeria removed those who abuse power.

yo: Bùhárí ti yan ẹni tó máa gbapò lọ́wọ́ ẹ̀ bó bá kúrò lórí oyè.
en: Buhari has chosen the person who will succeed him if he leaves office.

yo: Ìyá àti ọmọ mẹ́ta kú sínú ìjam̀bá ọkọ̀ ní Àkúrẹ́.
en: A mother and three children died in a car accident in Akure.

yo: Adájọ́ ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga ṣubú lu àìsàn lójijì lẹ́yìn tó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bọ́ lọ́wọ́ àìsàn kan.
en: The high court judge fell ill suddenly after recovering from an illness.

yo: Ẹní tó bá relé ewu tó bọ̀, ká kí i kú ewu ni.
en: The one who relays the coming danger, let him die in danger.

yo: Ó ṣeéṣe kí wọ́n yọ Tinúubú kúrò lára àwọn olùdíje fún ipò aàrẹ.
en: It is possible that Tinubu will be removed from the candidates for the presidency.

yo: Múyìíwá Adémọ́lá ní ilé-ẹjọ́ yóò sún ẹjọ́ náà síwájú di ọjọ́ kẹrìnlá.
en: Ademola's appearance in court will postpone the case until the 14th.

yo: Ìrántí àwọn ológun: Ọ̀síbàjò gbóṣùbà fún àwọn tó fẹ̀mí i wọn lélẹ̀
en: Military Remembrance: Osibajo pays tribute to those who lost their lives

yo: Wọ́n sọ ọkùnrin náà sẹ́wọ̀n wọ́n sì gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé àwọn dúkìá a rẹ̀.
en: They put the man in jail and confiscated his property.

yo: Ọ̀síbàjò fi àwọn alátìlẹ́yìn lọ́kàn balẹ̀ pé dídùn lọsàn ó ṣo.
en: Osibajo reassured the supporters that it was a pleasant day.

yo: Oníṣègùn ní ọdún mẹ́rin ló kù fún Kẹmi Afọlábí láti lò láyé.
en: Khemi Adolabi has four years left to live as a doctor.

yo: Wọ́n jí arábìnrin Bámiṣé gbé nínú ọkọ gígùn ní ìlú Èkó.
en: Bamishé's sister was abducted in a long boat in the city of Eko.

yo: Owó oyin jẹ́ owó tó lówó lórí púpọ̀ àmọ́ èèyàn lásán ò lè ṣe é.
en: Bee money is a very expensive money but ordinary people cannot do it.

yo: Ẹni tó kó sí inú ilé oyin ní ìjẹjọ jẹ́ ọlọ́run nípè.
en: The one who put in the beehive in judgment is called god.

yo: Lẹ́yìn ọdún méje Ọlọ́run dá òṣèré náà àti ọkọ rẹ̀ lóhùn.
en: After seven years God answered the actress and her husband.

yo: Mákindé ti fi ẹlòmíràn rọ́pò igbákejì rẹ̀ fún ìdìbò tó ń bọ̀ lónà.
en: Makinde has replaced his deputy for the upcoming election.

yo: Láyé àtijọ ni òògùn wà, ǹjẹ́ a ṣì le sọ pé òògùn wà?
en: In ancient times there was medicine, can we still say that there is medicine?

yo: Ẹgbèrún mẹ́ta làwọn ará ìlú yóò ma wọ ọkọ̀ ojú irin.
en: Three thousand citizens will board the train.

yo: Àwọn àjòjì ló ń ṣe fàyàwọ́ wọnú orílẹ̀ èdè e Nàìjíríà.
en: Foreigners are trying to enter the country of Nigeria.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ dáná sun gbọ́mọ gbọ́mọ kan ní ìgboro Ìbàdàn.
en: Young people set fire to a fire in Ibadan street.

yo: Mótò ti wà fuń títà ní ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn bàbá a Jídé ọlọ́kọ̀.
en: There is a car for sale from the fathers of Jídé oleko.

yo: Ọọ̀ni bẹ ìjọba kí wọ́n mú àdínkù bá àwọn ọ̀wọ́ngógó oúnjẹ.
en: Oni asked the government to reduce the amount of food.

yo: Ilé-ẹjọ́ yóò sọ bóyá Adédoyin àti àwọn òṣiṣẹ́ rẹ̀ yóò jẹ́jọ́ lọ́sẹ̀ yìí.
en: The court will say whether Adédoyin and his staff will be tried this week.

yo: Ọkọ ṣá ìyàwó rẹ̀ ládàá yánna yànna, ó ní kò jẹ́ kí òun ṣe 'kinní'.
en: The husband scolded his wife, saying that he did not let her do 'what'.

yo: Ìròyìn tó ń tó wa létí ni pé wọ́n ti ilé-ìtajà afẹ́fẹ́ ẹ gáàsì pa.
en: The news that comes to our attention is that the gas station has been closed.

yo: Ìjà bẹ́ sílẹ̀ láàárín àwọn ọmọ ẹlẹgbẹ́ òkùnkùn ní ìlú Ìbàdàn.
en: A fight broke out between the children of darkness in the city of Ibadan.

yo: Kíkẹ́ purọ́ pé òun lóyún ni ó bá jí ọmọ ọjọ́ mẹ́fà gbé
en: Lying that she was pregnant, she abducted a six-day-old child

yo: Àwọn àjòjì ni wọ́n fi ń ṣe ètùtù ní ìlú náà.
en: Atonement was done by foreigners in the city.

yo: A lọ sí abúlé e ilẹ̀-Ọlújìí lọ ṣe ọdún iṣu tuntun.
en: We went to the village of Olujii to celebrate the new year.

yo: Ó léwu kí a máa lo ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ tí a bá ń lo afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì dáná
en: It is dangerous to use a mobile phone while using a gas stove.

yo: A ó fún wọn nílẹ̀ tí wọn yóò gbé máa ta afẹ́fẹ́ ẹ gáàsì.
en: We will give them land where they will live and sell gas.

yo: Àìmoye ọkọ̀ àti ẹ̀mí ló ṣòfò ní Bẹ́gà nínú ìjàm̀bá iná tó ṣẹlẹ̀.
en: Countless vehicles and lives were lost in Bega in the fire accident that occurred.

yo: Àdó olóró kan bú gbàmù ní ìpínlẹ̀ Òǹdó gbogbo aráàlú ń sá kíjokíjo.
en: A poisonous bomb exploded in Ondo state and all citizens are running away.

yo: Ewúrẹ́ jẹ gbogbo ẹ̀gẹ́ tí ìyá Àdìsá sá síta.
en: Goats ate all the traps Adisa's mother escaped from.

yo: Ọ̀kẹ́ àìmọye àwọn tó ti jáde ní ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ gíga ló ń wáṣẹ́ lẹ́yìn ẹ̀kọ́.
en: Millions of people who have graduated from higher education are looking for work after education.

yo: Adarí ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, Babájídé Sanwó-Olú ti yí ohùn padà lórí ọ̀rọ̀ ọ rẹ̀.
en: The leader of the state of Lagos, Babajídé Sanwó-Olu has changed his voice on his words.

yo: Awọn aṣáájú ẹgbẹ́ ẹlẹ́sìn àbáláyé ti ṣèkìlọ̀ fún àwọn olóṣèlú.
en: World religious leaders have warned politicians.

yo: Àjọ tó ń mójú tó ìwà ìbàjẹ́ ti gbé ọkùnrin náà lọ sí ilé-ẹjọ́, ó lóun ò jẹ̀bi.
en: The organization that deals with corruption has taken the man to court, he is not guilty.

yo: Èyí ni ìlérí tí àwọn tó pa Olúwabámiṣé kò jẹ́ kó wá sí ìmúṣẹ.
en: This is the promise that those who killed Lord Bamishe did not allow to come true.

yo: Wọ́n ju òkú náà sílẹ̀ lórí eré wọ́n ṣì ṣíná ọkọ̀.
en: They threw the dead body on top of the game while the car was still burning.

yo: Ṣèyí Mákíndé ṣe ìfilọ́lẹ̀ ẹ ọjọ́ ìrántí àwọn ológun.
en: This is Makinde's commemoration of the soldiers.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ Tinúubú yarí pátápátá lẹ́hìn tí wọ́n gbọ́ èsì ìbò.
en: The children of Tinuubú were completely surprised after hearing the results of the vote.

yo: Olópàá gba owó àbẹ̀tẹ́lẹ̀ láti fi àwọn ọ̀daràn náà sílẹ̀.
en: The police took a bribe to release the criminals.

yo: Ó rọ̀ wọ́n láti máa ṣàtìlẹyìn fún àwọn ẹbí tí àwọn olóògbé náà fi sílẹ̀.
en: He urged them to support the families left behind by the deceased.

yo: Ó yẹ kí á máa ṣàtìlẹyìn fún àwọn ọmọ-ogun tó farapa.
en: We should support the wounded soldiers.

yo: Ọwọ́ tẹ àwọn tó ń fi ipá gba owó tó sì ń parọ́ pé òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba ni àwọn.
en: Hands down those who take money by force and lie that they are government employees.

yo: Ogun náà ti sọ ọ̀pọ̀ di aláàbọ̀ ara, opó àti ọmọ òrukàn.
en: The war has made many disabled, widowed and orphaned.

yo: Ohun gbogbo ló ń wọ́n sí i láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ìṣèjọba Bùhárí
en: Everything has been going against him since the beginning of Buhari's administration

yo: Wọ́n bá òkú ọmọkùnrin kan ní ilé ọba gbogbo ìlú dàrú.
en: They found the dead body of a boy in the king's house.

yo: Arákùnrin kan bú sẹ́kún lẹ́yìn tí ó fi owó iyebíye ta tẹ́tẹ́ tí ó sì pàdánù rẹ̀.
en: A brother cried after he bet with precious money and lost it.

yo: Àjọ àwọn òṣèrè ti yọ ọ̀kan lára wọn kúrò nínú ẹgbẹ torí ìwà a rẹ̀.
en: The actors union has removed one of them from the group because of his behavior.

yo: Ó dára kí a máa ṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún àwọn tó nílò ìrànlọ́wọ́.
en: It is good that we help those who need help.

yo: Ata tí a fọwọ́ lọ̀ dára ju ata tí a fẹ̀rọ̀ lọ̀ lọ: ìyá àgbà ló ṣọ bẹ́ẹ̀.
en: Pickled pepper is better than crushed pepper: my grandmother used to keep it that way.

yo: Odún méwàá sí ìsin-ìn Nàìjíríà yóò ti di ògbóǹtarìgì nípa ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé.
en: Ten years from now, Nigeria's religion will have become an expert in modern technology.

yo: Gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ni yóò ti ní ìmọ̀ nípa ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé.
en: All Nigerians will have knowledge of modern technology.

yo: Fún ohun gbogbo tí mo ti ṣe fún ẹ, kò yẹ kí o san-án padà bayìí.
en: For everything I have done for you, you should not repay me like this.

yo: Ṣebí wọ́n ní wèrè dùn-ún wò lọ́jà, kò ṣe é bí lọ́mọ.
en: As if they were crazy to taste it in the market, it is not like a child.

yo: Bàbá Àyìnlá Adédiwúrà di olóògbé.
en: Aintlá Adédiwura's father passed away.

yo: Gbogbo ẹ̀rù ìyàwó yálà kékére ni àbí títóbi ni wọ́n ti kó nílẹ̀.
en: All the fears of the wife, whether small or big, have been put to rest.

yo: Ààrẹ gbàdúrá pé kí Ọlọ́run tu àwọn ẹbí olóògbé náà nínú.
en: The President prayed that God comfort the families of the deceased.

yo: Ọlọ́pàá mẹ́rìnléláàádọ́rin gba ìgbéga lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kogí
en: 74 police officers have been promoted in Kogi state

yo: Ó ṣe ohun amóríyá fún àwọn ọlọ́pàá tó ti ṣe gudu gudu méje, yàyà mẹfà lẹ́nu iṣẹ́.
en: It was an exciting thing for the policemen who had done seven gudu gudu, leaving six out of commission.

yo: Ìgbéga náà jẹ́ ara akitiyan adarí ilé-isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
en: The promotion is part of the efforts of the Nigerian police chief.

yo: Àwọn olùkọ́ lọ sí ibi ìdánwò ìgbéga sí ipò tí ó kàn.
en: The teachers went to the exam for promotion to the next position.

yo: Kí ó lè dára fún ọ, àti kí ìwọ lè pẹ́ ní ayé.
en: That it may be good for you, and that you may live long in the world.

yo: Ẹni tó gbégbáorókè nínú ìdíje eré sísá gba àmì ẹ̀yẹ àgbáyé.
en: The winner of the race wins the world medal.

yo: Ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ ti pàdánù àwọn ọba mẹ́ta tó lágbára ní àárín ìgbà díẹ̀.
en: Oyo State has lost three powerful kings within a short period of time.

yo: Ohun tí a bá fúrúgbìn ni a máa ká, èèyàn ò lè gbin ẹ̀fọ́ kí ó ká kòkó.
en: What we sow is what we reap, a person cannot plant grass and reap fruit.

yo: Wọ́n gbàdúrà fún ọgbọ́n, ìmọ̀ àti òye láti lè dájọ́ gidi.
en: They prayed for wisdom, knowledge and understanding in order to judge properly.

yo: Ènìyàn mọ́kàndínlógún pàdánù ẹ̀míi wọn ní ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Kogí.
en: Nineteen people lost their lives in Kogi state.

yo: Òṣèré kan pàdánù ọmọ kan ṣoṣo tó bí gbogbo àwọn ẹbí àti ọ̀rẹ́ lọ ń ṣe àtìlẹyìn fun.
en: An actor lost his only child who was supported by all his family and friends.

yo: Kò sí àwáwí tàbí ẹjọ́ kankan fún èèyàn tàbí ẹgbẹ́ nípa gbiǵba ẹ̀mí àwọn áláìsẹ̀.
en: There is no excuse or lawsuit for a person or group for taking the lives of the innocent.

yo: Gbígbẹ̀san nípa gbígba ẹ̀mí máa ń jẹ́ kí ìwà ipá gbilẹ̀ sí i.
en: Retaliating by taking a life leads to more violence.

yo: Èyí wà lára àwọn ohun tí ó ń fa wàhálà ní àwùjọ tí a wà nísinsìnyí.
en: This is one of the things that causes problems in the society we are in now.

yo: Ẹ ṣàtìlẹyìn fún ìjọba tó wà nípò: Abíọ́lá Ajímọ́bi.
en: Support the current government: Abiola Ajimobi.

yo: Wọ́n ṣètò àjò tó máa tọjú àwọn aláìsàn àti àwọn aláìní.
en: They organized a trip to take care of the sick and the needy.

yo: Ṣùgbọ́n kí ẹni tí ó ní nínú ọrọ̀ náà máa pèsè ohun rere fún àwọn tí kò ní.
en: But the one who has the wealth should provide good things for those who don't have it.

yo: Oríṣiríṣi ọgbọ́n ló sodo sínú àwọn orin ayé àtijọ́.
en: Various wisdoms are included in the songs of the ancient world.

yo: Bí a ba fi ọwọ́ ọ̀tún bá ọmọ wí a máa ń fi ọwọ́ òsì fa ọmọ náà mọ́ra.
en: If we scold a child with the right hand, we use the left hand to hug the child.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn èèyàn ló ti ṣẹ̀ mí, èmi náà sì ti ṣẹ ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn èèyàn.
en: Many people have wronged me, and I have wronged many people.

yo: Ó yẹ kí a ní ẹ̀mí ìdáríjì kí a sì jẹ́ kí ohun tó ti kọjá kọjá lọ.
en: We should have a spirit of forgiveness and let bygones be bygones.

yo: Adarí fún àwọn ọmọ ọgọ́fà tí wọ́n bí lọ́jọ́ ọdún tuntun lẹ́bùn.
en: Leader for the 100 children who were born on the day of the new year gift.

yo: Àròkàn àròkàn ní ń fa ẹkún àsun-ǹ-dá.
en: Sorrowful sorrow is causing the weeping of the dead.

yo: Kò sí ẹni tí òye yé, kò sí ẹni ti ó ń wá ọlọ́run.
en: No one understands, no one seeks God.

yo: Kò dára kí èèyàn fojú pa ẹlòmíràn rẹ́ torí a ò mọ ẹni tó lè ṣeni lóore.
en: It is not good for a person to look at someone else because we do not know who can be kind.

yo: Gbogbo èèyàn ló ní ìdí tí a fi dá wà, ìpè oníkálukú ló yàtọ̀
en: Everyone has a reason to be alone, each person's calling is different

yo: Èmi náà tí ṣòwò o káràkátà rí ní ọjà Gbági nílùú Ìbàdàn.
en: I also used to trade in Gbagi market in Ibadan.

yo: Ààrẹ ti bá àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà yọ àyájọ́ ọdún tuntun.
en: The president has wished Nigerians a happy new year.

yo: Ọlámídé kọ lẹ́tà sí àwọn òbí ẹ̀ láti ilé-ìwe ẹ̀kọ́ gíga.
en: Olamidé wrote a letter to his parents from high school.

yo: Ìpolówó ọjà ní ayé àtijọ́ yàtọ̀ gédégédé sí ti òde òní
en: Advertising in the ancient world was completely different from today

yo: Àtúnṣe ti dé bá iṣẹ́ ọ̀gbìn ni gbogbo orígun mẹ́rẹ̀ẹ̀rin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.
en: Reform has come to agriculture in all the four corners of Nigeria.

yo: Omọ́wùmí ti fẹ́rakù, níṣe ló ń sín itọ́ kiri.
en: The soul has died, why is it spitting?

yo: Ìjọba ti ṣe àṣeyọrí lórí iṣẹ́ afárá kejì Ekó tí ó ń lọ lọ́wọ́.
en: The government has succeeded in the ongoing Eko second bridge project.

yo: Ojú ọ̀nà a márosẹ̀ tí ó wà ní Èkó sí Ìbàdàn àti èyí tí ó wà ní Àbújá sí Èkó
en: The route from Lagos to Ibadan and from Abuja to Lagos

yo: A tún gbé ìgbésẹ̀ lọ́dún tó lọ yìí láti se isẹ́ lórí ojú ìrìnnà ọkọ̀.
en: We also took steps this past year to work on the road.

yo: Iṣẹ́ ti lọ lójú u pópó ti Àpápá sí Òwòròǹshòkí.
en: Work has gone before him on the road from Apapa to Oworonshok.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ máa ń ba ara wọn sọ èyí tó jẹ́ òdodo ọ̀rọ̀.
en: Friends always tell each other what is right.

yo: Yóò tún jẹ́ kí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè gbóunjẹ fẹ́gbẹ́-gbàwobọ̀.
en: It will also make the country's economy flourish.

yo: Wàhálà lórí ìná a mọ̀nà-mọ́ná ti wà láti ìgbà ìwásẹ̀.
en: The stress on the fire has been there since the beginning of time.

yo: A ti gbé ìgbésẹ̀ láti bá àwọn tí ọ̀rọ̀ náà kàn sọ̀rọ̀ láti wá ojútùú sí ìṣòro ọ̀hún.
en: We have taken steps to talk to those affected to find a solution to the problem.

yo: Ààrẹ ṣàlàyé ìpinnu rẹ̀ láti gbógun ti ìsẹ́ àti òṣì lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.
en: The President explained his determination to fight unemployment and poverty in Nigeria.

yo: Ọmọlúàbí kì í ṣe àìgbọ́ràn bẹ́è ni kì í ṣe inúnibíni sí ẹnìkejì i rẹ̀.
en: Kindness is not disobedience and it is not persecution of others.

yo: A ó tẹ̀síwájú láti ṣe àwọn àtúnṣe tó mọ́nyánlórí nípa ètò ẹ̀kọ́ àti omi.
en: We will continue to make important reforms regarding the education and water system.

yo: A ó túbọ̀ máa fọwọ́sowọ̀pọ́ pẹ̀lú ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ àti ìbílẹ̀.
en: We will cooperate more with the state and local government.

yo: Owó oṣù àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ yóò ṣe wọ́n ní ànfààní ní àsìkò tí wọ́n bá san owó o wọn.
en: The salary of the workers will benefit them in time if they pay their money.

yo: A ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní máa san àwọn owó tí wọn jẹ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ fẹ̀yìntì fún ìgbà pípẹ́ báyìí.
en: We have started to pay the pensions owed to the retired workers for a long time now.

yo: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ni ọrọ̀ ajé Nàìjíríà yóò burẹ́kẹ́ síi.
en: The Nigerian economy will be blessed by the parliament.

yo: Bí mo bá jí ma rorín kí jeyínjeyín máa sá fún mi.
en: If I wake up, don't laugh so that you will run away from me.

yo: Mo ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ohun tí mo fẹ́ ṣe àmọ́, owó ni kò sí.
en: I have many things I want to do but there is no money.

yo: Ọmọ ọba kì í ṣojo, bẹ́ẹ̀ ọmọ ọba kì í ṣiṣẹ́ ẹrú.
en: A king's son does not work, nor does a king's son work as a slave.

yo: Àwọn ohun èlò ìsọmọlórúkọ ni à máa ń lọ láti fi ṣàdúrà fún ìkókó.
en: We use pronouns to pray for babies.

yo: Bàbá mi lọ sí ibi ìpàdé àwọn lèmọ́mù Irédé àti àgbègbè e rẹ̀.
en: My father went to the meeting place of the people of Irédé and its area.

yo: Abẹnugan wá kí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà nílé, lóko àti lájò kú ọdún tuntun.
en: Abenugan wishes all Nigerians at home, on and off the new year.

yo: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin bá Nàìjíríà yọ̀, ó pè fún ẹ̀mí ìṣọkan.
en: Abenugan of the House of Assembly congratulated Nigeria and called for a spirit of unity.

yo: Ààrùn ẹ̀jẹ̀ rúru jẹ́ àìsàn kan tó ń pọ̀ sii torí àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ àwùjọ.
en: Tuberculosis is a disease that is increasing due to social factors.

yo: Owó ní tí òhun ò bá sí nílé kí ẹnìkẹ́ni máṣe dá ìmọ̀ràn òhun.
en: It is money if there is nothing at home so that no one can give advice.

yo: Wọ́n kì wọ́n nílọ̀ pé kí wọ́n má lo òògùn fúnra wọn mọ́.
en: They don't want to stop using drugs themselves.

yo: A kò gbọdọ̀ dákẹ́ àdúrà wa pàápàá jùlọ fún ìsọ̀kan àti ìbágbépọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
en: We must not be silent in our prayers especially for the unity and coexistence of this country.

yo: Kí Ọdún yìí jẹ́ ọdún àṣeyọrí fún gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
en: May this year be a successful year for all Nigerians.

yo: Mo fẹ́ ọkùnrin tó ní sùúrù tó sì máa fẹ́ mi bí bàbá mi ṣe fẹ́ ìyá mi.
en: I want a man who is patient and will love me like my father loves my mother.

yo: Adarí ìpínlẹ̀ tí bọwọ́lu àbádòfin ètò ìsúná ọdún yìí
en: The state leader signed this year's budget

yo: Ẹní bá dúpé ore òní yóò rí ti ọjọ́ mìíràn gbà.
en: If a person is grateful for a friend today, he will receive another day.

yo: Aago wo ni ẹ fẹ́ lọ sí òde olókùú, ṣé ẹ mọ̀ pé ẹ ò gbọdọ̀ pẹ́?
en: What time do you want to go to the grave, do you know that you must not be late?

yo: Àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ kán wà tó máa bíni nínú àmọ́ kò yẹ kí ènìyán fèsì.
en: There are some words that will make people angry but people should not react.

yo: Àrokobọ́dúndé là ń kí àgbè, ojú gbooro là ń kí onídìrí.
en: Arokobobundede greets the language, wide-eyed greets the visionary.

yo: Adarí ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun bọwọ́lu àbádòfin ètò ìṣúná ọdún yìí
en: The governor of Osun signed the budget plan for this year

yo: Olódo ràbàtà kì í bá wọn duyè aṣáájú ilé-ìwé.
en: Olódo Rabata does not deserve the leadership of the school.

yo: Àwọn oníwádìí ti ṣàwárí ẹranko tuntun tí wọn kò rí rí.
en: Researchers have discovered a new animal that has never been seen before.

yo: Ọjọ́ kẹ́rìnlélógún, oṣú kejìlá, ọdún yìí ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú náà fẹnukò lórí ètò ìsúná náà.
en: The twenty-fourth day, the twelfth month, of this year at the House of Representatives voted on the budget plan.

yo: Èyí túmọ̀ sí pé ọ̀pọ̀ ò le dáhùn àwọn ìbéèrè tí wọ́n fi wá wọn lẹ́nu wò.
en: This means that many cannot answer the questions that are put to them.

yo: Wọ́n ṣe ìdàkọ ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò náà ní ọ̀rọ̀ fún ọ̀rọ̀.
en: The interview was transcribed word for word.

yo: Wọ́n rí òkú ọmọkùnrin tó kó sódò yọ ní ìrọ̀lẹ́ láti àárọ̀ tí wọ́n ti ń gbìyànjú.
en: They found the body of a boy who had been trying to get rid of it in the evening.

yo: Ìjọba Nàìjíríà ti sanwó oúnjẹ fún àwọn ọmọ ilé-ìwé fún ọdún tó kọjá.
en: The Nigerian government has paid for school children's meals for the past year.

yo: Kì í ṣe gbogbo àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ ni ẹ̀kọ́ ọ̀fẹ́ ti wà.
en: Not all states have free education.

yo: Àwọn oníṣègùn ti gba àwọn èèyàn níyàjú láti máa ṣe àyẹ̀wò.
en: Doctors have encouraged people to get tested.

yo: Wọ́n ṣèlérí láti pèsè oúnjẹ àti èròǹjà oúnjẹ fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ọ̀hún.
en: They promised to provide food and nutrition for those students.

yo: Àjọ tó ń ṣègbèfábo ti rọ àwọn obìnrin láti má dúró sínú ìgbéyàwó tí kò dára.
en: The charity has urged women not to stay in bad marriages.

yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ń ṣe ìpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn adarí àjọ elétò ààbò.
en: The president of Nigeria is holding a meeting with the leaders of the security organization.

yo: Ìpàdé ń lọ lọ́wọ́ láàárín àwọn aṣòfin, ààrẹ, àwọn aṣojú lóríṣiríṣi ní ìlú u Àbújá.
en: A meeting is going on between the parliamentarians, the president, various representatives in the city of Abuja.

yo: Ẹ jẹ́ ká wá ojú rere Ọlọ́run fún ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè e Nàìjíríà.
en: Let us seek God's favor for the development of the nation of Nigeria.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ti rọ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ látí gba ààwè àti àdúrà.
en: The youth group has urged the youth to receive prayer and prayer.

yo: Atiro ń ṣe ẹsẹ̀ láńkáláńká; arọ ò lọ́wọ́-nbẹ́sẹ̀.
en: Atiro is making a slow move; the cripple cannot walk.

yo: Olùṣọ́ tún wá rọ̀ wọ́n láti jáwọ́ nínú ẹ̀ṣẹ̀, kí wọn sì wá ojú rere Ọlọ́run.
en: The watchman also urged them to stop sinning and seek God's favor.

yo: Ọlọ́run ò bá gbogbo ẹni tó ń gbé inú òkùnkùn tafà sínú ìmọ́lẹ̀ wí.
en: God does not rebuke all those who live in darkness into the light.

yo: Kìí ṣe ìdùnnú olùkọ́ kí ó kọ́ ọmọ kí ọmọ má mọ nǹkan tí wọ́n kọ́ ọ.
en: It is not a teacher's pleasure to teach a child so that the child does not know what he was taught.

yo: Àsìkò ìtura ni àsìkò ààwẹ̀ jẹ́ fún gbogbo àwọn mùsùlùmí.
en: Fasting is a time of relaxation for all Muslims.

yo: Ẹ pa ọlọ́tẹ̀ àti àwọn alákatakítí ẹlẹ́sìn run lórílẹ̀ èdè e Nàìjíríà.
en: Destroy the rebels and religious extremists in Nigeria.

yo: Àwọn ewé máa ti sùn ní bí aago mẹ́fà bí o bá fẹ́ lọ já wọn.
en: The leaves will be asleep by 6 o'clock if you want to cut them.

yo: Wọn pa Tolúlọpé tó jẹ́ awakọ̀ òfurufú kan lẹ́yìn ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ wàhálà.
en: They killed Tolúlópe who was a pilot after many hardships.

yo: Àwọn ìyáálé ilé jáde síta wọ́n tẹ́wọ́gba ìyàwó tuntun.
en: Housewives went outside to welcome the new bride.

yo: Ìyàwó tó kéré jù bu omi sí ìyàwó lẹ́sẹ̀, ó sì gbàdúrà fun.
en: The younger wife sprinkled water on the bride's feet and prayed for her.

yo: Inú mi dún láti wà níbí yìí, nítorí ó ti pẹ́ tí mo ti rí àwọn ojú wọ̀nyí.
en: I am happy to be here, because it has been a long time since I saw these faces.

yo: Ayé àtijọ́ ni àwọn ènìyàn máa ń tẹ̀lé àṣà àti ìṣe kò rí bẹ́ẹ̀ mọ́ ní ìsinyìí
en: In the old world, people used to follow customs and practices, it is not like that anymore.

yo: Ẹ má ṣe fún wọn ní ìsinmi rárá torí wọ́n tí gba owó sọ́wọ́ tipẹ́.
en: Do not give them any rest because they have received money for a long time.

yo: Àjànàkú àwọn oníṣẹ́ ibi ti jẹ májèlé, wọ́n dẹran awo.
en: The violence of evildoers has been poisoned, and they are angry.

yo: Èmi ò ní yọ ẹnìkankan sílẹ̀ ní abẹ́ ìsàkóso ò mi.
en: I will not release anyone under my control.

yo: Èèyàn mọ́kànlélọ́gbọ̀n ni wọ́n tẹ̀ pa ní ibi tí wọ́n ti ń pín oúnjẹ ọ̀fẹ́.
en: Twenty-one people were killed at the place where they were distributing free food.

yo: Ààrùn kògbóògùn ń tàn kiri bí iná orí torí ọkùnrin àti obìnrin oníṣekúṣe.
en: Drug addiction is spreading like a fever because of immoral men and women.

yo: Owọ́ òfin ti tẹ ọkùnrin tí ó fi ipá bá ọmọ kékeré ní àjọṣepọ̀
en: The hand of the law has pressed the man who forcibly had sex with a minor child

yo: Ohun tí o bá ṣe gbọdọ̀ jẹ́ èyí tí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà yóò jẹ ànfààní rẹ̀.
en: What you do must be for the benefit of all Nigerians.

yo: Gọngọ sọ! Wáhálà bẹ́ sílẹ̀ bí wọ́n ṣe ń dín dùǹdú ìyà fún ara wọn nílé aṣòfin.
en: Gongo said! Trouble broke out as they tried to punish each other in the parliament.

yo: Ó rọ̀ wọ́n láti ṣe àtìlẹyìn fún ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin lórí àṣeyọrí i wọn.
en: He urged them to support the parliament on their success.

yo: Ó tún wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin fún àtìlẹyìn tí wọn ń ṣe fún un.
en: He also thanked the parliament for their support.

yo: Ohun mérìírí ló ń ṣẹlẹ̀ káàkiri àgbáyé, àdìtú ni iṣẹ́ olódùmarè.
en: Amazing things are happening around the world, mystery is the work of the mighty.

yo: Adarí ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó gbóṣùbà fún ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun fún ìpèsè àlàáfíà.
en: The governor of Lagos State has called on the military to ensure peace.

yo: À ń rìn nílẹ̀ inú ń bí ẹlẹ́ṣin, à ń jẹ̀fó sùn inú ń bí ẹlẹ́ran
en: We are walking on the ground as horses, we are sleeping as cattle

yo: Bá a bá ń bẹ láyé ẹ jẹ́ á ṣe ara wa lóore, bí a bá wà láàyè ẹ jẹ́ á da ọ̀rọ̀ ara wa rò.
en: If we are in this world, let us be kind to each other, if we are alive, let us think of each other's words.

yo: Ọba gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé àgùnbánirọ̀ pupa tó jáde ní ilẹ́-ẹ̀kó gíga
en: The king stepped on the red carpet that came out of the high ground

yo: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ ti rawọ́ lé iṣẹ́ àkanṣé kan ní agbègbè e ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn.

yo: Ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun bọwọlu àbádòfin ètò ìṣúná ọdún to kọjá sẹ́yìn.

yo: Ǹjẹ́ ìwọ mọ irúfẹ́ ọmọ tí Ìgè jẹ́ ko tó máa báa sọ̀rẹ́?

yo: Ó ṣe pàtàkì fún àwọn ìyá láti gba abẹ́rẹ́ ẹ rọmọ-lápá rọmọ-lẹsẹ̀ fún àwọn ọmọ.
en: It is important for mothers to get regular vaccinations for babies.

yo: Mo ṣe ìlérí fún orílẹ̀-èdè mi Nàìjíríà láti jẹ́ olótìítọ́ àti olódodo.
en: I promise my country Nigeria to be honest and fair.

yo: Àgbéga ti dé bá ìlànà àgbékalẹ̀ ojú òpó o ìdákọ́ńkọ́ àti ayélujára wa.
en: Agbega has come to terms with our infrastructure and infrastructure.

yo: Ẹ má jẹ́ kí àwọn ọlọ́tẹ̀ pín Nàìjíríà yẹ́lẹ-yẹ̀lẹ.

yo: Ìdí abájọ tí ìlú ọ̀wọ̀ fi rọ olóyè Ọlánipẹ̀kun lóyè kò tí ì farahàn.
en: The reason why the city of respect urged Olanipekun to take office has not yet appeared.

yo: Nàìjíríà ń ké pé: Dìde ẹ̀yin ará wa jẹ́pè Nàìjíríà.
en: Nigeria is calling: Stand up, our brothers, call Nigeria.

yo: Ìbànújẹ́ ńlá ni kọ́mọ́ ó tojú òbí fò sánlẹ̀ kó kú.
en: It was a great sadness when he saw his parent fall down and die.

yo: Ọkọ̀ òfurufú kan já sí oju títí ní Ìkẹjà nílùú Èkó èyí tí ó fa ìdíwọ́ lójú ọ̀nà.
en: A plane crashed in Ikeja in Lagos which caused a roadblock.

yo: Bojú bá yẹjú kóhùn má yẹ̀; ẹní tó bá dàlẹ̀ á bálẹ̀ lọ.

yo: Nàìjíríà yan ìgbìmọ̀ alámòójútó fún iná a mọ̀nà-mọ́ná.

yo: Àṣírí àwọn gbọmọ-gbọ́mọ tú ní Sókà nílùú Ìbàdàn.
en: The secret of those who knew it was revealed in Soka in the city of Ibadan.

yo: Ẹ̀là lọ̀rọ̀ a sọ̀rọ̀ ìyánrọ̀ ọjọ́sí, ṣebóhun ló ṣekú peléǹpe àná.
en: It's time to talk about old age, why did he die yesterday?

yo: Ọ̀fọ̀ ńlá ṣẹ Nàìjíríà, ẹni ire lọ nílẹ̀ ẹ káàárọ̀ oò jíire!.
en: A great mourning has come to Nigeria, the good person will go home soon!.

yo: Olóṣèlú á tan ará ìlú jẹ pẹ̀lú u tọ́rọ́ kọ́bọ̀ bí wọ́n bá dórí oyè wọ́n a gbàgbé ìlérí
en: Politicians will deceive the people of the city with him, if they hold their position, they will forget their promises.

yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n náà jẹ́ onímọ̀ nípa ìmọ̀ àti ẹ̀dá èdè ní ilé ìwé gíga Èkó.
en: The professor is a linguist at the University of Lagos.

yo: Ààrẹ bọwọ́lu ètò ìsúná ọdún tí a wà nínú ẹ̀ yìí.

yo: Ẹ̀rọ ìbanisọ̀rọ̀ jẹ́ ohun amáyédẹrùn ní ayé tí a wà yìí.
en: The communication device is a simple thing in this world.

yo: Ọba tá a bù tá ò le bù tán, ìjìnlẹ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ tí ń gbénú ènìyàn fọhùn.
en: A king who is bitten and cannot be bitten, the depth of words that make people speak.

yo: Ààrẹ Yar'Adua ti di olóògbé tí igbákejì rẹ̀ sì gorí oyè.
en: President Yar'Adua has passed away and his deputy has taken office.

yo: A ji pọnmi òwúrọ̀ kùtù-kùtù kì í pon omi rúrú.
en: We woke up early in the morning and didn't have hot water.

yo: Mọ̀wọ̀n ara ẹ; ìwọ̀n ara ẹni là á mọ̀!
en: Measure yourself; measure yourself!

yo: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin yóò gbógun ti òṣì àti ìṣẹ́.
en: The parliament will fight against poverty and suffering.

yo: Ta ní jẹ́ dúró de bílálà a àwọn anọmọgbọ́mọdè?
en: Who will wait to save the children?

yo: Gbogbo èèyàn ló ń dúró de àsìkò ọ̀tun ní orílẹ̀-èdè yìí, kí ọlọ́run dẹ́ẹ̀mí wa sí.
en: Everyone is waiting for the right time in this country, may God bless us.

yo: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ ti ṣètò òfin tí yóò gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn àti ìwà ọ̀daràn.
en: The House of Councilors has drafted legislation that will fight epidemics and crime.

yo: Wọ́n ṣe ìkìlọ̀ kí àwọn àjòjì máṣe dé ibi odò náà torí odò náà kò fẹ́ àlejò.
en: They warned foreigners not to come to the river because the river does not want visitors.

yo: Gbogbo kùdìẹ̀-kudiẹ ní wọn yóò mójú tó pàápàá jùlọ nípa iná a mọ̀nà-mọ́ná.
en: They will be aware of all the problems, especially the fire.

yo: Ohun tí o ò bá le gbà má fi lọ ẹlòmíràn mọ́.
en: What you can't take, don't give it to someone else.

yo: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ ni àwọn aṣòfin wà, síbẹ̀ wọ́n kínra wọn lẹ́yìn.
en: Although the legislators are from different parties, they are still behind them.

yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin kò ní jẹ́ kí ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ wá da ààrín wọn rú.
en: The parliament will not allow different groups to confuse them.

yo: Lọ́jọ́ ọjọ́sí, àní nígbà tójú wà lórúnkún gbogbo nǹkan ò le báyìí.
en: In old age, even when the eyes are on the knees, everything is not so hard.

yo: Iná a mọ̀nà-mọ́ná lọ káàkiri nígbà tí mo kọ́kọ́ dé ìlú ọba.
en: When I first arrived in the royal city, there was a lot of fire.

yo: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ ṣe gudugudu méje yààyà mẹfà lórí ọ̀nà Ọ̀yọ́ sí Ìṣẹ́yìn.
en: The Oyo state government made seven and six road trips on the road from Oyo to the end.

yo: Ikú pa abírí, abírí ti kú. Ikú pabìrì, abìrì í rọ̀run.
en: Death kills the tribe, the tribe is dead. Death is easy, easy.

yo: Kí lọmọ ilé-ìwé ń sun-un-run àsùnwatọ́ sí?
en: What about the school is destroying the good?

yo: Aláàfin ikú bàbá yèyé ti filẹ̀ ṣaṣọ bora.
en: The funeral of the father's death has left the veil.

yo: Ṣẹ̀kẹ̀rẹ̀ ò ní gbẹ́yìn, Agogo a máa ró kangó-kangó.
en: It will not be the end, the bell will be ringing.

yo: Wọ́n ní ìrètí pé ètò náà yóò fòpin ṣí rira epo láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè.
en: They hope that the program will stop buying oil from abroad.

yo: Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti ṣè ìpinnu láti fòpin sí ríra epo rọ̀bì láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè.
en: Nigeria has decided to stop buying rubber from abroad.

yo: Ààrẹ ti padà sí Nàíjíríà lẹ́yìn ìpàdé àpérò àlàáfíà lórílẹ̀ èdè e Amẹ́ríkà.
en: The president has returned to Nigeria after meeting the peace conference on the United States.

yo: Ààrẹ lọ sí ìlú Èkó láti lọ ṣe ìbẹ̀wò.
