yo: Ará sọ fun pé kò kúrò níbẹ̀ torí àjálù kán fẹ́ ṣẹlẹ̀ níbẹ̀.
en: Ará told him that he did not leave because a disaster was about to happen there.

yo: Kò bá wọn kẹ́gbẹ́kẹ́gbẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀ kò bá wọn rìnrìnkurìn torí ó gbẹ́kọ̀ọ́.
en: He didn't hang out with them, he didn't travel with them because he was studying.

yo: Àwọn ajá ń pariwo lóru lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n pariwo olè ní apá ilé kan.
en: Dogs are barking at night after they barked at a burglar in one part of the house.

yo: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ńlá kan ṣẹlẹ̀ kódà àwọn ọlọ́jà ò lọ sọ́jà.
en: A big incident happened and even the merchants did not go to the market.

yo: Mo nífẹ̀ẹ́ àwọn ẹbí mi ṣùgbọ́n tí a bá ti dépàdé báyìí ìjà ni ṣáá.
en: I love my family but if we meet now it will always be a fight.

yo: Lọlá ní àwọn ohun ọ̀sìn tó pọ̀, kò fẹ́rẹ̀ sí ohùn tí ẹ wá tẹ́ ò ní rí.
en: Lora has many animals, not nearly as loud as you come.

yo: Mo lọ sọ́dọ̀ ọ Túndé bí mo ṣe ń bọ̀ ni mo bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní gbọ́ ariwo oríṣiríṣi.
en: I went to you Tunde as I was coming I started to hear different noises.

yo: Ìyá à mi ra ìkòkò tuntun wá sílé lánàá.
en: My mother bought a new pot and came home yesterday.

yo: Ó gbóríyìn fún àwọn tó gbégbá orókè.
en: He praised those who reached the top.

yo: Ọmọkùnrin náà mọ ijó jó gidi gan an ni.
en: The boy really knows how to dance.

yo: Ọkọ ìyàwó pakuru mọ́ ìyàwó rẹ̀.
en: The groom hugs his wife.

yo: Ó gbé ọwọ́ lé e lórí, ó súre fúun.
en: He laid his hands on him and blessed him.

yo: Iná ti fẹ́ kú ní ìdí oúnjẹ tí ò ń sè kí ó tètè kó iná mọ́ ọ.
en: The fire is about to die because the food you are cooking will quickly catch fire.

yo: Mo ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ lórí ẹ̀ láti ijọ́ tí wọ́n ti fún mi.
en: I have been working on it since the day it was given to me.

yo: Mo fẹ́ràn àpọ̀n àmọ́ mi ò mọ̀ ọ́ sè.
en: I like it but I don't know how to cook it.

yo: Kí ló ṣe ẹ́ tí ò ń wami lójú bí egbére?
en: What is wrong with you that you are staring at me like a fool?

yo: Wọ́n bèrè ẹ ní ilé ìjọsìn ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó kọjá.
en: They asked him at the house of worship last week.

yo: Mo sọ pé o lọ ìrìn àjò kékeré kan pé o ò sì ní pẹ́ dé.
en: I said you went on a short trip and you won't be long.

yo: Kí ni màá fi san oore tó o ṣe fún mi báyìí?
en: How can I repay the kindness you have done for me now?

yo: Àwọn ọ̀tá ń lérí, ṣùgbọ́n ọ̀lọ́run ò jẹ́.
en: Enemies testify, but God does not.

yo: Olódù ọmọ àrè, ọba tá ò rí tí a ń rí iṣẹ́ ọwọ́ ọ rẹ̀.
en: Oloudu son of Arre, the invisible king whose handiwork we see.

yo: Ọba tá ò lè yiri ẹ̀ wò, ọba tó ń pèsè fún ẹni nígbà gbogbo.
en: A king who cannot be trusted, a king who always provides for one.

yo: Ìgbà tí àjọ kan ìyá Bùkúnmi ni ẹni tó ń gbàjọ ọ́ kú.
en: It was when Bukunmi's mother, the one who took care of you, died.

yo: Kò sí ohun tí a lè jẹ nílé.
en: There is nothing we can eat at home.

yo: Ìpàdé wà fún àwọn àgbẹ̀.
en: There is a meeting for farmers.

yo: Oore ni mo ṣe ló fẹ́ di ibi mọ́ mi lọ́wọ́.
en: It is my goodness that wants to hold evil in my hands.

yo: Wọ́n kó àwọn òfì lọ sí ibi tí wọn ó ti lù wọ́n.
en: They took the widows to the place where they were beaten.

yo: Ìdájọ wọn ni pé kí wọ́n yẹgi fun wọn.
en: Their judgment is that they should be spared.

yo: Ọjọ́ mẹ́rin ni ó lò lórí òkè.
en: He spent four days on the mountain.

yo: A ń kì í, à ń sà á, ó ní òun ò mẹni tó kú.
en: We are denying him, we are saving him, he said that he is not the one who died.

yo: A gbé ọ ga ẹni ìbẹrẹ̀ àti òpin.
en: We exalt you as the beginning and the end.

yo: Àyìndé tọ̀ sílé gbálagbàla, ó sọ pé omíyalé ló ṣẹlẹ̀.
en: The cow came home safe and sound, and said that it was a miracle.

yo: Ọmọ táà kọ́ yóò gbé ilé tí a kọ́ tà.
en: The child that we built will live in the house that we built and sold.

yo: Ojú mẹ́rin lóbímọ ṣùgbọ́n igba ojú ní ń wo ọmọ.
en: A child has four eyes, but only one eye looks at the child.

yo: Lára ẹrù ìdána ni èso ó wà.
en: Among the food is fruit.

yo: Morọ́mọkẹ́ jẹ́ ọmọ gíga ó sì tún dúdú.
en: Moromoke is a tall child and also black.

yo: Ọ̀dọ̀ ìyá àgbà ni Àlàbí ń gbé.
en: Álibi lives with his grandmother.

yo: Ọmọ rere ni yóò gbẹ̀yìn gbogbo wa.
en: He will be the last of us all to be a good son.

yo: Olùkọ́ ni àwọn òbí mi.
en: My parents are teachers.

yo: Ó fi agbada dín ẹran, ó sì yíi láta.
en: He covered the meat with a ladle and turned it over.

yo: Ó di ẹrù bí ẹni tó ń lọ sí ilé ọkọ.
en: He became a burden like a person going to the house of a husband.

yo: Àṣá gbé ọmọ adìyẹ dúdú méjì.
en: Asha brought two black chicks.

yo: Àṣáwọ̀ wà nínú oúnjẹ tí wọ́n gbé fún mi.
en: The food that was brought to me was dirty.

yo: Ọkùnrin náà rọ́ lu ọkọ̀ agbégilódò.
en: The man crashed into the truck.

yo: Mi ò rí ẹnìkankan dá mi lóhùn.
en: I didn't see anyone answer me.

yo: Ilé ijó kan ń bẹ lẹgbẹ̀ẹ́ odò.
en: There is a dance hall by the river.

yo: Ìfẹ́ tí ìyá ní sí ọmọ ò ṣeé fẹnu sọ.
en: The love a mother has for her child is indescribable.

yo: Ìròyìn yìí wà fún àwọn tó wà ní agbègbè yìí àti ìgbèríko rẹ̀.
en: This news is for those in this area and its countryside.

yo: Ibojì òkú náà kún fọ́fọ́.
en: The grave of the dead was full of dust.

yo: Ìdána náà wáyé láàárín ẹbí i Babájídé àti Fìjàbí.
en: The fire took place between the families of Babajídé and Fijábi.

yo: Wọ́n fi gbogbo ètò tó kù sí ọjọ́ ajẹ́.
en: They put all the rest of the plan to the witch's day.

yo: Ẹ̀ má ṣe bí ewúré, ẹran aláìgbọràn.
en: Do not be like goats, disobedient animals.

yo: Ó rí bí i pẹ̀tẹ́ẹ̀sì Ìdọ̀ha.
en: He saw the steps of Idoha.

yo: Àwọn kòkòrò tí jẹ gbogbo irè oko tí mo kó pamọ́ sóko.
en: Insects have eaten all the crops I have stored.

yo: Ọ̀kín lọba ẹyẹ, kìnìún lọba ẹranko.
en: A lion over a bird, a lion over an animal.

yo: Ìtàn ìṣẹ̀dálẹ̀ ìlú kọ̀ọ̀kan yàtọ̀ síra.
en: The history of each city is different.

yo: Èyí ni àrídájú pé ọlọ́run nífẹ̀ẹ́ wa torí ọmọ rẹ̀ ni a jẹ́.
en: This is the proof that God loves us because we are his children.

yo: Àjíǹde Jésù ni wọ́n ń ṣe àpéjọ fún.
en: They are holding a meeting for the resurrection of Jesus.

yo: Ǹjẹ́ èèyàn kan wà tó lè bá ọlọ́run jà?
en: Is there a person who can fight with god?

yo: Ní ibi ìkómọ Ọláolú, níṣe làdúrà ń lọ lọ́tùn-ún lósì.
en: At the place where the President was born, there was a prayer going on from left to right.

yo: Afẹ́fẹ́ oko ní ń fẹ́ ewé oko lámilámi, ẹ̀fúùfù lẹ̀lẹ̀ ní ń fẹ́ ewé àgbọn jìàjìà.
en: The field wind is blowing the leaves of the field, the wind is blowing the coconut leaves.

yo: Ilà ọwọ́ ọ̀ mi kó má dojú ìjà kọ mi nígbà tí mo bá nílò ore.
en: Line my hand not to fight against me when I need a friend.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló ti kú, ọ̀pọ̀ ló ti sọnù tá ò rí mọ́. ká ṣá maa dúpẹ́.
en: Many have died, many have disappeared and have never been found. let's always be thankful.

yo: Ìjà tó bẹ́ sílẹ̀ láàárín àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ méjì ò ṣe é parí.
en: The fight that broke out between two friends did not end.

yo: Bí a ti ń lọ tí à ń bọ̀ ibi kan náà ni a já sí
en: As we were going and coming back we came across the same place

yo: O ó dàgbàdàgbà níbẹ̀ bí ewé àgbagbà.
en: You will grow up there like an old leaf.

yo: A ò lè kó iyán ìwúlò èdè kéré torí òhun ni ọ̀pá tí ẹ̀yà á rọ̀ mọ́.
en: We can't underestimate the importance of language because it is the stick that the race hangs on.

yo: Bí èdè Yorùbá ṣe di kíkọ sílẹ̀ kò ṣẹ̀yìn Àjàyí àti àwọn ajíhìnrere.
en: As the Yoruba language became written it did not stop Ajayi and the evangelists.

yo: Bí ó ti mọ ni ó mọ ọkọ ìyàwó ó ṣe ìlọ́dìí
en: When he knew he knew the groom he objected

yo: Ọlọ́kùnrìn dínwó babaláwo dín òògùn òwe to jẹ mọ́ ẹsẹ ifá ni.
en: It is the proverbial medicine that sticks to the feet of a sword.

yo: Ọmọdé gbọ́n àgbà gbọ́n la fi dá ilé Ifẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ lòwe Yorùbá sọ.
en: A child is wise and an old man is wise to build the house of Love like that in Yoruba language.

yo: Ibi tí eerin méjì bá ti jọ jà koríko rẹ̀ ò tún gbórí.
en: The place where two elephants have fought over the grass will not prevail.

yo: Obìnrin tẹ́ẹ́rẹ́ yẹ ọkọ rẹ̀ ní ijọ́ ijó
en: A beautiful woman deserves her husband at the dance

yo: Ẹni tó gbọ́n fowó rẹ̀ ṣe nǹkan, ẹni tó gò ná owó ní ìná àpà
en: A wise man spends his money, and a hoarder spends money on fire

yo: Iṣẹ́ adẹ́mu ni iṣẹ́ tí bàbá Gbọ́njú yàn láàyò.
en: Ademu's work is the work that Abbonju's father prefers.

yo: Ẹni táìgbọ́n pa juye iyanrìn létí òkun.
en: A foolish person casts sand on the seashore.

yo: Ààmì ohùn ṣe kókó nínú èdè Yorùbá torí òhun ló gbé ìtumọ̀ dání.
en: Vowels are important in the Yoruba language because they convey meaning.

yo: Ẹ má bá mi lé ìyàwó ò mi lọ torí èmi ni mo san owó orí ẹ̀.
en: Don't send my wife away with me because I paid her taxes.

yo: Má fi ẹjọ́ pa mí torí mi ò ráyè ẹjọ́ ní àsìkò yìí.
en: Don't sue me because I don't have the right to sue at this time.

yo: Wọ́n mú iná dé lẹ́yìn oṣù kan àti ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́ta.
en: They brought the fire after one month and three weeks.

yo: Ọwọ́ tẹ àwọn tó ń jí epo rọ̀bì tá ni àná òde yìí.
en: Hands down those who stole the oil yesterday.

yo: Mo tẹ̀lé bàbá àgbà lọ sí ilé ìfowópamọ́.
en: I followed my grandfather to the bank.

yo: Òpin ti dé bá à ń pẹ́ dé ibi iṣẹ́ torí ọ̀gá tuntun tó wà nípò.
en: The end has come to him being late to work because of the new boss in place.

yo: Mò ń wá ìwé e sọ̀wédowó tí mo fi sí abẹ́ ìrọ̀rí mi lánàá.
en: I am looking for the checkbook that I put under my pillow yesterday.

yo: Àwọn olùkọ́ ti ní àsìkò ti tó láti gbé ìgbésẹ̀ tó nípọn
en: Teachers have had enough time to take bold action

yo: Ibì kan wà ní Bódìjà tí wọ́n ti máa ń jẹ àmàlá gbígbóná
en: There is a place in Bodija where they used to eat hot amla

yo: Mo lọ síbẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ mi mẹ́jọ, a sì yó bámúbámú
en: I went there with eight of my friends, and we got drunk together

yo: Nígbà tí à ń padà bọ̀, a pàdé àwọn agbófinró, wọ́n sì dá wa dúró
en: On our way back, we met the law enforcement officers and they stopped us

yo: Mi bèèrè pé kí ni mo ṣe tí wọ́n fi fẹ́ gba owó lọ́wọ́ mi.
en: I did not ask what I did that they want to take money from me.

yo: Wọ́n ní pé kò yẹ kí á wà níta lẹ́yìn aago mẹ́fà alẹ́
en: They said that we should not be outside after six o'clock at night

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ ọ wọn kò yé mi tààrà, kò sì yé àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ mi pẹ̀lú
en: I didn't understand their words directly, and neither did my friends

yo: A bá dìde, a sì sálọ kúrò lọ́dọ̀ ọ wọn.
en: We got up and ran away from them.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá yìí ń fi ìbọn lé wa kiri gbogbo Ìbàdàn
en: These policemen are shooting at us all over Ibadan

yo: Bá mi mú owó tí mo fún ẹ lánàá wá, mo fẹ́ lòó.
en: Bring the money I gave you yesterday, I want to use it.

yo: Ṣé kí n bèèrè ọ̀rọ̀ lọ́wọ́ ọba ni àbí kí n bi gómìnà?
en: Should I ask the king or should I ask the governor?

yo: Kọ́kọ́rọ́ ọlá mi kò sí lọ́wọ́ ẹnìkankan mọ́ báyìí
en: The key to my honor is no longer in anyone's hands

yo: Ètò kan wà lórí ẹ̀rọ amóhùnmáwòrán tí mo ma ń wò.
en: There was a program on the television that I used to watch.

yo: Wàhálà àìrówóná ló pọ̀ jù nílùú Ìbàdàn
en: There is a lot of unemployment in Ibadan

yo: Àìsàn ìtọ̀ ṣúgà ló mú bàbá wa kí ó tó kú.
en: Our father was diagnosed with diabetes before he died.

yo: Mi ò lè sùn bí ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́fà kí ìyá à mi tó dé.
en: I could not sleep for six weeks before my mother arrived.

yo: Àwọn dókítà obìnrin méje ló fún mi lábẹ́rẹ́.
en: I was given seven female doctors under him.

yo: Ìlù u gángan ni wọ́n máa ń lù fún àwọn ọba.
en: It is the actual drum that they used to beat for the kings.

yo: Oògùn mẹ́ta ni mo lò kí ara mi tó yá.
en: I used three medicines before I got better.

yo: Bàtà mi ń dún ko ko kà nítorí pé mo mọ̀wé.
en: My shoes are ringing because I know how to read.

yo: Ẹni tó bá mọ̀wé ló máa ń níyì láwùjọ wa.
en: A literate person is respected in our society.

yo: Ìgbá oró kìí fọ́ ni àwọn àgbà máa ń sọ
en: The elders used to say that the pain never breaks

yo: Ọjọ́ burúkú ẹ̀ṣù gbomi mu ni ọjọ́ tí Aláàfin kú
en: The worst day for the devil to drink is the day Alafin died

yo: Tí mo bá tún sọ̀rọ̀, wọn á máa bínú
en: If I speak again, they will be angry

yo: Tí mi ò bá tún sọ̀rọ̀, wọ́n á ni mi ò dá wọn lóhùn.
en: If I do not speak again, they will say that I did not answer them.

yo: Mo sọ fún dókítà pé ara à mi ti yá ju ti tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ.
en: I told the doctor that my body is better than before.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ Yorùbá fẹ́ràn láti máa ṣe fàájì
en: Yoruba people love to have fun

yo: Tí ara ẹ ò bá yá, ó yẹ kí o lọ bá dókìtà sọ̀rọ̀.
en: If you do not feel better, you should go and talk to a doctor.

yo: Gba gbogbo ohun tí ó sọ gbọ́, òótọ́ ni.
en: Believe everything he says, it's true.

yo: Àlùfáà kan jádé síwájú ìjọ láti bá àwọn ọ̀dọ́ sọ̀rọ̀.
en: A priest came out in front of the congregation to talk to the youth.

yo: Tó bá di agogo méjìlá alẹ́, a máa bá àwọn òbí i wa jà
en: When it is 12 o'clock at night, we will fight with our parents

yo: Ìwé mẹ́ta ni mo kà kí ilẹ̀ tó ṣú
en: I read three books before it got dark

yo: Àbúrò àti ọbàkan mi pàdé ara wọn lọ́jà Akẹ̀sán
en: My brother and sister met each other in Akesan market

yo: Ìgbà tí mo bá Ìyálóde sọ̀rọ̀, ó dá mi lóhùn.
en: When I spoke to Iyalode, he answered me.

yo: Tí o bá fún ọmọ lọ́yàn láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀, wọn á ní ìlera gidi.
en: If you give a baby food from the beginning, they will have real health.

yo: Owó tí mo ná lọ́jọ́ àjọ̀dún àdúgbò wa á ti pọ̀ jù.
en: The money I spent on our community festival was too much.

yo: Mo fẹ́ràn gbogbo ìkìlọ̀ tí gómìnà ń fún wa.
en: I like all the warnings the governor is giving us.

yo: Ara àwọn ọmọ yẹn kò yá, ni wọ́n fi gbé wọn lọ sílé ìwòsàn
en: The body of those children did not recover, so they took them to the hospital

yo: Àwọn òbí ẹ̀ gan ti mọ̀ báyìí pé ìyàtọ̀ ti wà.
en: Your parents know now that there is a difference.

yo: Kí ni mo tún fẹ́ sọ fún Adébáyọ̀ tí kò tíì mọ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀?
en: What else do I want to say to Adébayo that he did not know before?

yo: Mi ò mọ ìdí tí Olúwadáre fi bá àwọn ará àdúgbò ẹ̀ jà.
en: I don't know why Lord Dare fought with the people of his community.

yo: Mo kàn ríi pé àwọn olè wọnú ilé tọ̀ wọ́n ni.
en: I just saw that the thieves entered the house after them.

yo: Ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì náírà ni wọ́n gbé fún ọ̀dọ́mọkùnrin méjèjì.
en: Two thousand naira were given to the two young men.

yo: Èso mẹ́rin ni èmi nìkan jẹ látàárọ̀ ọjọ́ náà.
en: I alone ate four fruits that morning.

yo: Mo lè jẹ ẹyin mẹ́rin lẹ́ẹ̀kan náà láìsí wàhálà
en: I can eat four eggs at once with no problem

yo: Oun tí dókítà sọ fún mi kí n jẹ nìyẹn
en: That's what the doctor told me to eat

yo: Wọ́n ní kò yẹ kí àgbàlagbà máa jẹ kókò láàárọ̀.
en: They say that the elderly should not eat cocoa in the morning.

yo: Àwọn ìjẹkújẹ ti pọ̀ jù nínú oúnjẹ tí a máa ń jẹ
en: There is too much waste in the food we eat

yo: Èso dára púpọ̀ láti jẹ, tí a kò bá jẹẹ́ jù.
en: Fruit is very good to eat, if we don't eat too much.

yo: Ìrẹsì àti dòdò ni àwọn ọmọ kékèké máa ń jẹ
en: Little children eat rice and water

yo: Ẹ̀jẹ̀ ríru ni àìsàn tó léwu jù fún àwọn àgbàlagbà.
en: Diarrhea is the most dangerous disease for the elderly.

yo: Mo ti kọ ìwé méjì báyìí, tí mo sì ti ń tà wọ́n
en: I have now written two books and am selling them

yo: Kọ́lá Túnbọ̀sún ló kọ ìwé Ìgbà Èwe lọ́dún tó kọjá
en: Kola Tunbsun wrote the book of Youth last year

yo: Bàálẹ̀ Olúgbòde jẹ́ ògbóǹtarìgì kan nínú ìtàn Ìbàdàn.
en: Baal Olugbode is an expert in the history of Ibadan.

yo: Ajá à mi ni mo rán ní Akínmọ̀ọ́rìn níjọ́sí
en: I sent my dog ​​to Akinmorin yesterday

yo: Mo tún ra olóńgbò méjì nígbà tí mo rìnrìnàjò
en: I also bought two cats when I traveled

yo: Ẹranko púpọ̀ ló ti wá ń gbé inú ilé è mi báyìí.
en: Many animals have been living in my house now.

yo: Owó o dọ́là ti wá ju bó ti yẹ lọ báyìí.
en: The dollar amount is more than it should be now.

yo: Mo ti gbìyànjú láti kọrin sínú amóhùnmáwòrán.
en: I have tried to sing into the microphone.

yo: Ìyàwó mẹ́ta ni baálẹ̀ náà ni, gbogbo wọn ló sì sanra.
en: The chief has three wives, and all of them are fat.

yo: Wọ́n ti fún mi ní iṣẹ́ ṣe nílé ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́
en: They have given me a job in Oyo state government house

yo: Mo bá Túndé kẹ́dùn ti ìyá à rẹ̀ tó kú
en: I sympathize with Tunde on the death of his mother

yo: Àwọn àrá ilé è mi kò tilẹ̀ dá mi lóhùn bí mo ṣe ń pariwo tó
en: My family members didn't even answer me how loud I was

yo: Àfìgbà tí mo bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní kọrin lóru ọ̀gànjọ́
en: Until I started singing at midnight

yo: Gbogbo ará ìlú ni mo jí sílẹ̀ láìku ẹnìkan
en: I woke up all the townspeople without anyone dying

yo: Èyí jẹ́ kí inú bí àwọn adélébọ̀ àti àwọn ọkọ wọn.
en: This made the middlemen and their husbands angry.

yo: Irú ènìyàn wo ni kìí jẹ́ kí ará ilé sùn lálàáfíà?
en: What kind of person does not let the family sleep in peace?

yo: Àbí kí n rán àwọn bùrọ̀dá àdúgbò kí wọ́n lọ bá mi nàá ni?
en: Or should I send the local buradas to go with me?

yo: Mi ò kàn fẹ́ kí wọ́n sọ mí lẹ́nu ni.
en: I just don't want to be talked down to.

yo: Adémọ́lá náà mọ̀ bí mo ṣe jẹ́ ní ìlú yìí.
en: The Ademola knows how I am in this city.

yo: Wọ́n sọ mí lorúkọ lánàá, inú tèmi gan sì dùn sii.
en: They named me yesterday, and I was really happy.

yo: Àjẹmọ́nú ni wọ́n pe owó tí ẹ̀gbọ́n mí san fún mi níjẹ̀ta.
en: They called the money my brother paid me as a gift.

yo: Ìgbà wo ni àwọn alájọ máa wá gba àjọ wọn?
en: When will the people come to collect their organization?

yo: Owó kékeré tí mo ní lọ́wọ́ kò tó mií ná di ìparí oṣù
en: The little money I have in my hand is not enough until the end of the month

yo: Tí oṣù bá sì ti parí báyìí, ìyàwó ò mi á bèèrè ti ẹ̀.
en: And if the month is over now, my wife will not ask about you.

yo: Àbí kí lẹ tún fẹ́ kí n tún ṣe ju pé kí ń fa ara mi sílẹ̀ lọ.
en: Or they want me to do it again rather than letting myself down.

yo: Àǹfàní i kí ló jẹ́ fún ènìyàn kó jèrè gbogbo ayé kó wá sọ ẹ̀mí ẹ̀ nù?
en: What is the profit for a man to gain the whole world and then lose his life?

yo: Bóyá ọ̀run àpáàdì náà ni gbogbo wọn ń lọ
en: Maybe they are all going to hell

yo: Ìbínú ò yẹ akọ̀wé, ó yẹ kí gbogbo wọn ó máa ní sùúrù ni.
en: Anger is not appropriate for a secretary, everyone should be patient.

yo: Àfi ká bá orí i wa sọ̀rọ̀ kó baà lè sìn wá re ibi tó dára.
en: Unless we talk to our head so that he can serve us in a good place.

yo: Iṣẹ́ yìí mà ti fẹ́ parí báyìí, díẹ̀ ló kù.
en: This work is about to be finished now, there is only a little left.

yo: Mo gbé ohùn mi sókè sí Ọlọ́run, ó sì dá mi lóhùn.
en: I raised my voice to God, and he answered me.

yo: Àbí kìí ṣe ọmọ àbúrò bàbá à mi ni mò ń wò yí ni?
en: Or is it not my father's younger brother that I am looking at?

yo: Ení bí ení lọmọdé ń kawó, èjì bí èjì làgbà ń tayò.
en: One who is born as a child reads, the other as an adult excels.

yo: Ẹ̀ta ǹ tagbá, ẹ ta ara yín lọ́rẹ.
en: It's wrong, you fight each other.

yo: Ọmọ ọ̀ mi ti lọ sí ilé ìwé láàárọ̀ yìí kí n tó jí.
en: My son went to school this morning before I woke up.

yo: Kò sí oun tí mo bèèrè lọ́wọ́ ayálégbé è mi tó dá mi lóhùn.
en: No one I asked from my tenant answered me.

yo: Àwọn nǹkan púpọ̀ ni èèyàn lè rí rà lọ́jà Akẹ̀sán.
en: Many things can be found and bought in Akesan market.

yo: Kàkà kí eku má jẹ sèsé, a fi ṣe àwàdànù.
en: Instead of the rat being eaten, it is made into a dish.

yo: Kìí burú títí kó má ku ẹnìkan mọ́ni.
en: It's not bad until no one dies.

yo: Ayé ń lọ, à ń tọ̀ọ́ lẹ́yìn lọ.
en: The world is moving, we are moving forward.

yo: Ìgbà ò lọ bí òréré, ayé ò tọ́ lọ bí ọ̀pá ìbọn.
en: Time doesn't go like a stick, the world doesn't go like a gun.

yo: Ètò ìdìbò mélòó la ó ṣe kí ọdún yìí tó parí ná?
en: How many elections will you do before the end of this year?

yo: Ó ti pẹ́ tí mo ti ń dúró de Túndé àti Àrẹ̀mú
en: I have been waiting for Tünde and Aremu for a long time

yo: Wọ́n ti pẹ́ dé sí ẹnu iṣẹ́ lónìí.
en: They are late for work today.

yo: Bóyá àwọn ìyàwó o wọn ló tún dá wọn dúró.
en: Maybe their wives stopped them.

yo: Èmi nìkan ni mo wà níbí láti aago mẹ́sàán.
en: I am the only one here since nine o'clock.

yo: Kí ló tún wá kù fún mi láti ṣe ju kí n pè wọ́n lọ?
en: What else is left for me to do than to call them?

yo: Ilú Ọba ni Adétúnjí ti ń fi owó púpọ̀ ránṣẹ́ sílé
en: Adétunji has been sending a lot of money home from Ilu Oma

yo: Ìyá a wọn ǹkan ló ṣẹ́kù láti ìgbà tí bàbá wọn ti kú.
en: Their mother was only left since their father died.

yo: Kò jẹ́ bó ti jẹ́, iṣẹ́ ti parí o.
en: No matter what, the job is done.

yo: Mo jẹ ànàmọ́ àti epo pupa pẹ̀lú ẹja díndín
en: I eat garlic and red oil with thin fish

yo: Oúnjẹ náà dùn púpọ̀ debi, mo já díẹ̀ sára aṣọ mi.
en: The food was so delicious, I tore a little on my clothes.

yo: Ìyá a Túndé ní kí n fún òun jẹ lára oúnjẹ mi.
en: Túndé's mother asked me to give her some of my food.

yo: Iyán àti ẹ̀fọ́ rírò ni mo fi lé èyí tí mo jẹ tẹ́lẹ̀.
en: I put on the one I ate before with fever and nausea.

yo: Mo ní mi ò fẹ́ jẹ àsáró mọ́ nítorí pé ara mi kò yá
en: I said that I don't want to eat any more because my body is not well

yo: Ìṣòro púpọ̀ ló ń dojú kọ àwọn tó ń gbé agbègbè Onírù.
en: Many problems are facing those who live in Oniru area.

yo: Wàá ti máa gbọ́ gbogbo ohun tí mò ń sọ látàárọ̀
en: You will be listening to everything I say in the morning

yo: Kíni a tún lè fi wé iṣẹ́ àràmọ̀ǹdà tí Ọlọ́run ṣe fún wa?
en: What else can we compare to the miraculous work that God did for us?

yo: Báa ti fẹ́ kó rí, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ló rí, emi la ò ní yọ̀ sí?
en: If he wanted it to be, that's how it is, won't I be happy?

yo: Ààfin Olúbàdàn fẹ̀ ju ti Aláké Abẹ́kuta lọ
en: The palace of Olubadan is bigger than that of Alake Abekuta

yo: Àwọn òbí mi máa ń sọ fún mi kí n rántí ọjọ́ àtisùn.
en: My parents always tell me to remember the day to sleep.

yo: Bàbá à mi ní kí n rántí ọmọ ẹni tí mò ń ṣe.
en: My father asked me to remember the son of whom I was acting.

yo: Àfi ìgbà tí àwọn agbófinró mú àwọn ọlọ́ṣà yìí ni wọ́n tó dẹ́kun.
en: It was only when the law enforcement officers caught these thieves that they stopped.

yo: Kí la gbé, kí lẹ jù? Kí ló le tó bẹ́ẹ̀.
en: What do we live, what is too much? How hard is that?

yo: A sọ fún gbogbo akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ pé kí wọ́n so ewé agbéjẹ́ mọ́wọ́.
en: We told all the students to tie a leaf in their hands.

yo: A ti rí ẹ̀rọ kọ̀m̀pútà tó ń ka ìwé bí ènìyàn.
en: We have seen a computer that reads like a human.

yo: Ṣé gbogbo ohun tí mo sọ fún ẹ náà lo fi kọ́gbọ́n?
en: Did everything I told you make sense?

yo: Kò sí nǹkan tó ń bọ̀ lókè tí ilẹ̀ ò gba, ni wọ́n máa ń sọ.
en: There is nothing that comes from above that the earth does not accept, they used to say.

yo: Kò sì sí oun tí ojú ò rí rí, àbí bẹ́ẹ̀ kọ́?
en: And there is no one who has never seen, is it not?

yo: A kìí fi okó ńlá dẹ́rúba arúgbó ni àwọn Yorùbá ń wi.
en: The Yoruba say that we don't scare old people with a big car.

yo: Kí ni mo tún le ṣe láti mú ẹ gbọ́ràn sí mi lẹ́nu?
en: What else can I do to make you listen to me?

yo: A ti jáde kúrò nílé ìwé gíga kí ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n náà tó wọlé.
en: We had left the university before the professor entered.

yo: Ọmọ yẹn kìí ṣábà á gbọ́ràn àfi tí wọ́n bá fi ẹjọ́ ẹ̀ sùn.
en: That child will not obey unless they put him to sleep.

yo: Nígbà tí a ti ń dúró sínú ọjà látàárọ̀, a ò rí ẹnìkankan dá wa lóhùn.
en: When we were waiting in the market in the morning, we did not see anyone answering us.

yo: Adékúnlé ọkọ Sinmi ni wọ́n fi ẹ̀sùn kàn pé ó ṣe aṣemáṣe.
en: Sinmi's husband Adekunle was accused of negligence.

yo: Tí a bá ní kí á wòó fínífíní, kò sí ọmọ rere nínú àwọn ọmọ ejò.
en: If we are asked to look closely, there is no good child among the children of snakes.

yo: Wọ́n ti pè mí láti wá bá àwọn aláyọ̀ ṣe àjọyọ̀, mo sì gbà.
en: They have invited me to celebrate with the happy people, and I accepted.

yo: Ìtàn ìnàkí tí a sọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀ níjọ́sí pa mí lẹ́rìín gidi.
en: The story that was told yesterday really made me laugh.

yo: Báwo ni ìnàkí ṣe máa sọ̀rọ̀ bí ènìyàn láìsí wàhálà?
en: How can an ape speak like a human without difficulty?

yo: Kàn sí mi tí o bá ti gba owó tí mo fi ránṣẹ́.
en: Contact me if you have received the money I sent.

yo: Ó dàbíi pé Àrẹ̀mú àti ọ̀rẹ́ rẹ̀ ti dé báyìí.
en: It seems that Aremu and his friend have arrived now.

yo: Jẹ́ kí n lọ pàdé wọn lẹ́nu ọ̀nà kí ajá má baà gbó mọ́ wọn.
en: Let me go to meet them at the door so that the dog will not bark at them.

yo: A ò ní gbọ́ ikú Olódùmarè, ó ṣèèwọ̀ òrìṣà.
en: We will not hear of the death of the Almighty, God forbid.

yo: Àwámárídìí ni iṣẹ́ ọba arínúróde olùmọ̀ràn ọkàn.
en: Awamaraidii is the work of the king who is waiting for the counselor of the heart.

yo: A kìí bá yímíyímí du imí ẹ̀ lákìtàn.
en: We will never take your breath away.

yo: Àdúgbò tí mo ti dàgbà ni wọn ń pè ní Àkóbọ̀ Ojúurin.
en: The neighborhood where I grew up is called Akokobo Ojuurin.

yo: Kò jìnnà sí Bashọ̀run ní ìlú Ìbàdàn.
en: It is not far from Bashorun in the city of Ibadan.

yo: Ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Lágelú ni a ti pàdé olóríkunkun yẹn.
en: The local government of Lágelu has met that leader.

yo: Ó lè jẹ́ pé ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tí mo sọ fún ẹ nípa ẹ̀ ni wọ́n ń ròyìn ẹ̀.
en: It may be that the incident I told you about is what they are reporting.

yo: Ojú u wa kò ní ríbi mọ́ nílẹ̀ yìí o, ó dòkèèrè.
en: Our eyes will no longer be in this land, he said.

yo: Àfi ìgbà tí mo fojú ù mi rí ohun tí wọ́n ń rà lọ́jà.
en: Except when I saw what they were buying in the market.

yo: Káàkiri gbogo igbèríko Ìbàdàn ni a ti rí Olóòlù tó jẹ́ elégún.
en: All over the countryside of Ibadan, we have seen Ololulu, who is a giant.

yo: Ọdọọdún ni wọ́n máa ń gbée jáde, ó sì máa ń dẹ́rù ba àwọn ọmọdé
en: Every year they show it, and it scares the children

yo: Àìtètè mólè ni ọ̀rọ̀ tó wà nílẹ̀ yìí.
en: The word here is simple.

yo: Olè náà ti fẹ́ máa mú olóko lọ.
en: The thief wanted to take away the money.

yo: Kàkà kí ewé àgbọn dẹ̀, ńṣe ló tún ń le koko síi
en: Instead of the coconut leaf shrinking, it is getting harder

yo: Aì tíì kófá nílẹ̀, ifá ti ń ṣẹ o.
en: He has not yet fallen to the ground, the sword is breaking him.

yo: Àsìkò òjò ni gbogbo ohun tí a fẹ́ ṣe máa ń ṣeé ṣe
en: Everything we want to do is possible during the rainy season

yo: Tí a bá gbin ẹ̀wà àti kòkó, ǹjẹ́ èyí kò ní fún wa lówo?
en: If we plant beauty and fruit, won't this give us money?

yo: Iṣẹ́ àgbẹ̀ ṣá ni iṣẹ́ ilẹ̀ wa láti àtẹ̀yìnwá.
en: Agriculture is the work of our land from the past.

yo: Ẹni tí kò bá fẹ́ ṣiṣẹ́ gbọdọ̀ ṣetán láti jalè.
en: He who does not want to work must be ready to steal.

yo: Èwo ló tún dé tí Fúnmiláyọ̀ ń bá gbogbo ará àdúbgbò jà?
en: Where is Mrs. Mrs. fighting with all the local people?

yo: Ká ní pé mi ò dá ẹ lóhùn lẹ́ẹ̀kan ni, kí lo máa ṣe?
en: If I don't answer you once, what will you do?

yo: Ọlọ́run ò ní jẹ́ ká rí ogun abẹ́lé mọ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
en: God will not allow us to see a civil war in this country.

yo: Èyí tí a jà ní bíi ogójì ọdún sẹ́yìn kò bójú mu rárá.
en: What we fought about 40 years ago is not appropriate at all.

yo: Lọ́sẹ̀ yìí, mo bá Adékúnlé sọ̀rọ̀ nípa oyè tí wọ́n fi mí jẹ.
en: This week, I spoke to Adékunle about the reputation they gave me.

yo: A ò ní fi ojú sunkún ara wa mọ́ o, lágbára Ọlọ́run.
en: We will not cry our eyes out, God is strong.

yo: Bí a ò bá tiẹ̀ mọ ara wa rí, ṣe ó yẹ kí á tún máa jà ni?
en: If we don't even know each other, should we still fight?

yo: A ti rí ire púpọ̀ láti inú ìwà ọmọlúàbí tí Adébáyọ̀ ọ́ wù.
en: We have benefited greatly from Adébayo's good manners.

yo: Mo ti lọ sí òkun àti ọ̀sà, mi ò rí ọmọ tó dáa tó tìẹ.
en: I have gone to sea and ocean, I have not found a child as good as you.

yo: Máa bá wa lọ, Olúwa, kí á má baà sọnù.
en: Go with us, Lord, so that we will not be lost.

yo: Ìgbà tí mo wọ inú ìlú náà, wọ́n dá mi padà.
en: When I entered the city, they returned me.

yo: Ta ló fẹ́ fún mi lówó láti ra ẹ̀rọ kọ̀m̀pútà márùn-ún.
en: Who wants to give me money to buy five computers.

yo: Àìleèjó ni ó máa ń fàá kí ènìyàn máa sá kúrò ní ayẹyẹ
en: It is impatience that causes people to run away from celebrations

yo: Bóyá ọkọ ni ẹ́ tàbí àlè, obìnrin náà ni yóò pa ọkùnrin.
en: Whether you are a husband or a concubine, the woman will kill the man.

yo: Aago méjìlá ti ku bíi ìṣẹ́jú mẹ́tàléláàdọ́ta ààbọ̀.
en: It was half past twelve.

yo: Mo máa jayé orí mi kí n tó kúrò nílẹ̀ yìí o.
en: I will hang my head before I leave this place.

yo: Mo fẹ́ ran àwọn ènìyàn lọ́wọ́ ní gbogbo ìgbà tí mo bá ni
en: I want to help people every time I have

yo: Ogun abẹ́lé ìjọ́sí ò tíì kúrò lọ́kàn àwọn tó jàá.
en: The civil war has not left the hearts of those who fought.

yo: Ààrẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà kan kò fẹ́ kúrò lórí oyè títí tí wọ́n fi yọọ́ dànù.
en: An American president does not want to leave office until they are removed.

yo: A kò gbọdọ̀ tún dìbò yan bàbá arúgbó yẹn sí ipò kankan mọ́.
en: We must not re-elect that old man to any position.

yo: A kìí fi àgbàlagbà sílẹ̀ láti bọ́ ara wọn tí wọ́n bá ti darúgbó
en: We do not leave the elderly to fend for themselves when they are old

yo: Kàkà kí n jalè, màá yà lọ wá iṣẹ́ gidi ṣe ni.
en: Instead of stealing, I'll go find a real job.

yo: Àwọn òbí mi ti fún mi ní ọgbọ́n orí láti ṣe ohun tí mo fẹ́ ṣe.
en: My parents have given me the wisdom to do what I want to do.

yo: Láìfọ̀tápè, gbogbo ohun tí mo fẹ́ ṣe láyé è mi ni mo ti ṣe báyìí.
en: Without hesitation, I have done everything I wanted to do in my life.

yo: Kíni mo tún lè sọ tí kò ní mú wọn bínù?
en: What else can I say that won't make them angry?

yo: Mo ti ṣe gbogbo nǹkan tí àlùfáà ní kí n ṣe.
en: I have done everything the priest asked me to do.

yo: A ò tíì gbọ́ nǹkankan láti ẹnu àwọn tí a fi ẹ̀sùn kàn.
en: We have not heard anything from the accused.

yo: Ó yà ni lẹ́nu pé Títí ṣì ní bàbá àti ìyá láyé.
en: It is surprising that Titi still has a father and mother in the world.

yo: Màá mu omi àti ọtí papọ̀ lẹ́ẹ̀kannáà láìsí wàhálà
en: I will drink water and alcohol together without any problem

yo: Kíni a ò tíì rí rí nílẹ̀ yìí?
en: What have we never seen before in this land?

yo: Àjọ̀dún ọdún òmìnira ní orílẹ̀èdè Amẹ́ríkà máa ń wáyé lóṣù keje.
en: Independence Day in the United States is celebrated in July.

yo: Bá mi na ọmọ mi kìí ṣábà dé inú ọlọ́mọ.
en: With me, my son will not reach the womb.

yo: Àbámẹ́ta ni màá bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ mi tuntun tí mo ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀
en: I will start my new job in three days

yo: Ọkọ̀ òfurufú mẹ́ta ni mo wọ̀ kí n tó dé ilé ìtura ọ̀hún.
en: I took three flights before I got to that hotel.

yo: Ọkùnrin àti obìnrin ń fi ọwọ́ kọ́ ara wọn lọ́rùn.
en: A man and a woman strangle each other with their hands.

yo: Wọ́n dúró, wọ́n sì ya fọ́tò papọ̀ tí wọ́n fi ránṣẹ́.
en: They stopped and took a photo together which they sent.

yo: Wọ́n fagilé ìrìn àjò òfurufú kọ̀ọ̀kan nítorí èrò.
en: Every flight was canceled due to overcrowding.

yo: Láti ìgbà tí mo ti sọ fún Fúnmiláyọ̀ nípa ìyàwó ò mi, kò tíì fi mí sílẹ̀
en: Ever since I told Mrs Milayo about my ex-wife, she has not left me

yo: Báwo la ṣe fẹ́ gbọ́ pé irunmú ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n fásitì ti jóná?
en: How do we want to hear that the university professor's beard is on fire?

yo: Àlùfáà ń jóná, ẹ ń bèèrè irungbọ̀n.
en: The priest is burning, you are asking for a beard.

yo: Ajénifújà jẹ́ ọkùnrin takuntakun tó ń dá gbé ní ìlú Ẹlẹ́yẹlé
en: Ajenifujja is a hardworking man who lives in the city of Ejeyele

yo: Tí wọ́n bá ti Ààrẹ àná mọ́lé, inú máa bí àwọn ènìyàn púpọ̀.
en: If yesterday's President was locked up, many people would be angry.

yo: Mi ò rò pé wọn á ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ ṣá, nítorí pé ẹ̀rù ń bà wọ́n.
en: I don't think they will do that, because they are afraid.

yo: Mo lè sáré ju gbogbo àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ àti ẹbí mi lọ.
en: I can outrun all my friends and family.

yo: Ebi ń pa ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn aráàlú ní ìpínlẹ̀ Arámọkọ
en: Many people in Aramokko state are starving

yo: Ìgbà tí àwọn gómìnà méjèjì bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìjà ni mo mọ̀ pé wàhálà ti dé
en: It was when the two governors started fighting that I knew that trouble had come

yo: Ká má lọ kọlu igi tí wọ́n gbìn sí ojú ọ̀nà.
en: Let's not go and hit the tree planted on the road.

yo: Mo fẹ́ràn láti máa lá oyin pẹ̀lú búrẹ́dì àti omi ọbẹ̀
en: I like to eat honey with bread and soup

yo: Àṣé kò sí oun kankan tó lè dẹ́rùba ọmọ akin.
en: There is no one who can scare the son of akin.

yo: Ààmì ìpinlẹ́mìí ni ìkọlù tó wáyé ní ìlú Èkìtì
en: The attack that took place in Ekiti was a national symbol

yo: Abẹòkúta tí ń ṣe ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn ni ilé ìtajà náà wà.
en: The shop is located in the Abeokuta region of Ogun.

yo: Irúfẹ́ ilé ìtajà ọ̀hún ò wọ́pọ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.
en: This type of store is not common in the state.

yo: Ẹ jẹ́ ka gbé òṣùbà a sàdáńkátà fún gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì.
en: Let's raise the moon for the governor of Ekiti state.

yo: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì ti fi ìgbà kan jẹ́ olórí àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì kó tó di gómìnà.
en: The governor of Ekiti state was once the leader of the youth in Ekiti state before he became the governor.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ tí ààrẹ Bùhárí sọ ti mú kí gbogbo ọ̀dọ́ ìlú má fẹ́ràn-an rẹ̀ mọ.
en: President Buhari's words have made all the youths of the city no longer like him.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ìlù ti pinu pé àwọn yóò dìbò fún ẹni tó tọ́ sí ipò náà.
en: The youth of the city have decided that they will vote for the person who deserves the position.

yo: Ìkọlù tó wáyé lọ́jọ́ ìdìbò abẹ́lé náà ti mú kí ìkùnsínú wá láàárín àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀hún.
en: The attack that took place on the day of the local election has caused resentment among the members.

yo: Ààrẹ Bùhárí tún ti gba òkè òkun lọ fún ìtọ́jú.
en: President Buhari has also gone overseas for treatment.

yo: Ìtọ́jú ààrẹ Bùhárí tí n di lemọ́ lemọ́.
en: President Buhari's care is getting worse.

yo: Ààrẹ Bùhárí ní kí àwọn adájọ́ dá ẹjọ́ tó tọ́ àti èyí tó yẹ fún àwọn ikọ̀ Adigunjalè.
en: President Buhari asked the judges to make a fair and appropriate case for the Adigunjale ambassadors.

yo: Ẹ fi ààrẹ Bùhárí sílẹ̀ ẹ jẹ́ ká jayé oríi wa.
en: Leave President Buhari alone and let us show our heads.

yo: Irú ìjìyà wo ló tọ́ sí àwọn ikọ̀ Adigunjalè wọ̀nyí?
en: What kind of punishment do these ambassadors of Adigunjale deserve?

yo: Ṣé ààrẹ Bùhárí ti dé látorílẹ̀ èdè e Sẹ̀nìgà fún ìpàdá àwọn ààrẹ ilẹ̀ Áfríkà tó lọ?
en: Has President Buhari come from Senegal for the return of African presidents who have gone?

yo: Orílẹ̀ èdè e Sẹ̀nìgà ti ń fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ láàyè láti wọ inú ìlú u wọn láìní ìwé ìdánimọ̀.
en: The Senegalese country has been allowing many people to enter their country without an identity card.

yo: Ikọ̀ adigunjalè ti ń gbé àwọn ìgbésè kan tó máa ṣekú pa wọ́n.
en: The robbers are taking some actions that will kill them.

yo: Ìkọlù tó wáyé ní ìlú Abẹ́òkuta ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn pa ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ènìyàn.
en: The attack in Abeokuta town in Ogun state killed many people.

yo: Apá àríwá-ìlà-oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà jẹ́ ibi tó ṣòro láti lọ.
en: The north-eastern part of Nigeria is a difficult place to go.

yo: Àwọn agbègbè kan lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí nílò o ìdáábòbò tó páye.
en: Certain areas of this country need adequate protection.

yo: Àwọn àdúgbò bí i Kárìnkápọ̀, Olómiaró àti Adérónmú nílò ìdáábòbò ní kíákíá.
en: Communities like Karınkápo, Olómiaro and Adéronmu need immediate protection.

yo: Mínísítà fún ìṣọ àti ìdáábòbò ará ìlú ti pe àkíyèsí sí ọ̀rọ̀ ọ ṣíṣe ìdáàbòbò.
en: The Minister for Public Security and Defense has called attention to the issue of security.

yo: Àwọn ará ìlú ran ààrẹ Bùhárí létí nípa àdéhùn tó ṣe fún àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà.
en: The people of the town reminded President Buhari about the deal he made for Nigerians.

yo: Kò sí àníàní ààrẹ Bùhárí ò ní ṣíkà àdéhùn tó ṣe.
en: There is no doubt that President Buhari will not count the agreement he made.

yo: Ǹjẹ́ ààrẹ Bùhárí ti gbọ́ sí ìròyìn tí mínísítà fún ìṣọ́ àti ìdáàbòbò múwá?
en: Has President Buhari heard the report brought by the Minister of Security and Defense?

yo: Àwọn ìyá a wa àti àwọn bàbá a wa tọ́ ma ń tẹ̀lẹ́ wọn nígbà ìdìbò ló yẹ ká dá lẹ́bi.
en: Our mothers and our fathers follow them during elections and we should blame them.

yo: Ààrẹ Bùhárí ní òun yóò gbé ìgbésè ní kété tí àwọn bá parí ìpàdé.
en: President Buhari said he will take action as soon as they finish the meeting.

yo: Mínísítà fún ìsọ́ àti ìdáàbòbò ti dalẹ̀ àwọn ẹgbẹ́ tí wọ́n fi sípò.
en: The Ministry of Defense and Security has approved the teams that have been put in place.

yo: Ìgbésẹ̀ tí ààrẹ Bùhárí gbé lórí ìdáàbòbò àwọn ará ìlú kìí ṣe kékeré rárá.
en: The steps taken by President Buhari on the protection of the citizens are not small at all.

yo: Ààrẹ Bùhárí sọ ọ̀rọ̀ àìdaa sí àwọn ọ̀dọ́ nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan.
en: President Buhari spoke negatively to the youth in a publication.

yo: Oríṣríṣi ìkọlù ló ti ń wáyé ní àwọn agbègbè kan láti ọwọ́ ikọ̀ Adigunjalè.
en: Various attacks have been taking place in some areas by Adigunjalè.

yo: Ìjọba ti kán ìyẹ́ apá àwọn ikọ̀ Adigunjalè tọ́ ń da ilú rú.
en: The government has spread the wings of Adigunjalé's ambassadors and is disturbing the city.

yo: Àwọn ikọ̀ Adigunjalè ọ̀hún ò fi ọkàn àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè e Nàìjíríà balẹ̀
en: Those Adigunjale ambassadors did not calm the hearts of Nigerians

yo: Apá àríwá-ìlà-oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà jẹ́ ibi tó ṣòro láti lọ.
en: The north-eastern part of Nigeria is a difficult place to go.

yo: Ó yẹ kí a gbóṣùbà fún àwọn akọni orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà.
en: We should pay tribute to the heroes of Nigeria.

yo: Ọba ìlú Òndó sọ ọ̀rọ̀ tó pọ̀ nípa èdè àti àṣà a Yorùbá.
en: The King of Ondo spoke a lot about the Yoruba language and culture.

yo: Kábíyèsí Ọba Adéníran ni ọba ìlú Oǹdó.
en: Kábíyésí King Adéníran is the king of Ondó.

yo: Ó jẹ́ kí ó yé wa pé Yorùbá dùn láṣà, Yorùbá dùn lédè kí a gbé ìran Yorùbá lárugẹ.
en: He made us understand that Yoruba culture is sweet, Yoruba language is sweet so that we can promote the Yoruba generation.

yo: Kí àwọn òbí máa fi èdè Yorùbá bá àwọn ọmọ wọn sọ̀rọ̀.
en: Parents should use Yoruba language to talk to their children.

yo: Èdè abínibí dára ní sísọ fún ìdàgbàsókè ìran Yorùbá.
en: The native language is good in speaking for the development of the Yorùbá generation.

yo: Àjọ tó ń rí sí ìtọ́jú àṣà àti èdè e Yorùbá níṣẹ́ láti ṣe.
en: The organization that looks after the Yoruba culture and language has a job to do.

yo: Ó ka ìwé láti ilé ẹ̀kọ́ alákọ̀ọ́bẹ̀rẹ̀ tó fi dé ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga.
en: He studied from primary school to high school.

yo: Àjọ náà sọ pé ìbànùjẹ́ ọkàn ló jẹ́ fún àwọn nítorí pé àwọn ò mójútó àṣà àti èdè e Yorùbá.
en: The organization said that it is heartbreaking for them because they do not care about Yoruba culture and language.

yo: Ẹ jẹ́ kí èdè abínibí i wa kó mọ́ wa lẹ́nu.
en: Let our native language be familiar to us.

yo: Ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti ṣe ìlérí fún àjọ náà láti ṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún ìdàgbàsókè ìran Yorùbá.
en: The federal government has promised the organization to help the development of the Yoruba generation.

yo: Àwọn akínkanjú ikọ̀ ológun tó ti kú ò lóǹkà.
en: There are countless brave soldiers who have died.

yo: Kíkojú ikọ̀ àwọn akọluni mú kí ọpọlọpọ ènìyàn kú.
en: Facing the terrorists caused many people to die.

yo: Wọ́n ní àtìlẹyìn wà fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tó bá ṣe dáadáa nínú ìdíje náà.
en: They said there is support for students who do well in the competition.

yo: Àwọn ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ tó wà nínú ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú ò lóǹkà.
en: There are many rebel ambassadors in the political party.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú alákùkọ ti gbé igbáorókè nínú ìdìbò tó kọjá.
en: The political party has won the majority in the last election.

yo: Kí wọ́n sì fimú u wọn fọn fèrè ló máa jẹ́ kí òfin náà múlẹ̀.
en: And if they film him and blow the trumpet, that will make the law to be established.

yo: Ǹjẹ́ òfin wà ní ilẹ̀ ẹ Nàìjíríà?
en: Is there law in Nigeria?

yo: Kí ló dé tó jẹ́ pé àwọn tó mọ òfin lọ́ maá ń rú òfin ní Nàìjíríà?
en: Why is it that those who know the law often break the law in Nigeria?

yo: Ààrẹ ẹ́ wá bá àwọn ẹbí tó farapa nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà kẹ́dùn lọ́jọ́ Àìkú.
en: The President condoled with the families who were injured in the incident on Sunday.

yo: Ó sì ṣèlérí fún àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà wípé kò sí agbègbè tí àwọn yóò dá dá kádàrá a wọn.
en: And he promised the people of Nigeria that there is no area where they will be left alone.

yo: Ìjọba tún ti ṣèlérí tí wọn ò lè múṣẹ fún àwọn ọmọ orílè èdè e Nàìjíríà.
en: The government has also made promises that they cannot fulfill to the people of Nigeria.

yo: Ó yẹ kí a gbé òṣùbà fún àwọn akọni orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà.
en: We should raise the moon for the heroes of the nation of Nigeria.

yo: Àwọn akínkanjú ikọ̀ ológun tó ti kú ò lóǹkà.
en: There are countless brave soldiers who have died.

yo: Kíkojú ikọ̀ àwọn akọluni mú ki ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ènìyàn kú.
en: Facing the terrorists caused many people to die.

yo: Wọ́n ní àtìlẹyìn wa láti túbọ̀ ṣiṣẹ́ takuntakun ní agbègbè náà.
en: They have our support to work harder in the area.

yo: Àwọn ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ tó wà nínu ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú fẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́ tó lọ́gbọ̀n.
en: The rebel ambassadors in the political party are almost as wise.

yo: Ó ṣeni láàánú, pé ọ̀pọ̀ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tó ti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ gboyè ò rí iṣẹ́.
en: Unfortunately, many students who have graduated do not find work.

yo: Ṣe iṣẹ́ ṣì wà lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí ṣá?
en: Is there still work in this language?

yo: Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun anígboyà kan pàdánù ẹ̀mí i rẹ̀.
en: One of the brave soldiers lost his life.

yo: Ọmọ ogun tí ó farapa náà sì ti ń gba ìtọ́jú lọ́wọ́-lọ́wọ́.
en: The injured soldier is receiving treatment.

yo: Kí Olódùmarè ṣọ́ wa lọ́wọ ikọ̀ Adigunjalè wọ̀nyí.
en: May the Almighty protect us from these Adigunjaleh messengers.

yo: Mò fẹ́ fọkàn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè náà balẹ̀ pé àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ yóò kojú ìjìyà tó tọ́
en: I want to reassure the nation that the rebels will face the right punishment

yo: Ìyà yóò jẹ àwọn ọlọ̀tè títí tí wọn yóò fi ronúpìwàdà níbi àṣìṣe wọn.
en: The rebels will be punished until they repent of their mistakes.

yo: Nígbà tí ó ṣe àbẹ̀wò o rẹ̀ tán, wọ́n lọ sí ilé àwọn ọmọ aláìlóbìí.
en: When he was tired of visiting, they went to the orphanage.

yo: Wọ́n gbóṣùbà fún ikọ̀ náà fún ìforítì, ìṣọ́ra àti ìjà fitafita tí wọ́n fi ṣẹ́gun ọta.
en: They praised the ambassador for his perseverance, caution and bravery in defeating the enemy.

yo: Ọmọ ogun Arámọkọ kọlù àwọn Adigunjalè kan ní Èkó.
en: Aramokko soldiers attack some Adigunjalès in Lagos.

yo: Ikọ̀ ológun ní àwọn kò ní kọlu Ìgbòhò lọ́jọ́ ajé.
en: The military said they will not attack Igbohho on business day.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́-ológun kẹtàdínlógún sọ pé àwọn ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ náà ti wọ́lẹ̀.
en: The 17th Army said that the rebel ambassadors had landed.

yo: Ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ atẹ́ẹ́rẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun ti ba ète ìkọlù àwọn Adigunjalè náà jẹ́.
en: The local government in Osun state has foiled the attack plan of the Adigunjale.

yo: Wọ́n ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní tiná bọ àwọn ilé kọ̀ọ̀kan, tí ó sì ń fa ìbẹ̀rù bojo ní àárín ìlú náà.
en: They have started to set fire to each house, causing fear in the center of the city.

yo: Àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun anígboyà ti wọ̀yá ìjà pẹ̀lú àwọn ọ̀daràn.
en: Courageous soldiers have fought with criminals.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ti farapa yánna-yànna pẹ̀lú ẹ̀ri ipa ẹ̀jẹ̀ lọ́nà ibi tí wọ́n ṣá gbà.
en: Many were badly injured with evidence of blood from where they had been taken.

yo: Ó ṣe ni láàánú, pé ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun anígboyà kan sọ ẹ̀míi rẹ nù.
en: Unfortunately, one of the brave soldiers lost his life.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ ogun tí ó farapa náà sì ti ń gba ìwòsàn lọ́wọ́-lọ́wọ́ ní ilé ìwòsàn ológun.
en: The injured soldiers are receiving treatment at the military hospital.

yo: Ní kété tí ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ náà wáyé ní ọjọ́ kéjìlélógún oṣù kejì ọdún tó kọjá, ni wọ́n dé.
en: As soon as the incident happened on the 22nd day of the second month of last year, they arrived.

yo: Ọ̀gágun Táyé Ajíbọ́dẹ ti ṣe àbẹ̀wò sí ikọ̀ náà ní Olúyọ̀lé.
en: General Táyé Ajibodé has visited the embassy in Olúyolé.

yo: Ẹ jọ̀ọ́ ẹ bá wa bí àwọn mínísítà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí pé ibo lọ́ tí ń rí owó?
en: Please ask us like the ministers of this country that where are they getting money from?

yo: Ààrẹ tuntun tí a yàn sípò ní láti yan àwọn mínísítà mìíràn.
en: The newly appointed president has to appoint other ministers.

yo: Babátúndé Fáṣolá nìkan ni mínísítà tó dá yàtò nínú gbogbo àwọn mínísítà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
en: Babatunde Fashola is the only minister who is different among all the ministers of this country.

yo: Ipò tí wọ́n yan Babátúndé Fásholá sí, a rí ipa rẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
en: The position that Babatúndé Fashola was appointed to, we see his influence on this language.

yo: Wíwá orísirísi ìlànà fún ìtọ́jú ojú pópó jákè-jádò orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ló jẹ wá lógún.
en: It is our duty to find out the different policies for street maintenance across Nigeria.

yo: Díẹ̀ nínu ojú pópó ní Nàìjíríà ó lè gbóúnjẹ-fẹ́gbẹ́ gbàwo bọ̀ lọ́dọọdún.
en: Few of the streets in Nigeria can get sick every year.

yo: Mínísítà sọ̀rọ̀ yìí ní lásìkò ètò àyẹ̀wò iṣẹ́ ojú pópó ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn
en: The minister said this during the road inspection program in Ogun state.

yo: Ìdíkọ́ Oṣòdì tó wà ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Agége, ni agbègbè tí ó tóbi jùlọ ní ìlú Èkó.
en: Osodi River in Agége local government is the largest area in the city of Lagos.

yo: Fáṣọlá sọ pé ìtọ́jú ojú pópó ṣe pàtàkì pàápàá jùlọ lásìkò òjò.
en: Fashola said that road maintenance is especially important during the rainy season.

yo: Ayálégbé tó fojú ba ilé ẹjọ́ gbọ́dọ̀ san owó ìtanràn.
en: A tenant who faces court must pay a fine.

yo: Àkànní gbọ́dọ̀ fowó kún owó oṣù tó fẹ́ san fún àwọn asòfin.
en: Akanni must invest in the salary to be paid to the legislators.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ìpínlẹ̀ Òǹdó ṣì ń tẹ̀síwájú nínú ìwádìí i wọn.
en: Ondo state police are still continuing their investigation.

yo: Ṣé lóòtọ́ ni ìjọba ń ná owó tó tó owó lórí i ètò ìlera àwọn ará ìlú?
en: Is the government really spending enough money on the health system of the citizens?

yo: Ìdàrúdàpọ̀ wáyé láàárín àwọn ọlọ́jà a gààrí àti epo nítorí ipò.
en: There was confusion among the sellers of sugar and oil because of the situation.

yo: Àwọn ẹ̀yà a Yorùbá máa ń pé ara wọn ní ọmọ ilẹ̀ ẹ káàárọ̀ oò jíire.
en: The Yoruba tribes call themselves the natives of the country.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìbéèrè ni àwọn èèyàn ń bèèrè lọ́wọ́ adarí lórí ọ̀rọ̀ náà.
en: Many questions are being asked by the leader on the topic.

yo: Ìpínlẹ̀ Òǹdó lè bọ́ orílẹ̀ èdè yí pẹ̀lú àwọn ohun àlùmóọ́nì i rẹ̀.
en: Ondo State can feed this country with its nutrients.

yo: Ṣé nǹkan yàtọ̀ lẹ́yìn ìgbà tí Mọ́remí gbìyànjú láti fi ẹ̀mí ọmọ rẹ̀ lélẹ̀?
en: Are things different after Moremi tried to sacrifice her son's life?

yo: Kí ni èrò àwọn èèyàn nípa ọ̀rọ̀ Àyìnlá Ọmọwúrà?
en: What do people think about Ainla Omwura?

yo: Ìwúlò òwe kìí ṣe kékéré láwùjọ Yorùbá.
en: The importance of proverbs is not small in Yoruba society.

yo: Ìwádìí ṣì máa wà lórí ayédèrú ìròyìn ní ilẹ̀ yìí fún ọdún kan.
en: There will still be an investigation on fake news in this country for a year.

yo: Ìwádìí ilé aṣòfin forísánpọ́n lórí ẹ̀sùn apànìyàn tí wọ́n fi kan Fẹ́mi.
en: The parliamentary investigation was opened on the murder charge against Femi.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́kùnrìn tó fẹ́ sọ ilé ìjọba di ilé ọtí ni a máa lé dànù.
en: The youths who want to turn government buildings into bars will be thrown out.

yo: Ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lórí ohun tí ó máa fa àìsàn ìtọ̀ ọ súgà máa wáyé láìpẹ́.
en: A tutorial on what causes diabetes is coming soon.

yo: A máa sọ̀rọ̀ lórí àìsàn ìtọ̀ ọ ṣúgà àti ọ̀nà tí a lè gbà dènà ra ẹ̀.
en: We will consider the sickness sickness sick and how we can save you.

yo: A ní ìgbàgbọ́ pé ètò ìbò ọdún yìí yóò yàtọ̀ sí ti tẹ́lẹ̀.
en: We believe that this year's voting system will be different from the previous one.

yo: Ìjọba tí ń gbé ìgbésẹ̀ òfin láti dẹ́kun kíkó kẹ́tẹ́kẹ́tẹ́ lọ sí ìlú mìíràn.
en: The government is taking legal action to stop bringing donkeys to other cities.

yo: Àwọn tí wọ́n ní dúkìá púpọ̀ ni wọ́n ń ṣe onídùúró ẹlòmíràn.
en: Those who have a lot of property are acting as a supporter of others.

yo: Ìwà a jàndùkú àti ìpáǹle ti wà láyé, ọjọ́ ti pẹ́.
en: There is violence and oppression in the world, the days are long.

yo: Májèlé inú àmàlà ṣekúpa èèyàn mẹ́rin ní ìlú kan tí wọ́n pè ní ṣobí
en: Amla poison killed four people in a town called Sobi

yo: Àwọn akẹgbẹ́ ẹ Ṣadé ti padà sí ilé ìwé, ṣùgbọ́n Ṣadé kò bá wọn wọlé.
en: Şadeh's companions have returned to school, but Şadeh did not go in with them.

yo: Wọ́n yàn olórí ìjọ, àmọ́ orí gbé e dé ipò igbákejì ààrẹ.
en: They elected the head of the church, but the head elevated him to the position of vice president.

yo: Bàbá àgbà ni ó ṣe aṣojú u bàbá a rẹ̀ níbi ayẹyẹ náà.
en: Grandfather represented his father at the ceremony.

yo: Ìjọba àpapọ̀ gbé owó ribiti kalẹ̀ bíi owó ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn ará ìlú.
en: The federal government established a stipend as a subsidy for the citizens.

yo: Arẹ́gbẹ́ṣọlá ń ràn mí lọ́wọ́ lórí ìtọ́jú àwọn opó.
en: Argegsola is helping me with the care of widows.

yo: Ògúǹdè ṣe iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá àti olùkọ́ kó tó yan iṣẹ́ eré ìtàgé láàyò.
en: Ogunde worked as a policeman and a teacher before he chose acting.

yo: Ta ni ò mọ̀ pé àwọn àgbà jẹ́ ilé ìṣura ọgbọ́n?
en: Who does not know that elders are a treasure house of wisdom?

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́bìnrin tí wọ́n jẹ́ olùdíje fún ipò ayaba pọ̀ ní ọdún yìí.
en: There are many young women who are candidates for the position of queen this year.

yo: Onímọ̀ kan ló sọ pé ìpèsè ilé ẹ̀kọ́ nìkan kò lè yanjú ìpènijà yìí.
en: An expert said that school provision alone cannot solve this challenge.

yo: Owó ọjà mí tí wọ́n jí kó pọ̀ gan, òhun sì ló fa àpadàsáburú yìí.
en: My shopping money that was stolen was a lot, and that is what caused this tragedy.

yo: Ìwádìí ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ lórí ètò ọ̀rọ̀ ajé ní ìlú Ìbàdàn.
en: Research has begun on the economy in the city of Ibadan.

yo: Ọlọ́pàá ni Àdìsá ló fipá bá àwọn ọmọdébìnrin náà lò pọ̀.
en: It was Adisa who raped the girls by the police.

yo: Ọọ̀ni ti kéde ìpàdé àwọn lọ́balọ́ba láti ṣàpérò àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ ìlú.
en: Oni has announced a meeting of officials to discuss the issues of the city.

yo: Ilé isẹ́ ológun nílò ìmọ̀ nípa kíkọjú àwọn tí wọ́n ń ṣọ̀tẹ̀ sí ìlú.
en: The military needs to know how to deal with those who are rebelling in the city.

yo: Ó gba sùúrù, ìfarabalẹ̀ àti ìrònújinlẹ̀ láti bá mi ṣe iṣẹ́ yìí.
en: It took patience, dedication and thoughtfulness to do this work with me.

yo: Kò sí àní àní pé Ilẹ̀ Ifẹ̀ ni orírun gbogbo àgbàáyé.
en: It is not even that the Land of Love is the origin of all the universe.

yo: Afẹ́fẹ́ ẹ káràkátà tuntun tó fẹ́ wọ ìpínlẹ̀ yìí rọrùn kí a má sọ ìdàkejì.
en: The new car that wants to enter this state is easy to say the other way around.

yo: Ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ ni ìgbàgbọ́ àwọn ènìyàn nípa ìṣẹ̀dá ayé.
en: People's beliefs about the creation of the world are different.

yo: Lẹ́yìn tí mo bá ti jẹun tí mo sùn, mi ò ní rí ti yín rò.
en: After I have eaten and slept, I will not see what you think.

yo: Ìdí iṣẹ́ ológun ni bàbá à mi ti padà wá sílé pẹ̀lú ojú kan.
en: Because of military service, my father came home with one eye.

yo: Mi ò nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí kíkọlà sọ́mọ lójú nítorí inú ìrora ni ọmọ náà á wà.
en: I don't like circumcising close to the face because the child will be in pain.

yo: Ìtàn-an málegbàgbé ni àwọn ìtàn akọni bíi Mọ́remí ní àwùjọ Yorùbá.
en: The stories of heroes like Moremi in the Yoruba community are unforgettable stories.

yo: Bá wo ni a ṣe máa sọ̀rọ̀ nípa eréṣùpá, tí a ò ní mẹnu ba ààlọ́.
en: How can we talk about the moon, when we don't have anyone to deal with.

yo: Ilé ìwé kan ní Ìbàdàn ní ìmúra àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ò le yí padà.
en: A school in Ibadan has a student's attitude that cannot be changed.

yo: Adéṣọlá bẹ̀bẹ̀ fún oṣù díẹ̀ láti ṣe iṣẹ́ ìwádìí nínú u ìlú náà.
en: Adesola asked for a few months to do research in the city.

yo: Tí mi ò bá rí nǹkan oṣù mi ní oṣù tó ń bọ̀, á jẹ́ pé mo ti lóyún.
en: If I don't get my period next month, I will be pregnant.

yo: Àwọn jàndùkú ń dánà de àwọn ọkọ̀ lójú u pópó.
en: The robbers were burning the boats in front of him.

yo: Ẹ̀gbọ́n mi ti ṣèlérí fún àwọn òbí i wa láti fi àwọn ìwà burúkú sílẹ̀.
en: My brother has promised our parents to give up bad habits.

yo: Òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba ni ìyá mi fún ọdún púpọ̀ kí wọ́n tó fi iṣẹ́ sílẹ̀.
en: My mother was a civil servant for many years before she retired.

yo: Ọwọ́ ìjọba ti tẹ Àkànní àti àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀ níbi tí wọ́n tí ń gbìmọ̀ ọ̀tẹ̀.
en: The hand of the government has pressed Akanni and his friends where they are plotting rebellion.

yo: Nítorí i àìsan owó oṣù, àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ilé ìwòsàn da iṣẹ́ sílẹ̀ nílùú Èkó.
en: Due to non-payment of salaries, hospital workers left their jobs in Lagos.

yo: Gbogbo ara ló ro mí gidi, ṣùgbọ́n mo gbọdọ̀ parí iṣẹ́ yìí.
en: Everyone thinks I'm real, but I must finish this job.

yo: Mi ò mọ bí mo ṣe fẹ́ gbé ọ̀rọ̀ náà kalẹ̀ níwájú àwọn àgbàlagbà náà.
en: I don't know how I want to present the matter in front of the elders.

yo: À ń se ìwádìí lórí àwọn tí wọ́n ń fi iṣẹ́ oníwàásù bojú.
en: We are investigating those who are covering the work of the preacher.

yo: Mo jẹ́rìí pé Àdìsá á fi àgbà han àbúrò o rẹ̀ kí n tó délé.
en: I testify that Adisa will show the elder brother that he is tired before I go home.

yo: Nǹkankan ni mo mọ̀ pé ó lè ṣe ikú pa èèyàn nínú ilé yìí.
en: One thing I know is that it can kill people in this house.

yo: Èrò o rẹ̀ ni pé kò le kó ààrùn nítorí ó ti jẹ àjẹsára lọ́dọ̀ bàbá àgbà.
en: He thought that he could not catch the disease because he had been vaccinated by his grandfather.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ aráàlú ni inú u wọn dun láti ri pé ọmọ ọba yege.
en: Many citizens were happy to see that the king's son survived.

yo: Bàbá Àdìsá ló jẹ́ igi lẹ́yìn ọgbà fún ọmọ rẹ̀ lórí i kó lè dáa fun.
en: Adisa's father planted a tree behind the garden for his son so that it would be good for him.

yo: Ọ̀ṣúnfúnkẹ́ kìí se ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wa, alárinà lásán ni ó jẹ́.
en: Osufunke is not a member of our group, he is just a mediator.

yo: Ìjọba tún ṣe ìlérí pé kò ní sí súnkẹrẹ fàkẹrẹ ọkọ mọ́ l'Ékòó.
en: The government also promised that there will be no more car accidents in Ekooo.

yo: Àwọn onígbèsè yìí ń tán wa ní sùúrù pẹ̀lú u bí wọ́n ò ṣe rówó san.
en: These debtors are trying to be patient with him as they do not pay.

yo: A máa ríi bí àwọn ilé ìjọsìn ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó yóò ṣe máa jọ́sìn.
en: We will see how the houses of worship in Lagos state will worship.

yo: Wọ́n rọ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ìlú láti má se iṣẹ́ tí ó máa kọjá agbára wọn.
en: They urged the youth of the city not to do work that would be beyond their ability.

yo: Àwọn adarí ilé iṣẹ́ náà ni ó ń fa wàhálà fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ náà.
en: The managers of the company are causing problems for the workers.

yo: Kí ni o mọ̀ nípa olórin tí ó ń jẹ́ Àyìndé tó kọ orin ijó o fújì?
en: What do you know about the singer called Ainde who sings dance music?

yo: A kò ní fi ìyà jẹ Àjàní lórí i ìgbésẹ̀ tí ó gbé lórí ọ̀rọ̀ náà.
en: Ajani will not be punished for the action he took on the issue.

yo: Atọ́ládé ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìgbésẹ̀ láti fẹ́ Àbìkẹ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí aya rẹ̀.
en: Atolade has begun the process of marrying Abike as his wife.

yo: Tí mo bá ń gbọ́ orin, inú ù mi máa ń rọ̀, a sì máa mú orí ì mi wálẹ̀.
en: When I listen to music, I feel sad and my head is lowered.

yo: Àwọn ìjọba náà le tí ilé aṣòfin pa fún iye ọdún tó bá gbà.
en: The government can be closed by the parliament for as many years as it takes.

yo: Ọ̀yọ́ ó mọ̀ pé àwọn gbàlejò lónìí nítorí mi ò kí ń ṣe èèyàn yẹpẹrẹ.
en: He is happy to know that today's guests are not taking people for granted because of me.

yo: Ilé ẹjọ́ ni ó yẹ kó lè sọ tẹnu rẹ̀ lórí ẹ̀sùn òlè tí wọ́n fi kàn ẹ́.
en: It is the court that should be able to emphasize on the accusation of theft.

yo: Ta ni ò ní nǹkan tí ó ń là kọjá tàbí ìtàn tí ó máa rí sọ?
en: Who doesn't have something to go through or a story to tell?

yo: Mo fẹ́ mọ ìdí tí wọ́n fí ń pe Fẹlá Kútì ní abàmì ẹ̀dá.
en: I want to know why they call Fela Kuti a monster.

yo: Àwọn tọkọ tìyàwó tí wọ́n ṣe ìgbéyàwó ní ọdún kan sẹ́yìn ti pínyà.
en: The couple who got married a year ago have separated.

yo: Ọládipúpọ̀ ni olùdíje tó gbégbá orókè nínú ìdíjè náà.
en: Oladipopoi was the winner of the competition.

yo: Èmi ò mọ arábìnrin tí wọ́n fi ẹjọ́ ọ rẹ̀ lọ̀ mí rí.
en: I have never known the sister whose case was sent to me.

yo: Olórí ẹbí àti àwọn ẹbí lè gbéná wojú ara wọn láìpẹ́ lórí ọ̀rọ̀ yìí.
en: The head of the family and the families may soon face each other on this matter.

yo: Òfin tuntun ló fa wàhálà láàárín àwọn ọ̀dọ́ àti àwọn aṣòfin.
en: The new law caused trouble between the youth and the legislators.

yo: Àwọn Yorùbá ní ìgbàgbọ́ tó jinlẹ̀ nínú Ọ̀rúnmìlà àti Olódùmarè.
en: The Yorubas have a deep faith in God Almighty.

yo: Ó yẹ kí fífi ìjilnlẹ̀ ẹ Yorùbá kọ àwọn ọmọdé jẹ́ nǹkan ìwúrí fún òbí.
en: Teaching Yoruba to children should be an encouragement to parents.

yo: Ọbẹ̀ ilá ni mo fẹ́ sè tí mo bá ti ibi iṣẹ́ dé ní ọ̀la.
en: I want to cook rice soup when I get to work tomorrow.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ Agbọmọlà fẹ́ wọ́de ní ìrántì àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wọn tó kú.
en: The Ambomola group wants to come in memory of their dead members.

yo: Àwọn alágbára á máa já ìjọba gbà mọ́ àwọn aláìlágbára lọ́wọ́.
en: The powerful will take over the government from the weak.

yo: Àwọn ohun tó yẹ kí o mọ̀ nípa Ọọ̀ni Ilẹ̀ ifẹ̀ tuntun nìyí.
en: Here are the things you should know about the new Love Earth Day.

yo: Ẹbí, ọ̀rẹ́ àti ojúlùmọ̀ péjú láti ṣayẹyẹ ìkẹyìn fún Bàbá tó kú lánàá.
en: Family, friends and acquaintances gathered to celebrate the last time for Dad who died yesterday.

yo: Ọdún wo ni mo mọ̀ tó ti jókòó sí ibi tó wà yẹn, tí mo máa ní kó dìde.
en: How many years do I know that he has been sitting in that place, that I will ask him to get up.

yo: Ilé Epo tí mo ti fẹ́ ra epo ò jìnà sí ilé e wa.
en: The petrol station where I wanted to buy petrol is not far from our house.

yo: Ọba àti àwọn ijòyè e rẹ̀ ní iṣẹ́ púpọ̀ láti ṣe lórí ọ̀rọ̀ iná nínú ìlú yìí.
en: The king and his officials have a lot of work to do on the issue of fire in this city.

yo: Ní ìgbà wo gan an ni a lè sọ pé àbádòfin ìdìbò tuntun yóò di òfin?
en: When exactly can we say that the new electoral law will become law?

yo: Wàhálà tó n wáyé lórí ẹni tí yóò jẹ adarí ẹgbẹ́ náà kò tíì dópin.
en: The crisis that is happening on who will be the leader of the group has not ended.

yo: Òun ni ó jẹ Ìyalóde kẹ́yìn, tó sì ń ṣe dáadáa láti ọdún díẹ̀ sẹ́yìn.
en: He is the last immigrant, and he has been doing well for the past few years.

yo: Òkè òkun ni mo ti máa ń ra àwọn bàtà tí mo máa ń wọ̀ sẹ́sẹ̀.
en: I used to buy the shoes I used to walk on the beach.

yo: Bí arákùnrin náà ṣe máa ń tọ́jú aya àti ẹbí i rẹ̀ kò bójúmu tó.
en: The way the brother takes care of his wife and family is not appropriate.

yo: Ìyá Àjàó lè fi ọlọ́pàá gbé ẹni tó bá ṣèèṣì fọwọ́ kan ọmọ rẹ̀.
en: Ajao's mother can use the police to pick up anyone who accidentally touches her child.

yo: Ọjọ́ àbámẹ́ta tó kọjá ni Ìyalóde kí ayé pé ó dìgbòóṣe.
en: The last three days in Iyalode let the world die.

yo: Ìpè ayọ̀ ni mo gbàdúrà kí etí ì mi máa gbọ́ nínú ọdún yìí.
en: I pray that my ears will hear the call of joy this year.

yo: Ìdùnnú ará ilú jẹ́ ohùn kan tí ó gbọdọ̀ jẹ adarí ìlú lógún.
en: The joy of the people is a voice that must be the leader of the city.

yo: Kò sí amúgbálẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ inú ìtàn náà tí kò ní ipa tí ó ń kó.
en: There is no character in the story that does not have a role to play.

yo: Ọmọ ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n ló padà di olóṣèlú ní orílẹ̀ èdè ńlá kan.
en: He is a professor's son who became a politician in a big country.

yo: Ìjọba ṣe ìkìlọ̀ pàtàkì lórí ewu ìbọn rírà fún nítorí ìdìbò ọdún yìí.
en: The government issued a serious warning on the dangers of buying guns because of this year's election.

yo: Ó ní àwọn nǹkan tó yẹ kí ẹ mọ̀ nípa à mi tí ẹ bá máa bá mi ṣiṣẹ́.
en: It has things you should know about me if you are going to work with me.

yo: Ta ni àwọn olùdíje ipò náà ní Ògùn, mo fẹ́ mọ̀ wọ́n.
en: Who are the candidates for the position in Ogun, I want to know them.

yo: Ẹfúnṣetán Aníwúrà jẹ ìyálóde Ìbàdàn nígbà kan, tó sì lówó.
en: Effunsetán Aníwura was once the mother of Ibadan, and she was rich.

yo: Ó wu Àdìsá láti pa ohùn mọ́ àwọn alátakò lẹ́nu.
en: Adisa likes to silence the opposition.

yo: Ilé ẹjọ́ tó ga jùlọ ní orílẹ̀ èdè e wa wọ́gilé ẹ̀wọ̀n ọ̀dọ́kùnrin náà.
en: The most outstanding court of the young man, in a young man was cheated at the young man.

yo: Sọlá ti sọ tẹ́lẹ̀ náà pé Adé kìí ṣe ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wọn.
en: Solá has already said that Adé is not a member of their group.

yo: Lórí ọ̀rọ̀ ìdìbò ọdún tó kọjá, Abíọ́dún kò yóju síbi ìpàdé ẹgbẹ́.
en: On the issue of last year's election, Abiodun did not look at the party meeting.

yo: Ìjọba Èkó ti sọ pé ìwakuwà àwọn awakọ̀ ló ń fa súnkẹrẹ ọkọ̀.
en: The government of Lagos has said that the behavior of drivers is causing the decline in traffic.

yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ àwọn ọlọ́pàá ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó tako ìbálòpọ̀ nínú ọkọ̀.
en: The Lagos State Police Council opposes sex in vehicles.

yo: Àwọn olùdíje ti jẹ́ ẹ̀jẹ́ láti se ìpolongo ìbò láì lọ́wọ́ ẹ̀sìn àti ẹ̀yà nínú.
en: Candidates have been sworn to campaign without regard to religion and caste.

yo: Ará ilé kan ló máa ba gbogbo ará ilé gba ilẹ̀ ẹ wọn jọ, tí á dẹ̀ jo.
en: A member of the house will collect their land together with all the members of the house, which will be danced.

yo: Ìjọba kò mú àdéhùn wọn àtọdúnmọ́dún ṣẹ, la ṣé ń wosẹ́ níran.
en: The government did not fulfill their seven-year agreement, we are seeing.

yo: Wọ́n ti sọ fún wa tẹ́lẹ̀ pé àwọn kìí ṣe alárùn ọpọlọ.
en: They have already told us that they are not mentally ill.

yo: Ọlọ́páà ló fi ẹ̀sùn kan alàgbà tó fẹsẹ̀ fẹ lẹ́yìn tọ́mọ ijọ rì sọ́mi.
en: It was the police who charged an elder who wanted to kill the church.

yo: ̄Mo máa yà ilé ìwòsàn láti gba èsì àyẹ̀wò tí mo ṣe.
en: ̄ I will go to the hospital to get the results of the test I did.

yo: Ṣé ó dá ẹ lójú pé ó máa gba ọ̀pá àṣẹ láti tukọ̀ Eko?
en: Are you sure that he will get the authority to destroy Lagos?

yo: Àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí máa ń gba owó ìrànwọ́ fún iwádìí ìjìnlẹ̀.
en: Citizens of this country receive grants for scientific research.

yo: Lóòótọ́ ni ó mọ̀wé, ṣùgbọ́n ó ní láti gbaradì fún ìdánwò tó kẹ́yìn.
en: Of course he knows, but he has to prepare for the final exam.

yo: Ẹ̀rù ló n bà adarí ètò ni kò jẹ́ kí wọ́n pè mí sí ìfọ̀rọ̀wérọ̀ náà.
en: The director of the program was afraid and did not allow me to be invited to the discussion.

yo: Fáṣọlá ló sọ pé kìí ṣe ẹ̀bi ìjọba àpapọ̀ tí a kò bá rí iná ọba lò
en: Fashola said that it is not the federal government's fault if the royal fire is not used

yo: Ọmọ náà ló máa n fa àwọn ìjà kéékèèké láàárín ìyá àti bàbá a rẹ̀
en: The child is the one who causes small fights between his mother and his father

yo: Níwọ̀n ìgbà tí Ṣọlá ti bímọ, ó tó kí ó wọ bàtà tí ìyá a rẹ̀ bọ́ sílẹ̀.
en: Since Çola had given birth, it was enough for her to wear the shoes that her mother dropped.

yo: Apá ọba ò lè ka ìjọ̀gbọ̀n tí ó ń fà lẹ́sẹ̀ yìí nítorí ìlú ló ń bá fà á
en: The king's side can't count the stupidity that he is doing this time because the city is doing it

yo: Ọwọ́ ọ̀lọ́pàá ti tẹ àwọn afurasí tó ń ta ayédèrú ògùn ní Èkó.
en: The police have arrested suspects selling counterfeit drugs in Lagos.

yo: Àwọn kókó tó jẹyọ níbi ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò igbákejì àárẹ.
en: The points that emerged at the interview of the vice president.

yo: Ààrẹ tí ń padà bọ̀ láàjò, kí onílé kó gbọ́ kó sọ fún toko
en: The president who is returning from a visit, let the owner of the house listen and tell the toko

yo: Egbìnrìn ọ̀tẹ̀ tí ó ń wọlé tọni wá ni ọ̀rọ̀ ìjínigbé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Òǹdó.
en: The source of the rebellion that is coming in is the issue of kidnapping in Ondo state.

yo: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ilé aṣòfin ìlú Ìbàdàn máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ iyànṣẹ́lódì láti ọ̀la lọ.
en: The workers of the parliament of Ibadan will start their assignment from tomorrow.

yo: Ilé iṣẹ́ ológùún bẹnu àtẹ́ lu àìbìkítà àwọn ará ìlú lórí ìdáàbòbò.
en: The police department criticized the lack of attention of the citizens on security.

yo: Ìpàdé àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba àti ìjọba lórí ọ̀rọ̀ owó òṣù tún forí sánpọ́n
en: The meeting between government officials and the government on the issue of salaries also ended

yo: Fáyẹmí wípé gbèsè tí òun bá nílẹ̀ ni kò jẹ́ kí ó tíì yan igbákejì
en: Fayemi said that the debt he has has not allowed him to choose the second

yo: Mo gbọ pé ilé e ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin júwe ilé fáwọn alága ìjọba ìbílẹ̀
en: I heard that the house of parliament is the house for local government chairmen

yo: Ìjọba kéde pé kí àwọn ènìyàn máa tètè sọ ẹ̀dùn ọkàn wọn.
en: The government announced that people should be quick to express their grievances.

yo: Ẹjọ́ ti dé ọ̀dọ̀ ọ baálẹ̀ ìlú, kò sì sí ẹ́ni tó lè tú ìgbìmọ̀.
en: The case has reached the mayor, and there is no one who can dissolve the council.

yo: Ètò àbò àti ètò ẹ̀kọ́ ṣe kókó nínú àwùjọ tí a wà báyìí.
en: Security and education systems are important in today's society.

yo: Àkànbí dèrò ọ̀run nítorí Eré orí ẹní ní ìlú Èkó
en: Akanbi is waiting for the sky because of the head game in the city of Eko

yo: Àwọn olùgbé Ìbàdàn ni àpọ̀jù iná a mọ̀nàmọ́ná ń da àwọn láàmú.
en: The residents of Ibadan are troubled by the excess of electricity.

yo: Ọ̀wọ́n epo rọ̀bí ló fa ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ àìgbọ́raẹniyé láàárin àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ náà.
en: The rubber oil chain caused the incident of misunderstanding between the states.

yo: Àṣìṣe ni ó ṣe tí wọ́n fi yọ ọ́ kúrò lára àwọn olùdíje ipò náà
en: It was a mistake that he was removed from the candidates for the position

yo: Wo ọ̀rọ̀ kékeré tó dá awuyewuye sílẹ̀ láàárín àwọn àgbàlagbà.
en: Look at the small talk that caused controversy among the elders.

yo: Wo àwọn aṣíwájú àgbáyé tí wọ́n ń ko ipa ribiribi.
en: Look at the world leaders who are making a big impact.

yo: Ṣé ìwọ gbàgbọ́ pé èèyàn kankan ò lè gbà wá nínú oko ẹrú ni?
en: Do you believe that no one can save us from slavery?

yo: Igun Àdé àti igun Ṣọlá ní àwọn ni alága ẹgbẹ́ tọ́ sí
en: Igun Adé and Igun Shola are the ones who deserve the chairmanship

yo: Olórin-ìn kan ni ó sọ pé ìtanijí ni orin tí ó kọ fún àgbà àti ọmọdé.
en: A singer said that the song he sings for adults and children is a wake-up call.

yo: Mi ò kàn fẹ́ sọ pé ikú ọmọ wọn ló sọ ìyá náà di rádaràda
en: I don't just want to say that it was the death of their child that made the mother whole

yo: Àwọn Afẹ́nifẹ́re ló pín ẹran ọdún délé è mi nítorí ìfẹ́ wọ́n ní sí mi.
en: Lovers shared the meat of the year at my house because of their love for me.

yo: Obìnrin kògbérégbè nínú òṣèré e Yorùbá ni wọ́n ṣàfihàn lórí ètò.
en: A female Yoruba actress was featured on the show.

yo: Ohun tí ó yé àwọn ènìyàn ni pé ìdí ńlá kìí ṣe òdìwọ̀n fún ẹwà.
en: What people understand is that great reason is not the measure of beauty.

yo: Àwa la ni owó tí àwọn adigunjalè jágbà lójú u pópó.
en: We have the money that the robbers stole in front of him.

yo: Ìkíni kú oríire ti ya ọ̀dọ̀ ọ Fúnkẹ́ àti ọkọ rẹ̀ lórí ọmọ tí wọ́n bí.
en: Congratulations to Funke and her husband on their new born child.

yo: Gbogbo òṣìṣẹ ló n fẹ́ ìlọsíwájú ilé iṣẹ́ tí wọ́n bá tí ń ṣiṣẹ́
en: All employees want the progress of the company they are working for

yo: Ìṣọ̀kan àwọn ará ìlú ni ìgbẹ̀yin gbogbo ọ̀tẹ̀ lóòótọ́.
