yo: Bàbá Sùwé ló yẹ kí ó jẹ ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ àwọn òṣèré e Yorùbá
en: Suwe's father should be the president of the Yoruba actors' association

yo: Bọla Ìgè ti kú, ọjọ́ pẹ̀ dí, àwọn nkan tó yẹ́ kí o mọ̀ nípa rẹ̀ rèé
en: Bola Ige is dead, it's late, things you should know about him

yo: Àwọn olórin ilẹ̀ wá pọ̀ tó fakọyọ nilẹ̀ Adúláwò lọ́dún yìí
en: There are a lot of country musicians who have performed in Adulawo this year

yo: Ọgọ́rùn-ún èèyàn ló pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn nínú ìkọlù tí ó sẹlẹ̀ ní Èkìtì
en: Hundreds of people lost their lives in the attack in Ekiti

yo: Ìṣe àti  àṣà mìíràn tí àwọn olóṣèlú fi da gbogbo ètò náà rú nìyí.
en: This is another act and practice by which the politicians have messed up the whole system.

yo: Màmá tó jẹ́ onímọ̀ òye kọjá lọ ní àárọ̀ kùtùkùtù lánàá
en: Mother who was a scholar passed away early yesterday morning

yo: Ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn ti gbà kí àwọn òṣèré lo pápá ìṣeré fún ìpolongo eré.
en: Ogun State has allowed players to use the stadium for game promotion.

yo: Ilé ìwòsàn kan ti di ṣíṣí padà lẹ́yìn oṣù díẹ̀ tí wọ́n tìí pa.
en: A hospital has reopened after months of closure.

yo: Ilé iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá bu ẹnu àtẹ́ lu ìròyìn pé àwọn ọlọ́pàá kan sá lọ
en: The police department denied the news that some policemen ran away

yo: Àwọn agbénipa tí wọ́n jí ọmọ náà gbé ní ojú u pópó lásán ló paá
en: The thugs who kidnapped the child killed him in plain sight

yo: Ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́, kò sí olóṣèlú tó fẹ́ fí owó ra aṣọ lọ́wọ́ ọ wa
en: In Oyo state, no politician wants to buy clothes from us

yo: Ṣé lóòótọ́ ni ìjọba pé àkíyèsí àwọn ará ìlú sí ọ̀tẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn.
en: Is it true that the government is paying attention to the rebellion in Ogun state.

yo: Ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun, ajàfẹ́tọ̀ọ́ gbé gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun lọ sílé ẹjọ́.
en: In Osun state, ajafetoto took the governor of Osun state to court.

yo: Òṣèré kan ló sọ pé iṣẹ́ amòfin tí òun kọ́ kò mú owó wọlé mọ́.
en: An actor said that the legal work he did not bring in money anymore.

yo: Ó ti máa ń sọ tẹ́lẹ̀ pé inú ń dun òun kí ó tó gba ibẹ̀ lọ
en: He used to say that he was sad before he went there

yo: Àwọn nǹkan tó ṣẹlẹ̀ níbi ayẹyẹ ìgbéyàwó ò ṣé bá ẹ̀dá kankan sọ
en: The things that happened at the wedding ceremony should not be said to any creature

yo: Àwọn ohun tó yẹ kí o mọ̀ nípa olóògbé tí wọ́n ń ṣe ayẹyẹ tòkú ẹ̀
en: The things you should know about the deceased who are being celebrated

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ èèyàn ló jóná di eérú nínú iná tó jó ní ilé iṣẹ́ kan ní Èkó
en: Many people were burnt to ashes in a fire in a factory in Lagos

yo: Ọba ìlú wa kìlọ̀ fún áwọn ọ̀dọ́ lórí i ṣíṣe òògùn owó òjijì.
en: The king of our city warned the youth against making sudden money.

yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ní àwọn kò tíì gbọ́ nípa ikú aṣòfin ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó to kú
en: The Legislative Council said they have not heard about the death of the late Lagos state legislator

yo: Wọ́n ti sọ pé wọ́n fún àwọn adarí ní ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì si láti dá wa lóhùn
en: They have said that they gave the leaders two more weeks to answer us

yo: Ilé iṣẹ́ ọmọ ogun ìlú Ìbàdàn ti mọ àwọn ọmọ ogun ti lọ ojú ogun.
en: The military office of the city of Ibadan has known that the soldiers have gone to war.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn pàdánù ẹ̀mí i wọn nínú ìjàmbá ọkọ ní Èkó.
en: People lost their lives in a car accident in Lagos.

yo: Mo fẹ́ jẹ́ kí wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ lórí ìwé ìrìnna mi.
en: I want them to start processing my passport.

yo: Bí ọmọ ṣe ń wá sáyé náà ni èèyàn ń jáde kúrò láyé lójóojúmọ́.
en: As a child comes into the world, a person leaves the world every day.

yo: Kí ni ohun tí àwọn ìránṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run sọ nípa ọdún tó ń bọ̀?
en: What did the servants of God say about the coming year?

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ òṣìṣẹ̀ yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìyanṣẹ́lódì láti ọ̀sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀ lọ.
en: The task force will start the assignment from next week.

yo: Ọlọ́pàá ti fẹ́ wó ilé mi lulẹ̀ bí kìí bá ṣe ọpẹ́lọpẹ́ àwọn ará ìlú.
en: The police wanted to demolish my house if it wasn't for the gratitude of the people.

yo: Ìyàwó o gómìnà Èkìtì rọ àwọn obìnrin ìlú lóríi ewu gbígbẹ̀bí sílé.
en: Ekiti governor's wife urges city women on the dangers of giving birth at home.

yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ akadá ní ìjọba àpapọ̀ ni kò fẹ́ kí ìyanṣẹ́lódì àwọn ó parí.
en: The federal government does not want their assignment to end.

yo: A fún àwọn adarí ní ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì síi láti dá àwọn opó náà lóhùn.
en: The leaders were given two more weeks to answer the widows.

yo: Lára àwọn ọmọ tí olóògbé bí sọ pé olóògbé fẹ́ràn ẹbí àti ará.
en: Among the children born to the deceased said that the deceased loved family and brothers.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ Yorùbá míràn ò mọ̀ pé èèwọ̀ ni kí obìnrin wọ igbó orò.
en: Other Yoruba people do not know that it is forbidden for a woman to enter the forest.

yo: Wọ́n ṣe ètò ìpàdé ìta gbangba ní àwọn àgbègbè kọ̀ọ̀kan.
en: They organized outdoor meetings in each area.

yo: Àwọn ará ìlú ní ọ̀gá ilé iṣẹ́ tí kò bá san ẹ̀kúnwó oṣù ń tàpá sí òfin.
en: The people of the city have a company boss who does not pay the monthly salary, they are violating the law.

yo: Bàlúù ogun orílẹ̀ èdè wa kan ti já lójú ìjà pẹ̀lú àwọn jàndùkú.
en: One of our nation's soldiers has lost his battle with the Jandukku.

yo: Àwọn ẹbí i Tósìn wí pé ẹ̀rù ń bà wọ́n lóri ìlera ọmọ wọn.
en: The families of Tósin said that they are afraid of their child's health.

yo: Èmi ti dáríjì ẹ́ ṣùgbọ́n ó yẹ kí ìwọ náà jọ̀wọ́ dáríjì mí.
en: I have forgiven you but you should also forgive me.

yo: Irọ̀ ni pé adarí ẹ̀gbẹ́ fún ẹbí ọmọ tí ó kú ní owó tí ó tó bẹ́ẹ̀.
en: It is a lie that the leader of the side for the family of the dead child has that much money.

yo: Ìjọba ti kéde pé ojú irin Àgbàdo gbọdọ̀ se é rìn láìpẹ́.
en: The government has announced that the Agbado train must run soon.

yo: A ò fẹ́ kí ẹ̀jẹ̀ ọmọ náà wà ní ọrùn-un wa nítorí a mọ̀ pé kò dáràn.
en: We do not want the child's blood on our neck because we know it is not good.

yo: Nítorí ìwà burúkú tí ó ti wù, kò lè wá sí ilé mi mọ́ láyé ẹ̀.
en: Because of his bad behavior, he can no longer come to my house.

yo: Á ṣe kaye àwọn èèyàn tó wà lẹ́wọ̀n ni ó fi rí i pé ó ti pọ̀ síi lọdún yìí.
en: If we count the number of people in prison, he saw that it has increased this year.

yo: Mi ò nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí gbogbo óúnjẹ tí wọ́n máa ń sè nílé mi ní alaalẹ́.
en: I don't like all the food that is cooked in my house at night.

yo: Àwọn aṣèwádìí ti fi èsì ìwádìí wọn tó ìjọba létí láti tọrọ ìrànwọ́.
en: Researchers have sent the results of their research to the government to ask for help.

yo: Ayẹyẹ ìdána ọmọbìnrin rẹ̀ jẹ́ èyí tí gbogbo èèyàn mọ̀ nípa rẹ̀.
en: His daughter's cooking party is what everyone knows about.

yo: Àwọn tó ṣèsẹ̀ gba yàrá tuntun lókè ní afínjú gidi.
en: Those who moved into the new room upstairs were really neat.

yo: Jọlá gba àgọ́ ọlọ́pàá lọ sílé ìwòsàn nítorí ọwọ́ ìyà tí ó bà á.
en: Jhola was taken from the police station to the hospital because of his injuries.

yo: Ìpàdé ọjọ́ ajé ni yóò jẹ́ kí a mọ̀ bóyá àwọn olùkó á yansẹ́ lódì.
en: The business meeting will let us know if the collectors will decide against.

yo: Àwọn ará ìlú ní ó yẹ kí ìyansẹ́lódì àwọn olùkó ti dópin.
en: The people of the city said that the assignment of the collectors should be over.

yo: Tí wọ́n bá ti ṣe nǹkan tí ò daa, wọ́n á ní ọ̀tá ló fẹ́ ba orúkọ wọn jẹ́.
en: If they have done something bad, they will have an enemy who wants to spoil their name.

yo: Ìran àwọn òjíṣẹ́ ń takora lórí ẹni tí yóò di ààrẹ nínú àwọn olùdíje.
en: The line of ministers is conflicting on who will become the president among the candidates.

yo: Òpómúléró ò mi ní ìyá àti bàbá mi jẹ́ fún àṣeyọrí àti àṣeyege è mi.
en: My mother and father gave me encouragement for my success and success.

yo: Pátá jíjí ti wá di iṣẹ́ fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́ tó yọ̀lẹ nítorí owó.
en: Stealing has become a job for young people who are lucky because of money.

yo: Mí ò sí lára àwọn aṣòfin tó máa ń sọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀gàn nípa ìjọba.
en: I am not one of the legislators who talk scornfully about the government.

yo: Ọmọ burúkú yìí ló dá wàhálà sílẹ̀ láàárin àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ náà.
en: This bad boy caused trouble among the friends.

yo: A kò mọ̀ ohùn tó mú ìjọba tí wọ́n fi wo àwọn ilé kan ní ìgboro.
en: We do not know the voice that made the government look at some houses in the street.

yo: Àlááfíà ti padà nítorí a ti mú àwọn tó ń dìtẹ̀ mọ́ ìjọba.
en: Peace has returned because the conspirators against the government have been arrested.

yo: Mo ti gbọ́ tẹ́lẹ̀ kò yẹ kí akàròyìn máa tú àṣírí àwọn ọlọ́pàá.
en: I have heard before that a journalist should not reveal the secrets of the police.

yo: Mi ò lè ṣàtìlẹyìn fún ọmọ tí kò bá ti lè gbọ́rọ̀ sí mi lẹ́nu.
en: I cannot support a child who cannot listen to me.

yo: Nínú oṣù u Ṣẹrẹ ni a máa ṣe àjọyọ́ ọ oye ọdún tí bàbá à mi ti kú.
en: In the month of May we will celebrate the anniversary of my father's death.

yo: Ilé iṣẹ́ aṣọ́bodè kò fún bàbá mi ní owó kankan, irọ́ ló pa.
en: The gate company did not give my father any money, it was a lie.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn kọ̀ọ̀kan lorílẹ̀ èdè yìí máa ní ìwọ́de lórí ìfipábánilòpọ̀.
en: Every person on this earth will have a choice on rape.

yo: Yínká fi orin ọpẹ́ sẹ́nu láti dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Ọlọ́run lórí ilé tuntun rẹ̀.
en: Yınka put a song of thanks in his mouth to thank God for his new home.

yo: Ìdí tí àwọn olùkọ́ kò ṣe tíì fi òpin sí ìyanṣẹ́lódì ni ó yẹ kí a bèrè.
en: The reason why the teachers have not put an end to the assignment is what we should ask.

yo: Lẹ́yìn tí àwọn kan gba òmìnira, ni wọ́n tún jí àwọn kan gbé.
en: After some were freed, some were kidnapped.

yo: Níbo ni wọ́n ń bá ètò ẹ̀kọ́ ní orílẹ̀ èdè yìí lọ?
en: Where is the education system going in this country?

yo: Ṣọlá ma ń tètè san owó oṣù òṣìṣẹ́ tí wọ́n bá ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní ílé iṣẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀.
en: Always pay the wages of workers who work in your company.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ awakọ̀ èrò ṣíná ìbọn níbi ìpolongo ìbò tí ó wáyé.
en: Members of the mob opened fire during the election campaign.

yo: Inú ù mi á dùn tí ẹgbẹ́ òṣìṣẹ́ àti ìjọba àpapọ̀ fẹnukò lórí àbá òfin yìí.
en: I will be happy if the labor union and the federal government agree on this bill.

yo: Olúọmọ ló fara gba ọ̀bẹ fún ààrẹ níbi ìpolongo ìbò.
en: Olumoma accepted the knife for the president during the election campaign.

yo: Kí ni ìdí tí o ṣe rò pé mo máa yọ ara mi kúrò nínú ìfọ̀rọ̀wérọ̀ yìí?
en: Why do you think I will remove myself from this discussion?

yo: Àjọ ètò ìlera gbọ́dọ̀ máa polongo ọ̀nà àti gbé ní àláàfíà.
en: The health organization must promote the way and live in peace.

yo: Ẹ wo bí ìjíròrò tó dán mọ́rán ṣe ń lọ láàárin àwọn ọmọ orogún.
en: Look at how the lively discussion is going on between the children of the rivals.

yo: Àdùnní jẹ́bi àdínkù tó bá owó àjọ mi nítorí ọwọ́ ẹ̀ ló wà.
en: Adunni is responsible for the shortfall of my company's money because it is his hand.

yo: Ẹ ta kété sí ìròyìn tí kò ní àrídájú tó ń ba orúkọ àwọn ènìyàn jẹ́.
en: Be quick to the unsubstantiated news that spoils people's reputation.

yo: Fálànà ti kìlọ̀ fáwọn ọ̀dọ́ tí wọ́n máa ń ṣẹ̀rù ba àwọn ará àdúgbò.
en: Falana has warned the youth who are afraid of the local people.

yo: Kí gan-an ni ẹgbẹ́ àwọn ọmọ ìta ní ṣe pẹ̀lú òṣèlú orílẹ̀ èdè e wa?
en: What exactly does a group of outsiders have to do with the politics of our country?

yo: Àjọ tí ó ń mójú tó ìbò ti gbé ìgbésẹ̀ méje fún ètò ìdìbò ọdún yìí.
en: The organization that oversees the election has taken seven steps for this year's election process.

yo: Nínú ọdún kan, ó kéré jù ọkọ̀ agbépo kan máa gbiná ní Èkó.
en: In a year, at least one bus will catch fire in Lagos.

yo: Ọ̀gá ọlọ̀pàá ni àwọn òbí ì mi máa pè ti nǹkankan bá fẹ́ ṣẹlẹ́ si mi.
en: My parents will call the police chief if something happens to me.

yo: Mo máa ṣe àyẹ̀wò àwọn ibùdó ìtàn tí wọ́n lò nínú ìwé náà.
en: I will examine the historical sites used in the book.

yo: Ẹ bá mi fi owó yé ayẹyẹ náà sí kí ẹ fi bu ọlá fún bàbá mi.
en: Please pay for the ceremony with me so that you can honor my father.

yo: A kò lè sọ bóyá olósèlú ló ní ọkọ̀ ńlá tó kó ìrẹsì wá sí ìlú u wa.
en: We cannot say whether a politician has a big truck that brought rice to our town.

yo: Kòkòrò oyin ló lé àwọn ènìyàn kúrò ní ábúlé kan ní Ọ̀yọ́.
en: A bee bug drove people out of a village in Oyo.

yo: Mo fẹ́ mọ ìtàn nípa bí ètò ìdìbò ṣe bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
en: I want to know the history of how the electoral system started in this country.

yo: Wo àwọn ohun tó yẹ kí o mọ̀ nípa òǹkọ̀wé D. O. Fágúnwà.
en: See what you should know about the writer D. O. Fagunwa.

yo: Ta ni ò mọ̀ pé Ìkòròdú ni wọ́n bí mi sí tí mo sì dàgbà síbẹ̀.
en: Who does not know that I was born in Ikorod and I grew up there.

yo: Ọba á máa pàṣẹ fún ìlú tí wọ́n á sì máa mu àṣẹ rẹ̀ ṣẹ.
en: The king will give orders to the city and they will carry out his orders.

yo: Ó pé tí mo ti ń dá àjọ láti rí owó tí mo fi gba ilé tí mò ń gbé yìí.
en: He said that I have been creating a company to get the money I used to buy the house I live in.

yo: Ọba ló ba lórí ohun gbogbo ní àwùjọ tí ó bá tí ń jọba.
en: The king has control over everything in the society he rules.

yo: Ṣé ẹni tí ó bá láyà nìkan ni ó lè mọ òwe Yorùbá dáadáa?
en: Is it only the brave who can know Yoruba proverbs well?

yo: Ó yẹ kí wọ́n ya ọjọ́ kan sọ́tọ̀ láti máa ṣe ìrántí àwọn ológun to kú.
en: A day should be set aside to commemorate the dead soldiers.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn ọmọ náà kò tiẹ̀ fẹ́ yé wa mọ́ rárá ni.
en: The words of the children do not even want to understand us at all.

yo: Wọ́n ti ṣòfin láti dènà fífi owó ra ìbọn fún ìlò o tara ẹni.
en: Laws have been passed to prohibit the purchase of firearms for personal use.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn púpọ̀ ni wọ́n pàdánù ẹmí i wọ́n nínú ìkọlù náà.
en: Many people lost their lives in the attack.

yo: Kò sí ohun tó kàn mí pẹ̀lú ìdájọ́ tí wọ́n dá ní ilé ẹjọ́ lénìí.
en: I have nothing to do with the judgment made in the court today.

yo: Àwọn àgbàgbà rọ àwọn ìyàwó ilé láti rọra ṣe pẹ̀lú ọkọ wọn.
en: Elders urge housewives to be gentle with their husbands.

yo: Mo tún tẹ́wọ́ gba ọmọ tí obìnrin yìí bí fún ọkọ mi tọwọ́tẹsẹ̀.
en: I also accepted the child that this woman gave birth to my husband immediately.

yo: Ilé iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá sọ pé Lápàdé ṣì ni ọ̀gá ọlọ́pàá ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó.
en: The police office said that the meeting still has a police chief in Lagos state.

yo: Kàrímù tí ó jẹ́ ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ Lápàdé náà ti di ọ̀gá ọlọ́pàá ní ìlú Ìbàdàn.
en: Karim, who was his friend at the meeting, has become a police chief in the city of Ibadan.

yo: Inú ù mi á dùn tí mo bá lè ṣe fún àwọn òbí mi jẹ ní ìlọ́po.
en: I will be happy if I can give my parents twice as much.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn ló há síbi ìkọlú náà tí ó sì mú ẹ̀mí i wọn lọ.
en: Many people came to the scene of the attack and it took their lives.

yo: Ìròyìn ìdìbò ọdún yìí ti kàn kárí ayé pé ó máa lágbára.
en: News of this year's election has spread around the world that it will be strong.

yo: Kò dájú pé ìdìbò ọdún yìí yóò dára nítorí àwọn nǹkankan.
en: It is not certain that this year's election will be good because of some things.

yo: Ó yẹ kí ẹ mọ àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ tí ó yẹ tí oyún bá ti wọ ìgbéyàwó o yín.
en: You should know the appropriate steps if you are pregnant.

yo: Àwọn wo ni ọ̀rẹ́ Àdìó tó fẹ́ fún nípò nínú ẹgbẹ́ tó bá di adarí ẹgbẹ́?
en: Who are Adio's friends that he wants to give place in the group if he becomes the leader of the group?

yo: Ọdún márùn-ún ni mo fi fẹ́ ìyàwó mi ka tó ṣe ìgbéyàwó.
en: I married my wife for five years.

yo: Ọlọ́run máa fi ìran hàn mí tí ìyàwó mi bá ń yan àlè .
en: God will show me a vision if my wife chooses marriage.

yo: Àjọ́kẹ́ ni obìnrin àkọ́kọ́ tí yóò gbégbá orókè nínú ìdíje tí à ń sọ yìí.
en: Ajeke is the first woman who will win the competition we are talking about.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ ti kéde orúkọ olùdíje fún ipò ààrẹ àti amúgbálẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀.
en: The party has announced the name of the candidate for the position of president and his deputy.

yo: Ìlú Iléṣà ni àwọn bàbá tí máa ń fẹ́ràn-an àwọn ọmọbìnrin jùlọ.
en: Ilesha city is where fathers love their daughters the most.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ẹlẹ́ṣin tí wọ́n ń fi ẹṣin wọn ṣiṣẹ́ létí òkun ń pa owó púpọ̀.
en: Many horsemen who use their horses to work by the sea make a lot of money.

yo: Oṣù kan gbáko ni ó lò ní áhámọ́ àwọn ajínigbé.
en: He spent a month in the jail of the kidnappers.

yo: Ariwo ni wọ́n máa ń fi orin pa ní àdúgbò tí mò ń gbé.
en: They used to kill the noise with music in the area where I live.

yo: Àkàndé yọjú síbi ìpàdé náà ṣùgbọ́n ó kọ̀ láti kópa nínú nǹkankan.
en: Akande appeared at the meeting but refused to participate in anything.

yo: Yéwandé ní wàhálà ìpolongo ìbò ló ṣe ìdíwọ́ ọ wíwá síbi ìjíròrò àná.
en: Yéwande had trouble with the election campaign that prevented him from coming to yesterday's discussion.

yo: Ìpádé mìíràn yóò wáyé láàárín àwa àti ìjọba lọ́jọ́ ajé tí ó ń bọ̀.
en: Another meeting will be held between us and the government next business day.

yo: Adé ti sọ tẹ́lẹ̀ pé àìbìkítà àwọn ẹbí ìyá náà ló pa ìyá òun.
en: Adé had previously said that the neglect of the mother's family killed his mother.

yo: Túńdé pe gbogbo ẹgbẹ́ jọ láti sọ fún wọn pé kí wọ́n gbáradì.
en: Tunde called all the groups together to tell them to get ready.

yo: Ẹ̀mí èèyàn àti ilé ìjọba máa ń wà nínú ewu lásìkò ìbò.
en: People's lives and government buildings are always in danger during elections.

yo: Àwọn nǹkan díẹ̀ ló mú ìyàtọ̀ bá ìjọba ààrẹ Olúdé àti Adémi.
en: There are few things that make the difference between Olúdé and Ademi's government.

yo: Ìkìlọ̀ ti wáyé pé kí á máṣe tan àbẹ́là sórí ike tàbí pákó.
en: There has been a warning not to light candles on plastic or wood.

yo: Wọ́n máa hu irú ìwà bẹ́ẹ̀ sí mi láì ṣe pé mo ṣẹ̀ wọ́n tì.
en: They would do such things to me even if I didn't offend them.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀gá ọlọ́pàá ni yóò máa ṣàkósó àwọn tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ gbaṣẹ́.
en: The police chiefs will be in charge of the new recruits.

yo: Afẹ́nifẹ́re wa ti dá sí owó tí à ń dá fún ìdàgbàsókè iṣẹ́ náà.
en: Our benefactor has contributed to the money we are raising for the development of the project.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá òde òní kán fẹ́ràn láti máa ka ẹ̀ṣùn mọ́ aláìṣẹ̀ lẹ́sẹ̀.
en: Today's police prefer to keep the accused innocent.

yo: Mo fẹ́ràn láti máa lo àwọn àkànlò èdè tí mo bá fẹ́ sọ̀rọ̀ .
en: I like to use language tools when I want to talk.

yo: Àwọn ará ìlú ti lọ fi ìfẹ̀hónú u wọn hàn lọ́dọ̀ àwọn olóyè ìlú.
en: The people of the city have gone to show their love to the city officials.

yo: Ẹ̀sùn àjẹbánu àti lílo owó báṣubàṣu la fi kàn olóyè náà.
en: Allegations of corruption and embezzlement were brought against the officer.

yo: Owó oṣù tí àwọn òsìsẹ́ ń gbà kéré jù owó tí wọ́n ń ná sórí óúnjẹ lọ.
en: The monthly salary that the workers receive is less than the money they spend on food.

yo: Ohun dá wàhálà sílẹ̀ ní Èkó torí ìbò ni àwọn ìjọba ti mọ̀ sí.
en: There is trouble in Lagos because the government has known about it.

yo: Baálẹ̀ kọ́ lọ́ ṣe ètò ìrànwọ́ ìwé kíkà fún àwọn ọmọ ìlú.
en: The governor did not plan to help the citizens with reading books.

yo: Ò ti pẹ́ jù fún Délé láti yọwọ́ nítorí orúkọ ẹgbẹ́ yóò hàn lórí ìwé.
en: It was too late for Dele to stop because the club's name would appear on paper.

yo: Èmi ni wọ́n gbé iṣẹ́ oúnjẹ tí wọ́n máa jẹ níbi ayẹyẹ náà fun,.
en: I was the one who was responsible for the food that they would eat at the party.

yo: Àwọn nǹkan tó gbajúmọ̀ nípa ìlú Ìbàdàn ni a máa mẹ́nu bà.
en: We will mention the famous things about the city of Ibadan.

yo: Tí mo ba jẹ́ obìnrin, màá ti tara ọkùnrin rówó kọ ilé àti ra ilẹ̀.
en: If I were a woman, I would have asked a rich man to build a house and buy land.

yo: Ìdí tí ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wa fi padà lẹ́yìn ẹ̀ ni pé o tako òfin ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wa.
en: The reason why our group is back behind you is that you are against the rules of our group.

yo: Ọjọ́ ìgbéyàwó o Títí jẹ́ pàtàkì nítorí òun ni ọmọ kan ṣoṣo tí òbí ẹ̀ bí.
en: Titi's wedding day is important because she is the only child born to her parents.

yo: Ǹjẹ́ ẹni tí yóò borí ní ìdìbò ọdún ṣe pàtàkì bí?
en: Does it matter who wins this year's election?

yo: Ilé ńlá àràmọ̀ndà ni wọ́n wó tí wọ́n sọọ́ di ọgbà ẹ̀wọ́n.
en: Aramanda's big house was demolished and turned into a prison.

yo: Àwọn agbẹjọ́rò tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ wọ iṣẹ́ ni adájọ́ àgbà ṣe ìbúra fún.
en: The lawyers who committed the crime were sworn in by the chief judge.

yo: Ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti rọ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ láti lọ́ wá iṣẹ́ kọ́ tí wọn ò bá rí iṣẹ́ ṣe.
en: The federal government has urged the youth to look for work if they do not find work.

yo: Báyìí ni àwọn olùdíje ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ṣe fẹ́ kojú ìṣòro ìlera ara.
en: This is how the contestants in Eko state want to face the health problem.

yo: Mo máa to gbogbo ìwé ẹ̀rí náà sínú àpótí kan láti tọ́jú ẹ̀.
en: I will put all the certificates in a box to keep it.

yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ adájọ́ orílè èdè yìí fẹ́ ṣèpàdé lórí ìdàgbàsókè ètò ìlera.
en: The judicial committee of the head of this language wants to meet on the development of the health system.

yo: Wọ́n ti sọ tẹ́lẹ̀ pé kò sí ìyì fún baálẹ̀ tí kò ní aya lọ́ọ̀dẹ̀.
en: It has been said before that there is no respect for a chief who does not have a wife.

yo: Ọlọ́pàá ò lè ti ilé adajọ́ àgbà kí wọ́n tún lé àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀ jáde.
en: The police can't close the courthouse and expel its employees.

yo: Nínú oṣù yìí náà ni wọ́n gba iṣẹ́ tí ó ń pèsè ìjẹ fún wọn láìrò tẹ́lẹ̀.
en: In this month they took a job that provided food for them without thinking beforehand.

yo: Tí a bá ń sọ̀rọ̀ ní pa ilé aṣòfin àpapọ̀, ó kápá a gbogbo èèyàn nílùú.
en: If we are talking in front of the federal parliament, it affects everyone in the city.

yo: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin bọwọ́ lu ìwé tí ó ṣàfikún owó oṣù fáwọn òṣìsẹ́.
en: The parliament approved the document that increased the salary for the workers.

yo: Àjọ tí ó ń mójú tó ẹ̀tọ́ àwọn ọmọdé fún ìyá ọmọ náà ọ̀sẹ̀ kan.
en: The children's rights organization gave the child's mother a week.

yo: Àwọn ọkùnrin tí wọ́n ní ìlákàyè kìí hu irú ìwà bẹ́ẹ̀ sí ìyàwó o wọn.
en: Men who have sense do not do such behavior to their wives.

yo: Bùnmi tún parọ́ pé òun kọ́ lòun wa ọkọ̀ sáré àsájù.
en: Bummi also lied that he did not drive too fast.

yo: Òtútù ọ̀tẹ̀ yìí máa pọ̀ ju gbogbo èyí tí o lè ti rí rí.
en: This storm will be colder than anything you've ever seen.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ baálẹ̀ mìíràn ṣẹ̀ dé padà láti àjò tí wọ́n lọ pẹ̀lú èsì ayọ̀.
en: Other princes came back from the trip they went with happy results.

yo: Èwo nínú ìlérí tí ọkọ ẹ̀ ṣe fun ní ọjọ́ ìgbéyàwó o wọn ló ti mú ṣẹ?
en: Which of the promises made by your husband on the wedding day have you fulfilled?

yo: Màá foríji àwọn tó bá dá owó ìlú tí wọn kò fẹ́ kí ó bàjẹ́.
en: I will forgive those who create public money that they do not want to be corrupted.

yo: Mo yó gidi pẹ̀lú óúnjẹ ọdún tí àwọn ará ilé mi gbé wá fún mi láti jẹ.
en: I was really full with the food that my family members brought for me to eat.

yo: Àtúpalẹ̀ ìlànà a bí wọ́n ṣe kojú ìwà ìbàjẹ́ nínú ìwé ìtàn àròsọ náà.
en: Analysis of how they deal with corruption in the novel.

yo: Ààrẹ nìkan ló láṣẹ láti yọ adájọ́ àgbà kúrò nípò.
en: Only the president has the authority to dismiss the chief justice.

yo: Ìpàdé ìtagbangba tó wáyé ní láàárín àwọn lọ́balọ́ba ṣe kàn ẹ́.
en: The public meeting that took place among the leaders affected him.

yo: Ṣọlá ní ìwà kan náà ni Táíwò àti Kẹ́hìndé jọ ń wù.
en: Táíwó and Kehinde both like the same thing.

yo: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ẹ mánigbàgbé kan tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí àwọn ọmọ náà máa di ìtàn.
en: An unforgettable incident that happened to the children will become history.

yo: Àwọn olùdíje fún ìpò olóyè ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ gbà láti san owó.
en: Candidates for the position of chief in Oyo State agree to pay money.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọ̀pọ̀ ọkọ̀ ayókẹ́lẹ́ ló ti rì sàbẹ̀ ẹ yìnyín ní àárọ̀ yìí.
en: A lot of cars have sunk under the snow this morning.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn á máa fi mí ṣe yẹ̀yẹ́ tí mo bá fi lè kọjá láàárin wọn.
en: People will make fun of me if I can pass between them.

yo: Kí Ọlọ́run máa ṣọ́ àwa àti ẹbí i wa lápapọ̀ nítorí nǹkan ò rọrùn.
en: May God watch over us and our family as a whole because things are not easy.

yo: Mo tiẹ̀ gbúròó ìràwọ̀ oníròyìn tó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń dé.
en: I even wished for a rising star journalist.

yo: Àwòrán tó ṣàfihàn-an àwọn ilé tí ó jóná lọ́jọ́ náà máa jáde lọ́la.
en: A picture showing the houses that burned that day will be released tomorrow.

yo: Màá sọ ìtàn-an Fágúnwà fún un yín àti àwọn nǹkan tí ẹ ò mọ̀ nípa ẹ̀.
en: I will tell you the story of Fagunwa and the things you don't know about him.

yo: Olùdíje tó bá ṣetán láti ṣe titi wa nínú ẹgbẹ́ yìí ni a máa dìbò fún.
en: The candidate who is ready to join us in this group will be voted for.

yo: Ìjì tó jà lánàá tó mi gbogbo igi oko ò wá ní lè yòrùlé àwọn èèyàn.
en: The storm that raged yesterday that shook all the trees in the farm did not bring down people.

yo: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ti rọ àwọn ènìyàn láti má ṣe ìdájọ́ lọ́wọ́ ara wọn.
en: The Lagos state government has urged people not to judge themselves.

yo: Mo ti pinnu láti gbé ara ile mi lọ sí ilé ẹjọ́ nítorí àìrí owó ilé san.
en: I have decided to take my family to court for non-payment of rent.

yo: Ìjíròrò wà fún àwọn ará Èkó pẹ̀lú ànfààni láti bèèrè ohunkóhun.
en: There is discussion for the people of Eko with the opportunity to ask anything.

yo: Ipa tí àwọn bàbá ìsàlẹ̀ ń kó nínú ìdàgbàsókè ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ ò kéré.
en: The role of the lower fathers in the development of Oyo state is not small.

yo: Àdúgbò Ìyànàpájà ni ìjàmbá tó mú ẹ̀mí àwọn ènìyàn lọ ti wáyé.
en: The accident that took people's lives took place in Iyanapaja community.

yo: Ilé ẹjọ́ gbọ́dọ̀ dájọ́ ikú fún àwọn tó pa Tìmílẹ́hìn nítorí wọ́n jẹ̀bi.
en: The court must sentence those who killed Timilihein to death because they are guilty.

yo: Àjọṣepọ̀ tó wà láàárín èmi àti àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ mi kò ní jẹ́ ki ń tú àṣírí i wọn.
en: The relationship between me and my friends will not allow me to reveal their secrets.

yo: Ó yẹ kí wọ́n máa kọ́ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ní èdè Yorùbá ní àwọn ilé ìwé.
en: Students should be taught in Yoruba language in schools.

yo: Àwọn nǹkan tó ṣe kókó nípa àwọn olùdíje fún adárí ẹgbẹ́ ló sọ.
en: He said important things about the candidates for party leadership.

yo: Kí lo mọ̀ nípa Káyọ̀dé tí o fẹ́ fi sí ipò oyè kan láàárin ẹgbẹ́?
en: What do you know about Kayode that you want to put in a leadership position in the group?

yo: Àwọn nǹkan wo lo rò pé ó yẹ kí o mọ̀ nípa àṣà àti ìṣe Yorùbá?
en: What things do you think you should know about Yoruba customs and practices?

yo: Mo gbọdọ̀ ṣe ohun tí ó máa jọ àwọn òbí mi lójú gidi ni.
en: I must do what my parents really like.

yo: Mo mọ̀ pé àwọn ìjọ̀ òde òní máa ń sọ pé omi lè ṣe iṣẹ́ ara.
en: I know that the churches of today say that water can do the work of the body.

yo: Lóòótọ́ ni wọ́n máa ń dábẹ́ fún obìnrin àti ọkùnrin láyé àtijọ́.
en: It is true that they used to say goodbye to women and men in the past.

yo: Onímọ̀ ìlera ṣàlàyé ìgbésẹ̀ tí àwọn èèyàn lè gbé láti kojú àìsàn.
en: A health expert explains the steps people can take to deal with illness.

yo: Mi ò rò pé ó ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti máa bá àwọn ọmọ mi wí rárá.
en: I don't think he has the right to discipline my children at all.

yo: Ààrẹ ti kìlọ̀ fún àwọn ọmọ ìta pé kí wọ́n yéé na àwọn ará ìlú.
en: The president has warned outsiders to understand the people of the city.

yo: Kìí ṣe gbogbo èèyàn tí wọ́n jẹ́ ọmọ Ògùn ló wà nínú iṣẹ́ ìjọba.
en: Not all people who are children of Ogun are in government service.

yo: Kò bá dáa tí àwọn ẹbí ọkọ mi bá lè gbà láti sùn ọjọ́ náà síwájú.
en: It wouldn't be good if my husband's family could agree to postpone the day.

yo: Àwọn olùdíje gbọ́dọ̀ fọ̀rọ̀jomitoro ọ̀rọ̀ ọ wọn láti yé ara wọn.
en: Candidates must discuss their words to understand each other.

yo: A dúpẹ́ pé àwọn elétò ìlera ti gbà láti dá ìyanṣẹ́lódì náà dúró.
en: Thankfully, health systems have agreed to stop the mission.

yo: Àjọ tí ó ń mójú tó ètò ìdìbò ti gbà láti ṣè ètò ìlanilọ́yẹ̀.
en: The organization that oversees the election process has agreed to make a plan.

yo: Ìjọba máa ṣe àbẹ̀wò fún àwọn nǹkan tó tako ìlera láwùjọ.
en: The government will inspect for things that are against the health of the society.

yo: Àjọ tó ń mójú tó ètò ìdìbò ń retí ìdáhùn àwọn ènìyàn ìbéèrè yẹn.
en: The organization that oversees the election process expects the people to answer that question.

yo: Olóògbé Táíwò Adégbóyèga jẹ́ ènìyàn pàtàkì ní orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
en: The late Taiwo Adégboyega was an important person in this country.

yo: Ó dá mi lójú àwọn kan yóò bẹnu àtẹ́ lu ìdàdúró adájọ́ àgbà náà.
en: I am sure some people will criticize the suspension of the chief judge.

yo: Tàfá ni ó máa jẹ́ olórí àwọn jàǹdùkú nílùú Abẹ́òkúta tí ó bá yá.
en: Taffa will be the leader of the gangs in Abeokuta if he succeeds.

yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ ìṣèdájọ́ tó ga jùlọ ti kọ̀wé ìfisùn tuntun ránṣẹ́ sí Baálẹ̀ ìlú.
en: The highest judicial committee has written a new charge and sent it to the mayor.

yo: Olúmidé ti rọ àwọn ènìyàn pé kí wọn má fojú òṣèlú wo àbẹ̀wò òun.
en: Olumidé has urged people not to focus on politics in his visit.

yo: Akọ̀wé ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti sọ tẹ́lẹ̀ rí pé òun kò jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kàn-án.
en: The secretary of the federal government has previously said that he is not guilty of the charges against him.

yo: Bí Tàfá bá jẹ olórí àwọn jàndùkú, kò sí ẹni tí ó le è kojú ẹ̀.
en: If Tàfa is the leader of the Janduku, no one can face him.

yo: Bí Ẹfúnṣetán ṣe di ilú Ìbàdàn mú nígbà ayé e rẹ̀, kò gbọdọ̀ ṣẹlẹ̀ mọ́.
en: The way Effunsetán captured the city of Ibadan during his lifetime, it must not happen again.

yo: Wọ́n ṣètò ìlanilọ́yẹ̀ lórí ohun tí wọ́n lè ṣe láti dènà àìsàn náà.
en: They plan on what they can do to prevent the disease.

yo: Ó yẹ kí àwọn ìyàwó ilé máa gbàdúrà pé ohun rere fún ọkọ wọn.
en: Housewives should pray for good things for their husbands.

yo: Àwọn ará ìlú wípé olórí ọ̀dọ́ ìlú leku ẹdá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìkọlù Baálẹ̀ ọkọ ìlú.
en: The people of the city said that the head of the city was responsible for the attack on the mayor's vehicle.

yo: Ó yẹ kí á bèèrè lọ́wọ́ ara wa pé ṣé òṣì n pọ̀ si láàárín àwùjọ wa?
en: We should ask ourselves whether poverty is increasing in our society?

yo: Àwọn olórin maa ń fẹ́ kí àwọn ènìyàn máa pè wọ́n lójoojúmọ́.
en: Musicians want people to call them every day.

yo: Ìjọba sọ pé irọ́ ní ìròyìn pé àwọn yóò ti ilé ìwòsàn pa lọ́jọ́ ìdìbò.
en: The government says that the news that they will close the hospital on election day is false.

yo: Mò ń rọ àwọn akẹgbẹ́ mi nínú àwùjọ láti máṣe kánjú.
en: I urge my colleagues in the group not to rush.

yo: Ìjàmbá iná tó máa wáyé nígbà ọyẹ́ ń kọ àwọn ènìyàn lóminú.
en: A fire accident that happens during the day makes people angry.

yo: Kìí ṣe pé ẹ̀yà a Yorùbá ò ní ọbabìnrin rí ṣùgbọ́n kò le ṣẹlẹ̀ mọ́.
en: It is not that the Yoruba race never had a queen but it cannot happen again.

yo: Kò sẹ́ni tí ó lè sọ bí ipa àwọn olórí ẹ̀sìn ṣe lágbára tó nígbà ìdìbò.
en: No one can say how strong the influence of religious leaders is during elections.

yo: Àtọmọdé àtàgbà ni wọ́n ti pèsè ààyè fún ní ilé ìwòsàn tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ kọ́.
en: They have provided space for children and adults in the hospital they built.

yo: Aṣaájú tó kọ́kọ́ gbógun tí àwọn alájẹbánu gbìyànjú gan ni.
en: He was the first leader who tried to fight the criminals.

yo: Àwọn ìdílé yìí ló lè fi agídí bá ilé iṣẹ́ ológun sọ̀rọ̀ lásìkò ètò ìdìbò.
en: It is these families who can stubbornly talk to the military during the election process.

yo: Àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ẹ málegbàgbé wáyé ní àsìkò ìpolongo ìbò lọ́dún tó lọ.
en: Unforgettable events took place during the election campaign last year.

yo: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ iléèwòsàn ìjọba wọ́de nítorípé wọn ò san owó oṣù u wọn.
en: Government hospital workers came because they did not pay their salaries.

yo: Ìjọba ti ilé ìwòsàn kan pa ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì lórí ọ̀rọ̀ ọmọ tí ó kú.
en: The government killed a hospital in Ekiti state over the death of a child.

yo: Báwo ni ká ti gbọ́ pé odidi ìyàwó ilé ní ojúkòkòrò ọkùnrin?
en: How have we heard that all housewives are greedy for men?

yo: Àwọn ará ìlú tí ń palẹ̀mọ́ ti ààrẹ tí ó ń ti àjò padà bọ̀.
en: The people of the city who are supporting the president who is returning from the trip.

yo: Wọ́n ti pèsè ohun gbogbo tí a máa nílò fún ìbò sílẹ̀.
en: They have prepared everything we will need for voting.

yo: Kí gan an ní àwọn nǹkan tí Káyọ̀dé bèèrè fún lọ́wọ́ ẹ?
en: What do you really have that Kayode asked you for?

yo: Kíni àwọn ohùn tó ṣé kókó tó yẹ ká mọ̀ nípa oyún ọmọ yìí?
en: What are the important voices that we should know about this pregnancy?

yo: Àsìkò ìdìbò kò dí àwọn èèyàn lọ́wọ́ láti lọ sí ibi iṣẹ́.
en: Election season does not stop people from going to work.

yo: Adájọ́ àgbà ti padà sọ pé òun kò jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn tí ìjọba fi kan òun.
en: The chief judge has returned and said that he is not guilty of the charges brought against him by the government.

yo: Àwọn ohun kán wà tó yẹ kí àwọn ọmọdé mọ̀ nípa ètò ìdìbò nìyí.
en: There are some things that children should know about this election process.

yo: Gbogbo àwọn tó wà nídìí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìpànìyàn yóò gé ìka jẹ nígbẹ̀yìn.
en: All those involved in the killing will end up biting their fingers.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ olúwo ṣe èèmọ̀ bí wọ́n ṣe gbọ́ pé olúwo papò dà.
en: The children of the viewer were shocked when they heard that the viewer returned.

yo: Kò sí àríyá tí wọ́n lè pè mí sí tí mo máa bá wọn ra aṣọ.
en: There is no party where they can invite me to buy clothes with them.

yo: Ìjàmbá iná tí ó máa ń ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà ọyẹ́ ò kí ń lóòǹkà .
en: The fire accident that happens during the night is not enough.

yo: Ògùn owó jẹ́ ọ̀nà kan pàtó tí àwọn ọ̀dọ́ òde òní fí ń wa owó kíákíá.
en: Money addiction is a specific way that today's youth are looking for quick money.

yo: Láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ìsìn náà ni mo tí ń ṣàkíyèsí pé nǹkankan ṣe olùdarí ìsìn.
en: From the beginning of the religion, I have noticed that something is the leader of the religion.

yo: Ilé iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ láwọn kò lè ṣọ iye ènìyàn tó kú ní Ìṣẹ́yìn.
en: The Oyo state police office cannot keep track of the number of people who died in Iskehin.

yo: Ó yẹ kí wọ́n fi tó ìjọba létí pé àwọn ọ̀nà àdúgbò yìí kò dára rárá.
en: They should remind the government that the roads in this area are not good at all.

yo: Mo gbọ́ nínú ìròyìn pé ọ̀wọ́n oúnjẹ máa wà láti ọ̀sẹ̀ tí ó ń bọ̀ lọ.
en: I heard in the news that there will be food shortages from next week.

yo: Ọ̀gá ọlọ́pàá pàṣẹ pé kí wọ́n ṣé ìwádìí lórí ọlọ́pàá inú àwòrán.
en: The police chief ordered an investigation into the policeman in the picture.

yo: Olóòtú sọ fún àwọn òǹwòran pé àwọn ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń mú ẹyẹ bọ̀ lápò ni.
en: The editor told the viewers that they were just bringing the bird back.

yo: Iléeṣé ológun ti ṣèlérí láti máa ṣọ́ ẹ̀mí àwọn ará ìlú.
en: The military has promised to guard the lives of the citizens.

yo: Wọ́n ti kéde pé àwọn ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú lé tẹ̀síwájú pẹ̀lú ìpolongo wọn.
en: They have announced that the political parties will continue with their campaign.

yo: Iléeṣẹ́ aṣọ́bodè ní àṣìta ìbọn ló fa sábàbí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìpanìyàn.
en: The gatekeeper's mistake is the most common cause of murder.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ ẹnu ẹ̀ máá ń dàbí i ìgbà tí wọ́n bá sọ̀kò sí àárin ọjà láti tu ká.
en: The words of your mouth will be like when they are thrown into the middle of the market to disperse.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ òjò ló ti rọ̀ tí ilẹ̀ ti fimu láàárin ọdún kan yìí.
en: It has rained so much that the land has been frozen in the middle of this year.

yo: Àyìndé ní àṣẹ ààrẹ lóríi pípa ẹni tó bá jí ìbò gbé tako òfin.
en: Ainde has a presidential order to kill anyone who steals votes against the law.

yo: Ìdìbò ọdún tó ń bọ̀ ní ìdánilójú pé yóò rọrùn fún àwọn ará Ọ̀yọ́.
en: Next year's election is guaranteed to be easy for the people of Oyo.

yo: Ìjọba faraya lórí i bí àwọn olùkọ́ iléèwe ṣe lé àwọn ọmọ padà sílé.
en: The government is worried about how the school teachers sent the children back home.

yo: Onímọ̀ ní kò sí òògùn tó lè pa àrùn lùkúlùkú ní ilẹ̀ yìí.
en: Experts say there is no medicine that can kill any disease in this land.

yo: Ohun tó jẹyọ nínú ọ̀rọ̀ olùdíje fún ipò ààrẹ níbi ìpàdé e wa ni ìwọ̀nyí.
en: These are the things that emerged from the speech of the presidential candidate at the meeting.

yo: Ìtàn-an málegbàgbé ni ìtàn-an Mọrèmi tó fi ọmọ rẹ̀ kan ṣoṣo rúbọ fún ìlú.
en: An unforgettable story is the story of Moremi who sacrificed her only son for the city.

yo: Akínlàdé Àbáyọ̀mí rọ́pò ọmọ Balógun gẹ́gẹ́ bíi alága àwọn ọlọ́kọ̀.
en: Akinladé Abayomimi replaced Balogun's son as the chairman of the farmers.

yo: Ṣé ọwọ́ ti ká àwọn adàlúrú tó ń kólé, kóko, tó sì ń pàyàn ní ìlú u wa?
en: Are the evildoers who are building, building, and killing in our city?

yo: Olùdíje fún ipò ààrẹ, Bọ́lá Tínubú ní òun yóò sàjọyọ̀ ìsẹ́gun.
en: The candidate for the position of president, Bola Tinubu said he will be celebrating his victory.

yo: Àwùjọ Yorùbá ní gbogbo ohun tí àwọn àwùjọ tó kójú òṣùwọ̀n ní.
en: The Yoruba community has all the things that normal communities have.

yo: Àwọn agbébọn pa eèyàn púpọ̀ ní ìlú Ọ̀ṣun, bẹ́ẹ̀ ní Ọ̀yọ́ náà.
en: Gunmen killed many people in the city of Osun, as well as in Oyo.

yo: Ọbáfẹ́mi ní káwọn olùdìbò lo ìwé ìdìbò o wọn fi yan ààrẹ tó tọ́.
en: Obafemi asked the voters to use the ballot paper to elect the right president.

yo: Ìṣẹ́ àti ìyà tí àjàkálẹ̀ àrùn-un kògbóògùn kó bá wa ò da rárá.
en: The work and suffering caused by the epidemic of the disease and the drug did not stop us at all.

yo: Àyájọ́ èdè abínibí jẹ́ ohun tó yẹ ní pàtàkì ní àwùjọ káwùjọ.
en: Learning one's mother tongue is especially important in society.

yo: Olúṣẹ́gun Ọbásanjọ́ ní kí áwọn èèyàn gbìnyànjù láti dìbò.
en: Olusugun Obasanjo asked the people to make an effort to vote.

yo: Ìbálòpọ̀ láàárín àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ní àsìkò yí jẹ́ ohun tí ó ń peléke síi.
en: Sexuality among young people at this time is something that is increasing.

yo: Àwùjọ Yorùbá jẹ́ orísun àwọn ọlọ́pọlọ pípé nínú u gbogbo iṣẹ́.
en: The Yoruba community is a source of perfect minds in every job.

yo: Oǹdò, Ọ̀yọ́ àti Ọ̀ṣun wà lára àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ tó peregedé lọ́dún yìí.
en: Ondo, Oyo and Osun are among the states that are perfect this year.

yo: Àjọ tó ń mójútó ìdìbò ní kò sáyè fún màjèṣín láti dìbò rárá.
en: The organization that oversees the election does not allow residents to vote at all.

yo: Báwo ni ìdìbò ọdún tó ń bọ̀ yí ó ṣe lọ gan an?
en: How did next year's election go?

yo: Ètò ọrọ̀ ajé jẹ́ ohun tó yẹ kó múmú lọ́kàn-an gbogbo àwa èèyàn.
en: Economic planning is something that should be kept in mind by all of us.

yo: Ọwọ́ ọlọ́pàá kò tíì tẹ àwọn jàńdùkú tó ṣiṣẹ́ ìjínigbé náà.
en: The police have not arrested the criminals who carried out the kidnapping.

yo: Àjọ̀ tó ń mójútó ètò ìdìbò gbé òṣùbà a káre fún ìlú lórí ìpalẹ̀mọ́ ọ wọn.
en: The organization that oversees the election system raised the moon for the city on their implementation.

yo: Àwọn ará ìlú ń gbàdúrà pé ẹni tí yóò láànú u wọn ni kó bọ́ sípò.
en: The people of the city are praying that the person who will have mercy on them will recover.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ onígbàálẹ̀ fá gbogbo ìbò tó pọ̀ jù ní ilé aṣòfin àgbà ní Ekiti.
en: The conservative party won the majority of votes in the Ekiti state house of parliament.

yo: Adérẹ̀mí Ọbásanmí padà sílé aṣòfin àgbà fún sàá mìíràn.
en: Adéremi Obasanmi returned to the parliament for another day.

yo: Ọjà a Balógun tó wà ní Ilú Èkó ti wá di ilé fún àwọn jàǹdùkú!
en: Balogun Market in Lagos has become a home for mobsters!

yo: Àwọn ohùn tó yẹ kí ẹ mọ nípa Olórí ẹgbẹ́ nìwọ̀nyí.
en: These are the voices you should know about the Leader of the group.

yo: Ìròyìn nípa ìbálòpọ̀ láàárín èèyàn àti àwọn ẹranko jẹ́ ohun ìbànújẹ.
en: The news about sex between humans and animals is sad.

yo: Olórí àwọn ọ̀dọ̀ ní òun kò le kín àwọn ọ̀bàyéjẹ́ lẹ́yìn láyé!
en: The leader of the youth said that he could not fill the world's wisdom!

yo: Arábámbi lóun yóò gbà èsì ìbò tí kò bá sì ìdàrúdàpọ̀ kankan.
en: The Arab will receive the results of the vote if there is no confusion.

yo: Àwọn ará ìlú ń dunnú pé gbogbo ìgbìnyànjú u wọn ò pòfo.
en: The people of the city are happy that all their efforts are not in vain.

yo: Ìbànújẹ́ gba ìlú kan nígbà tí àṣìta ìbọn ba ọmọ ọdún méjì kan.
en: Tragedy gripped a town when a two-year-old boy was accidentally shot.

yo: Ọmọ tí orúkọ rẹ̀ ń jẹ́ Bámidélé ni àṣìta ìbọn ọdẹ àdùgbò kan bà.
en: A child whose name is Bamidélé was mistakenly shot by a local hunter.

yo: Ọdẹ náà kò le sọ pàtó ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n ó du ẹ̀mi ọmọ náà.
en: The hunter could not say exactly what happened, but he took the child's life.

yo: Oyin ti jẹ́ ohùn kan tí ó ń tà ní ọjà àgbáyé ní báyìí nítorí ìwúlò o rẹ̀.
en: Honey has become a voice that sells in the world market now because of its usefulness.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ṣe ìkéde pé àwọn yóò mú àwọn adigunjalẹ̀ ọjọ́si.
en: The police announced that they will arrest the old robbers.

yo: Àwọn olóṣèlú ti ń gbówó fáwọn bọ̀rọ̀kìní ìlú láti bá wọn dá sí ìdìbò.
en: Politicians have been paying money to city councilors to help them in the election.

yo: Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́gboyè ọjọ́sí, Adébísí Adéoyè tí wọlé sí iléèwé gígá ní Èkó.
en: A mature student, Adébisi Adéoye who entered the higher school in Lagos.

yo: Ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ ní Ìgbòho yóò kọ́ àwọn agbègbè e Yorùbá yókù lọ́gbọ́n.
en: What happened in Igbho will teach the rest of the Yoruba areas wisely.

yo: Oríire náà kìí ṣe ti òun nìkan, ti gbogbo orílè èdè yìí ni.
en: The luck is not only for him, it belongs to all the heads of this language.

yo: Ìyá àgbà ti ilé Balógun ní adùn ló ń gbẹ̀nyì ewúro.
en: The old lady of Balogun's house is the one who digs the goat.

yo: Ṣẹ ìbànújẹ́ ayérayé kọ́ ni kí èèyàn fẹ́ ọ̀tá èèyàn.
en: Isn't it an eternal sorrow to marry an enemy?

yo: Àwọn onílù Aláàfin ní olórí tó yẹ ní Aláàfin tó ṣẹ̀ wàjà.
en: The drummers of Aláafin have the right leader in the upcoming Aláafin.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá tètè dé ìpàdé àwọn jàǹdùkú dúró ní Ògùn.
en: The police soon arrived at the mob's meeting in Ogun.

yo: Inú oko agijù kan ní ìlú Òǹdó ni wọ́n ti ṣàwárí i wúrà olówó iyebíye.
en: Expensive gold has been discovered in a forest farm in Ondo.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ lóbìnrin ní irọ́ ni pé aṣọ ló ń fa ìbálòpọ̀ ọ típa.
en: Young women have a lie that clothing is what makes you sexually active.

yo: Adigunjalẹ̀ lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin ni wọ́n mu ní ìdíkọ̀ ní Ajẹ́gúnlẹ̀.
en: Both men and women were arrested in Ajegunle.

yo: Ìgbìnyànjù ìyá lórí ọmọ pọ̀ gan, pàápàá jù lọ àwọn ọmọbìnrin.
en: Mother's pressure on her child is very high, especially girls.

yo: Ìjọ̀ba kéde Ẹtì gẹ́gẹ bi ọjọ́ ìsìnmi tuntun.
en: The government announced Eti as a new religious day.

yo: Mákindé, Lánlẹ́hin àti Abísádé ni àwọn ọmọ tí ìyá olóbì bí.
en: Mákindé, Lánlehhin and Abísádé are the children born by the mother.

yo: Àdìgún tíí ṣe olórí àwọn ọlọ́kọ̀ ní Ìsẹ́yìn ní òun ò ṣetán àti fi ipò sílẹ̀.
en: Adigung, who was the head of teachers in Isei, was not ready and resigned.

yo: Àwọn ara ìlú ń sọ̀rọ̀ nípa owó tí ìjọba ní kí àwọn ilé isẹ́ aládàáni san.
en: Citizens are talking about the money that the government asked the private companies to pay.

yo: Àwọn olóṣèlú tó yege àti àwọn to fìdírẹmi ti kọ̀yìn sí ara wọ́n.
en: Politicians who are right and those who want to die have turned against each other.

yo: Olórí àwọn ẹlẹ́ran tó ṣẹ̀ jẹ ní ìlú Ìbàdàn ní ètò tó dára gidi.
en: The head of the butchers in the city of Ibadan has a very good plan.

yo: Ìyá kan tí wọ́n ń pè ní Àyìnkẹ́ ní ìlú u Àgbéyè ní ẹni tó dàgbà jù lọ.
en: A mother called Ayinkeh in the town of Agbye was the oldest.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ ẹpọ rọ̀bì ní ilẹ̀ yìí ti wá di ohun àgbọ́ronú.
en: The issue of rubber in this country has become a common thing.

yo: Èrò burúkú tó pọ̀ ní àwùjọ wa jẹ́ ohun tí ò lè fa ìlọsíwájú.
en: Too much bad thinking in our society is what cannot cause progress.

yo: Nítorí owó ni àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ ogún ọdún ṣe lè jà tó bẹ́yẹn.
en: It is because of money that twenty year old friends can fight so much.

yo: Àdúrà àwọn èèyàn ni kí ìbànújẹ́ má fi ìgbà kankan wọnú ilé e wọn.
en: The prayer of the people is that sadness will never enter their homes.

yo: Àwọn àgbààgbà ilú Ìgbòho ní ìyà tí ìjọba ń fi ń jẹ wọ́n tó gẹ́.
en: The elders of Igbho are suffering enough from the government.

yo: Àwọn ẹlẹ́sìn àbáláyé tí ò tíì kùnà ṣì wà láyé.
en: There are still people in the world who have not failed.

yo: Ohun tí àwọn èèyàn maa ń rọ̀ ni pé èké ni gbogbo àwọn tó ń ṣẹ̀sìn.
en: What people say is that all those who worship are liars.

yo: Àìgbọràn ló mú ki àwọn ọmọ ilé ìwé ijọ́sí fi ikú ṣe ìfà jẹ.
en: It was disobedience that caused the students of the religious school to commit death.

yo: Mó mu àwọn àlàyé àti ìmọ̀ràn yìí ni pàtàkì nínú ìgbésí ayé mi.
en: I take these explanations and advice very seriously in my life.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ọmọdé ni ò lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ilé rárá nítorí àìsínílé àwọn òbí i wọn.
en: Many children are not home schooled at all because their parents are not home.

yo: Àìbìkítà àwọn ará àdúgbò náà ń kóbá àwọn ọmọdé wọ̀nyí.
en: The indifference of the local people is affecting these children.

yo: Ìbáṣepọ̀ láàárín àwọn òbi àti ọmọ yẹ kó dán mọ́rán.
en: The relationship between parents and children should be smooth.

yo: Àpòjù iyọ̀ nínú óúnjẹ máa ń fa àìsàn nínú àgọ̀ ara.
en: Excess salt in food causes illness in the body.

yo: Abọ́sẹ̀dé Àyìnlá tíí ṣe olùkéde fún àjọ tí ó ń rí sí ìlera ló sọ èyí
en: Abodede Ahinla who is a publicist for a health organization said this

yo: Fífi ohun tí èèyàn bá gbọ́ nípa ẹlòmíràn wùwà jẹ́ ìbẹ̀rè orí burúkú.
en: Taking into account what one hears about another person is a bad idea.

yo: Àjàsá ní òun kò ní dẹ́kun láti máa tako àwọn tó bá òun jẹ́.
en: Ajasasa said that he will not stop opposing those who are against him.

yo: Òṣèlú àti ìjẹ̀lú jẹ́ ohun ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, kò yẹ ká dà wọ́n pọ̀.
en: Politics and fame are different things, we should not mix them together.

yo: Àwọn olówó kan wà ní ilé ayé yìí tí a kò lè díwọ̀n owó o wọn.
en: There are some rich people in this world whose money cannot be measured.

yo: Ọjọ́ ọdún àwọn ìmọ̀le ti ń kanlẹ̀kùn, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni ìparí ọdun ń súnmọ́.
en: The day of the year of lights is knocking, so the end of the year is approaching.

yo: Ẹni tí ò bá lérò, tí ò létò, ò lè jẹ́ olóríi tiwa.
en: A person who does not think, who is not organized, cannot be our leader.

yo: Àwọn ọmọdé wọ̀nyí lè mú òfun èèyàn bẹ́ níbi àìgbọràn.
en: These children can take the human gift of disobedience.

yo: Ṣíṣe ìtẹnumọ́ fún nǹkan kan náà jẹ́ dandan fún ọlùkọ́ ilé ìwé.
en: Emphasizing the same thing is mandatory for the school teacher.

yo: Gbogbo ọjà tí ìyá àgbà rà ní àwọn adigunjalẹ̀ náà gbà lọ́wọ́ ọ wọn.
en: All the goods bought by the grandmother were taken by the robbers.

yo: Ilé iṣé àwọn ológun ní àwọn olóṣèlú kan fẹ́ yin àdó olóró lásìkò ìbò.
en: The military office has some politicians who want to use poison during the election.

yo: Àwọn agbẹjórò ní ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀ṣun ní àwọn yóò kọṣẹ́ sílẹ̀ fún oṣù díẹ̀ ná.
en: Lawyers in the state of Oshun will be out of a job for a few months.

yo: Èkìtì ní àwọn ọ̀mọ̀wé pọ̀ jù sí ní gbogbo ilẹ̀ ẹ Yorùbá lápapọ̀
en: Ekiti has the most scholars in the entire Yoruba country

yo: Májèlé ní àwọn obìnrin tí ó máa ń ti ọmọ sí ọkùnrin lọ́rùn jẹ́.
en: Women who strangle children to men are poisonous.

yo: Ìdàrúdàpọ̀ ló ń wáyé jùlọ nínú òṣèlú láti ọjọ́ tó ti pẹ́.
en: There has been a lot of confusion in politics since a long time ago.

yo: Àgbàdo ní ohun ọ̀gbìn tó pọ̀ níta ní báyìí nítorí àsìkò o rẹ̀ ni a wà.
en: Maize has a lot of crops outside now because we are in the dry season.

yo: Olórin ni ọmọkùnrin tí àwọn ará ibí kó bá wọn kun ilé e wọn.
en: A musician is the boy that the local people take with them to fill their house.

yo: Gbajúmọ olórin ní òun kò jẹ̀bi ẹ̀ṣùn-un fífi ipá bá ọmọdé lòpọ̀
en: The famous musician is not guilty of the charge of having sex with a child

yo: Ariwo ti pọ̀ jù ní àdúgbò yí pẹ̀lú u bí kò ṣe jẹ́ ìgboro.
en: The noise is too much in this area with him if it is not a street.

yo: Àwọn jàǹdùkú yin ìbọn fún àwọn èèyàn inú ọkọ̀ tí à ń wí nítorí owó.
en: The mob shot the people in the car that we were driving for money.

yo: Ọkọ̀ òfurufú ni wọ́n fi gbé ọ̀daràn tó pa obìnrin kan lọ sí Èkó.
en: The criminal who killed a woman was taken to Lagos by plane.

yo: Kò sí ìwé ẹ̀rí fun olùdíje tí àwọn ẹgbẹ́ onígbàálẹ̀ fà kalẹ̀.
en: There is no certificate for the candidate issued by the parties.

yo: Gbogbo àwọn olùdíjẹ̀ inú ìdìbò o tí ọdún tó ń bọ̀ yí ló ti dàgbà gan.
en: All the candidates in next year's election have grown up.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́́ ní àsìkò ti tó kí àwọn arawọn ṣe ìjọba.
en: The youths have enough time to make themselves the government.

yo: Ilé ẹjọ́ dá ẹjọ́ ikú fún ọkùnrin tó pa ìyàwó o rẹ̀ ní ilé ẹjọ́ àgbà Èkó.
en: The court sentenced the man who killed his wife to death at the Lagos High Court.

yo: Àkíyèsí ti wà lórí i pé iye àwọn obìnrin pọ̀ gidi gan ju àwọn ọkùnrin lọ.
en: It has been noticed that there are more women than men.

yo: Ohun pàtàkì ni kí obìnrin mọ iná dá, ṣùgbọ́n kò yọ ọkùnrin náà sílẹ̀.
en: It is important for a woman to create fire, but it does not free the man.

yo: Ìròrí àwọn ọmọ tálákà ni pé àwọn ọmọ olowó ò kí ń lè dá ǹkan ṣe.
en: The problem of poor children is that rich children can't do things.

yo: Adéọlá sùn kalẹ̀ nítorí kò fẹ́ tẹ̀lé ìyá àgbà padà lọ sí ìlé.
en: Adeola fell asleep because she did not want to follow her grandmother back home.

yo: Ẹmu ní ọti tí púpọ̀ àwọn àgbàlagbà má ń mu ní agbègbè Ìbàdàn.
en: Alcohol is alcohol that most adults do not drink in the Ibadan area.

yo: Ajiḿọ̀bi gba Mákindé nímọ̀ràn láti gbáradì fún iṣẹ́ tó wà níwájú u rẹ̀.
en: Ajimobi advised Makinde to prepare for the task ahead of him.
